title: Graduate Software Engineer
description:
The Opportunity

We are a seeking talented Graduate Software Engineers to join the Boeing Defence Australia Graduate Program in Brisbane. This program offers graduates a permanent full-time position, providing a solid career foundation from day one.

Graduate opportunities are across a range of engineering business units at Boeing which include:

E-7A Wedgetail - The centrepiece of Australia's national air defence capability, incorporating powerful airborne surveillance, communications and battle management capability.
MQ-28 Ghost Bat - Development and integration of mission systems for uncrewed teaming aircraft designed to be a force multiplier in support of advanced multi-mission air combat operations.
Sustainment Operations - Maintenance, repair, overhaul and upgrades of military aircraft including F/A-18F Super Hornets, CH-47F Chinooks and P-8A Poseidons, as well as training design and delivery.
Joint Systems - Design, development and sustainment of defence communications systems and networks.

As a Graduate Software Engineer¬†you will:

Contribute to the development, modification and integration of mechanical products including mounting hardware, packaging solutions and thermal management solutions.
Contribute to the design, modelling and analysis of mechanical products and systems using 3D CAD, FEA and CFD tools.
Contribute to the development of engineering documentation and support configuration management of system hardware.
Communicate and collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team in a conscientious and inclusive way to successfully deliver innovative solutions to the Australian Defence Force.

Your attitude, motivation, willingness to learn and ability to self-task under supervision will determine your success in our team!

Education

Tertiary degree qualification in an engineering, computer science or information technology (or anticipated graduation before July 2025)

Eligibility

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet Defence security requirements.

How to apply

Please submit your CV together with a cover letter and your university transcript to be considered.

Our Graduate Program

Our 24-month Graduate Program is designed to equip you with essential skills for a successful transition into full-time work, while also fostering your growth into an experienced professional. Throughout the program, you will engage in professional learning and development, as well as social and collaborative opportunities to expand your Boeing network.

While the Graduate Program has defined learning objectives and a structured framework, your individual journey will be tailored in collaboration with your manager, shaped by business needs and your personal professional development goals. To enhance your exposure and learning, you will remain within one business unit for the entire duration of the program, allowing you to immerse yourself in team dynamics and project work. Over these 24 months, you will not only acquire the technical skills necessary for your role but also develop the interpersonal skills that are vital for a fulfilling career.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.¬† Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with an inclusive team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place.¬† From the seabed to outer space you can contribute to work that matters.¬† We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth.¬† Find your future with us.

As an equal opportunity employer, female candidates, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

Benefits

Cutting edge projects
Flexible working options
Discounts for travel and accommodation
Salary packaging options
Health and wellbeing benefits
Study assistance

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader, click Apply Now.

Applications Close:¬†Wednesday 30 April 2025

¬†

¬†

title: Software Developer
description:
Join the revolution in workforce management.

foundU is Australian-grown and managed, home to 70+ passionate people who are committed to accelerating the success of Australian businesses.

We've created a platform that streamlines recruitment, onboarding, rostering, timesheet management, payroll, and reporting for a seamless experience. We‚Äôre in the business of building things most people haven‚Äôt thought of yet. The pace is fast, and the work is challenging. We dream big, and we fight hard for customer ease.

As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing foundU software, enabling our clients to keep step with the ever-changing digital landscape.¬†

In this role, you will:

Assist Senior Software Developers with all aspects of software design and coding.

Write, maintain and test code as per your assigned tasks.

Ensure automated test coverage for your assigned tasks.

Monitor the technical performance of foundU‚Äôs systems.

Perform code reviews and provide feedback to your peers.

Collaborate with wider foundU team, leveraging foundU‚Äôs technology stack and making localised improvements.

Work with product managers, to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

Attend and contribute to all agile ceremonies within the foundU agile playbook.

Attend regular team meetings and interactions; providing feedback to leaders, escalating issues according to severity.

Maintain knowledge of the Australian HR, Payroll and Industrial Relations environments.

Our tech stack:¬†

VueJs, React Native, ES6+, Sass¬†

Storybook, Cypress, Jest, Webpack, etc.¬†

Laravel, PHP¬†

MySQL¬†

RESTful APIs¬†

Supporting Services¬†

AWS(EC2, Aurora,¬†Elasticache, WAF, ALBs, ECS, Lambda, Elasticsearch, etc.)¬†

Do you have the foundU DNA?

Our people come from all walks of life - we‚Äôve got hipsters and geeks, nurses, and restaurateurs. But the one thing that binds us is a glass-half-full, sleeves rolled up, can-do mentality.

We are looking for someone with:

A Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field.

Knowledge of the software development life cycle.

A desire to work in a fast-paced environment.

The ability to develop unit testing of code components or complete applications.

Experience as a full-stack developer and understand concepts of software engineering.

Experience working on a variety of software development projects.

Deep programming language knowledge.

You‚Äôll get bonus points if you have:

A knack for creative problem solving.

Knowledge of Australian HR/Payroll.

Apply now to be a part of our empowering and supportive culture where everyone makes a difference.

Why join foundU?

Work

We are passionate about promoting from within. We prioritise the development and growth of our team members through up-skilling, cross-training, and maximising their potential. Diversity is celebrated and we strive to foster a culture of inclusiveness for all members of our team.

People and Culture

We‚Äôve cultivated a collaborative team culture where everyone's voice is heard and valued. We are committed to growth and improvement, embracing feedback and suggestions with an open mind. We always strive to enhance what we do and how we do it.

Benefits

An established flexible work policy - ‚ÄòWork Anywhere, Anytime‚Äô. We encourage our teams to settle on the mix of office vs working from home time that suits them.

A bonus week of annual leave after every 12 months at foundU.

Monthly ‚Äòpocket money‚Äô to purchase anything that supports your working life ‚Äì such as training courses, an office chair or even a team lunch.

Free coffee from the local caf√© while working from the office.

Dog friendly office

We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply for roles at foundU, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application. We will partner with you to identify the best way to assist you through our recruitment process.

¬†

Want to learn more? Visit the links below!

www.foundu.com.au

www.foundu.com.au/careers

www.linkedin.com/company/foundu/

¬†

We respectfully ask recruiters not to contact us regarding assistance with job vacancies. Your understanding is greatly appreciated. Thank you.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Our client, a Brisbane based software product start-up, is on the lookout for another software engineer to join their team to assist in the ongoing development and enhancement of their software products. This highly successful business has established itself in the market with it's cutting edge products.

Due to their ongoing success, they are in an organic growth stage and on the hunt for a solid software engineer with experience building complex software ideally in a scientific environment. When it comes to seniority, they are open to mid-level through to quite senior engineers.

Their tech stack is Python/Django & React but they are open to other tech stack experience.

You must have experience in

A minimum of 3 years of experience in full stack software development

Experience building complex software in a language like Python or C++

It is ideal if you have experience with:

Experience in building software using Python & Django

Building applications which process and display large amounts of data

Geospatial data

Database design

Front-end development (ideally using React)

This is a great opportunity to join a highly successful software product start-up with an exciting pipeline of work and well established, industry leading clients.

If this role sounds like you, then please don't hesitate to apply now.

title: Software Developer
description:
We are Metro South Health

We are the major public healthcare provider for Brisbane's south side, Logan, Redlands and the Scenic Rim. We operate five major hospitals and a range of community, specialty and state-wide healthcare services. We are renowned for teaching and research excellence.

We are truly dedicated people who care about our community. We come to work to make a difference. We save lives, changes lives and make the world a better place. We overcome the many challenges that come our way by going above and beyond and achieve the best possible outcomes by working together. We are bold, innovative, collaborative, inspiring.

We recognise our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we encourage people of all genders, ethnicities, ages, abilities, languages, sexual orientation and family responsibilities to apply.

We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace for our people and our community.

We are part of and proud of the community we serve. We are better together.

Join us at Metro South Health and be part of a world-class, dynamic and growing health service that embraces technology, excellence in health care, teaching, research and empowering our people to be the best in serving our community.

About the Role

The Software Developer position is within the Data and Analytics Team, Addiction and Mental Health Services (AMHS). The position has no direct reports and will be reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics Team.
This position is responsible for providing high level technical support to ensure AMHS applications meet organisational business needs.
Specific technical tasks include development and maintenance of AMHS applications, including existing SSRS, SSIS and .Net Batch Jobs, and Power Platform applications, deployment of applications to different environments and integration of in-house developed code with vendor packaged software.
Provide advice, recommendations and technical support regarding application development and processes including best practice code design, project structuring, performance, source control, data content and security, interface design and management of release strategies across all operating environments, in accordance with the approved incident management and system maintenance polices.¬†

Find out about the role in more detail and how to apply in the attached Role Description.

Our values of Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Engagement and Excellence, shape our culture within Metro South Health. Our values guide our day-to-day decision making and are fundamental to what we care about as a health service, how we behave, how we interact with each other and provide care to the many patients who come through our doors every day.

We offer rewarding career opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas across our health service and pride ourselves on providing a work environment that is safe, satisfying, flexible, and promotes a healthy work-life balance.

As a Metro South employee, you will benefit from a higher than standard employer contribution to Superannuation of up to 12.75%, access to salary packaging, flexible working arrangements and competitive salary rates with annual incremental increases.

You can find out more about why it's so great to work at Metro South here: www.metrosouth.health.qld.gov.au/join-our-team.

description:

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Take hold of a monster opportunity as a Senior Software Engineer in our Technology Delivery team. If you‚Äôre a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we‚Äôd love you to apply.

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role
We‚Äôre all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. Join Australian Retirement Trust (ART) as a Senior Software Engineer and play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and supporting our application solutions. In this role, you'll be instrumental in helping ART maintain its market-leading position by delivering top-notch application features that benefit our members. You'll work with industry-leading tools, technologies, and practices to ensure our solutions are not only functional but also easy to maintain and future-proof.

As a Senior Software Engineer at ART, you'll be responsible for developing and delivering solutions that align with our technical strategy. You'll assess, analyse, and implement changes based on requests, prioritise and diagnose incidents, and investigate problems to find effective remedies. Your expertise will be crucial in performing code and design reviews, preparing builds, and providing input on scheduling. Additionally, you'll mentor and train team members, promote a culture of continuous improvement, and occasionally work outside normal business hours to meet service levels. If you're ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

This role is available as a permanent opportunity.

About you
It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you‚Äôll tick some of the following boxes too:

Excellent problem solving, problem management and analytical skills.
High-level of interpersonal, both written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to negotiate, consult and liaise with business, technical and supplier personnel on complex and technical IT issues and to develop and present reports, submissions and recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Extensive experience at a Senior Level demonstrating expert level skills in Software development and proficiency in tools required for the Software Development of the platform team.
Proven ability to effectively plan, prioritise and manage activities to deliver IT services to meet Business expectations.
Relevant industry experience designing and developing in a medium to large financial organisation.
Knowledge of Solution Delivery Lifecycle methodologies (Waterfall & Agile), Release Coordination and quality assurance processes.
Ability to teach and impart knowledge coherently and effectively.
Demonstrated support experience with complex events processing and high throughput of transaction processing.

About us
Our 2.3 million members trust us to take care of almost $300 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you‚Äôll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now
Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close midnight Sunday, 27 April 2025.

We don‚Äôt want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you‚Äôll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you‚Äôve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us ‚Äì and recruitment is no different.

title: Software Engineer
description:
The Opportunity

Boeing Defence Australia is seeking Software Engineers to join the MQ28 Mission Systems team to develop a first of its type autonomous Collaborative Combat Aircraft. Based in Brisbane, you will work within a team developing cutting edge technologies and capabilities, fielded on real platforms.

Experience/Qualifications

Experience with Object-Oriented Design practices and familiarity with C++ and Python
Experience with Linux software development environments
Ability to respond to high level guidance to create a minimum viable product.
Knowledge and experience in the application of Agile Software Development principles
A passion for problem solving and a willingness to learn within a dynamic environment.
Tertiary qualification in Engineering (Software/Mechatronics), Computer Science or Information Technology

Desirable

Skills or domain knowledge in mission systems, electronic warfare, electronic sensors & sensor integration, messaging protocols and data exchange.
Familiarity with and ability to support software test and evaluation.

Eligibility

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

You may require a Foreign Work Authorisation (FWA) to commence in this position. Please refer to the Department of Defence website to understand your personal obligations.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. From the seabed to outer space, we have helped shape aerospace and defence innovations in Australia over the past 95 years.

In addition to a competitive salary, our employees benefit from flexible working options, global opportunities, salary packaging, performance incentives, study assistance, wellbeing programs and discounts on health insurance, travel and accommodation.

We're also committed to fostering an environment that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive for every employee, with great opportunities for professional growth.

As an equal opportunity employer, female candidates, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply. We are also open to candidates from other industries including mining, communications, ICT and oil and gas.

Benefits

Cutting edge projects
Flexible working options
Competitive remuneration and incentive plan available
Discounts for health insurance, travel and accommodation
Salary packaging options
Health and wellbeing benefits
Study assistance
Global opportunities

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader, click Apply Now.

title: Multiple Software Engineers
description:
Multiple Software Engineer Roles - Federal Government Projects

We are seeking multiple Software Engineers with a variety of experience and expertise, and a strong track record in delivering Federal Government projects.

Australian Citizens with a Baseline clearance are highly desirable for these roles.

Role / Responsibilities:

Work as part of a small specialist or multidisciplinary delivery team to deliver enterprise-class software solutions.
Participate in agile ceremonies including planning, estimation, and design sessions.
Write clean, testable, maintainable, and scalable code that meets stated acceptance criteria.
Collaborate with team members, stakeholders, and other delivery teams to achieve shared outcomes.
Develop and maintain technical documentation throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Participate in performance discussions and undertake additional duties as directed by the supervisor.
Work under limited supervision, following the department's delivery frameworks.
Supervise, support, and mentor less experienced developers.
Ensure alignment with CI/CD practices and modern development standards.
Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into working solutions.

Skills / Experience:

Strong experience with C#, .NET Core, and .NET versions 5-8.
Experience with .NET Framework and Microsoft Web API / REST architecture.
Solid understanding of Vue3 and modern JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks (e.g. React, Angular, jQuery).
Familiarity with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap.
Experience with CA GEN and coding in R is desirable.
Demonstrated experience delivering IT systems using Microsoft Azure (e.g. App Service, Function App, APIM, Service Bus, Azure SQL).
Experience provisioning and managing cloud infrastructure and Azure Data environments.
Strong grasp of Infrastructure as Code and automation practices using Bash or PowerShell scripting.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, particularly using Azure DevOps.
Solid experience with SQL Server (2014 and later), with the ability to write and optimise SQL queries.
Experience with unit testing and automated UI testing.
Proficient with Git for source control.
Familiarity with development environments such as Visual Studio 2019/2022, Visual Studio Code, or JetBrains Rider.
Exposure to D365 and PowerApps is a plus.

To be considered for these roles, click APPLY now!

title: Software Engineer
description:
The Opportunity

We are looking for Software Engineers to support the Battlespace Communication System (BCS) Program. BCS is a next generation networking product that is the centerpiece for multiple projects and campaigns. The BCS combines both developmental and off the shelf hardware and software to provide world leading communications capability for ADF personnel. It can be rapidly deployed from anywhere, and its modular design provides a flexible, scalable solution that can be customized for various mission needs.

We have a range of opportunities available as we plan for future work. This role will see you applying your software skills to either our core product for Army, upgrading the capability to integrate with related maritime communications projects, or modernization of the joint air battlespace management system.

Our team has a unique culture, which prioritises innovation whilst maintaining a culture of flexibility and fun. We are collaborative, adaptable and outcome-focused. You'll find yourself working in an inclusive team, where people really matter. We work flexibly, with a hybrid in office/ work from home arrangement.¬†

Responsibilities

Contribute to the development of robust networking and communications software with a focus on cyber security, scalability and performance.
Design, development, integration and test of integrated hardware and software systems.
Write code to solve complex problems
Review pull requests, and provide constructive feedback
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback
The ability to communicate and collaborate with a diverse team, in a conscientious and inclusive way.

Experience/Qualifications

Essential:

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.
We invite a diverse range of people to apply, including people from outside of the defence industry.

¬†Desirable:

A tertiary qualification in engineering or related technical field
Experience within Defence or complex engineering project environments
Backend or frontend software language and open-source package knowledge (Python, Javascript, C programming, and UI design) are highly desirable.
Experience in building secure applications in a Linux environment
Can take part in all aspects of the software development lifecycle with an agile mindset.
IP networking protocols and implementation of network security

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force.¬† As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.¬† Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place.¬† From the seabed to outer space you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values.¬† We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth.¬† Find your future with us.

Benefits

Flexible working options
Study assistance
Salary packaging
Employee Incentive Program
Global opportunities

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.¬† Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader, click¬†Apply Now.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
About the role

Join our team as a Senior Software Engineer and contribute to the development of a cutting-edge long-horizon mine plan optimization application. Solving the largest problems of its type in the world, this feature-rich .NET desktop application, built with DevExpress and Gurobi, handles complex code and large datasets, emphasizing software performance. Be part of a dynamic team that drives innovation and efficiency in the mining industry.

Responsibilities

The Senior Software Engineer will be an integral part of an Agile team, implementing requirements using the best technical solutions available and solving complex technical problems that other team members may encounter.

Be well informed of the latest technologies and trends in software development in order to develop well engineered results and be proactive in proposing newer and more advanced technical strategies and solutions.

Design and develop new features for our products.
Implement requirements using the best technical solutions available.
Solve complex technical problems that other team members may encounter.
Stay informed of the latest technologies and trends in software development.
Actively participate in Agile ceremonies and peer code reviews.
Collaborate with the broader Digital Products team and other relevant business stakeholders.
Participate in architectural, design, and product/process discussions.
Mentor Junior Developers and contribute to the inclusive and high-performing culture of the team.

About you

If you meet some of these requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a relevant professional qualification.
Minimum of three to five years of relevant experience.
Solid understanding of modern software practices including CI/CD and DevSecOps.
Advanced knowledge in C#, LINQ, automated unit tests (MSTest/NUnit/XUnit), and WinForms.
Strong knowledge in .NET Core, MVC, MS SQL, NLog, Fluent Assertions, Trunk-based development, Azure DevOps.
Experience with test-driven development (unit testing).
Good understanding of concurrency and threading models in .NET.
Database integration and development (SQL, NoSQL).
Version control system experience (TFS/GitHub/GitLab).
Strong knowledge of principles and patterns (SOLID, dependency injection), quality standards.
Excellent communication skills.
Experience in Agile processes, including estimation and planning.

Desirable

Knowledge of mathematical optimization technique such as Mixed Integer Programming (MIP) with experience with MIP solvers such as Gurobi, FICO Xpress, CPLEX, SCIP, or CBC
Experience writing performant C++
CAD, 3D graphics, and integration with existing mining CAD packages (such as Vulcan).
Entity Framework Core.
Parallel and high performance computing
Mine planning optimization (short and long term models)
Prior experience with Azure and Azure DevOps.
Exposure to statistical analysis using tools such as R or Python
React, JavaScript, TypeScript development

About Rio Tinto

Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive.

We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs ‚Äì striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. But we can‚Äôt do it on our own, so we‚Äôre focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win-win situations and meet opportunities.

Every Voice Matters

At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome ‚Äì they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you a passionate Software Engineer with a focus on C++ looking to make a real impact in the world of AI? Athena AI, a cutting-edge Defence Technology company at the forefront of artificial intelligence innovation, is seeking a highly skilled Software Engineer to join our dynamic team in Brisbane.

As a Software Engineer at Athena AI, you'll work alongside a talented group of engineers, data scientists, and product managers to develop high-performance software solutions that power our AI innovations. If you‚Äôre ready to take your career to the next level and work on projects that push the boundaries of technology, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy robust software applications using C++.
Build high-performance, scalable, and maintainable code for production systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data scientists, machine learning engineers, and product managers.
Implement end-to-end software development lifecycles‚Äîfrom design and coding to testing, deployment, and maintenance.
Develop and execute comprehensive QA and testing strategies to ensure software quality and reliability.
Own specific parts or features: Take full ownership of designated software components from ideation through deployment, ensuring they meet performance, quality, and maintainability standards.
Participate in code reviews, enforce coding standards, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes.
Research and apply the latest software development techniques and best practices.
Communicate technical details effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

About You:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience in software development with a strong focus on C++.
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and design patterns.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to overcoming challenges.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
Desirable: Familiarity with edge deployment on NVIDIA Jetson and Qualcomm platforms.
Desirable: Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools such as Jira.
Desirable: Experience with algorithms and backend development.
Remuneration & benefits
Excellent professional development working within Athena's Software Team and exposure to world class computer vision technologies
Competitive salary range
AGSVA clearance to baseline or NV1 included for the right applicant¬†
Information for applicants

To apply for this opportunity, please submit your resume and a cover letter briefly explaining why you are the right candidate for this position with Athena ¬†AI.¬†

We encourage candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences to apply, even if you feel you may not meet all the selection criteria. ¬†At Athena AI, we value the unique perspectives and skills that each candidate can bring to our team.¬†

Note that due to the nature of our projects, YOU MUST BE AN AUSTRALIAN CITIZEN to be considered for this position. ¬†Our roles require an Australian Government Security Clearance, or the ability to obtain one. Security clearances may only be granted to Australian citizens. Applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.¬†

We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our innovative and passionate team.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer, South Bank - QLD
description:
At Flight Centre Travel Group (FCTG) our purpose is to¬†'open up the world for those who want to see'. Every day, we give people all around the world the opportunity to experience something really amazing ‚Äì travel!¬†

As the Full-Stack Engineer in Enterprise Technology Services (ETS), our global technology team, you'll be responsible for backend design, build, testing¬†and release across multiple streams.¬†¬†Focusing on backend systems with occasional work on the frontend. You'll craft high-quality software that is user-friendly, resilient, scalable, maintainable, and adds value for customers.¬†¬†

If you have demonstrated practical experience of development, backed by a deep understanding of good¬†software engineering practices we encourage you to apply!

¬†

A day in the life

Build efficient, testable, and maintainable solutions with the right balance between solving the problem at hand and not over engineering your solution
Work across the entire stack and help transition our applications to a cloud native, containerized, clustered, micro-services architecture¬†
Write backend code in Java and the Spring Framework¬†
Write frontend code in TypeScript, JavaScript, and the React Framework
Write database scripts in T-SQL and PL/SQL
Collaborate in our cross-functional pillars to plan and deliver high quality solutions in a fast-paced, agile environment
Take initiative and always look for ways to improve the quality of our solutions, code bases, technical debt, standards, processes, and best practices
Own the quality of what we build, through testing, test automation, and observability to ensure operational reliability and performance
Maintain and improve the documentation across our code bases, architectures, and knowledge bases
Be a participant in the global engineering community and improve our practice across the company

¬†¬†

You'll be perfect for the role if you have

title: Software Engineer ‚Äì Cloud and AI Development
description:
Background¬†¬†

Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and driven to create innovative solutions in biomedical science? Join our dynamic, rapidly growing team to support software development for our groundbreaking Gelomics cloud platform.¬†

Gelomics is revolutionising biomedical research through the development and commercialisation of advanced 3D cell and tissue culture technologies. Our products offer ethical, cost-effective, and predictive alternatives to traditional animal testing, empowering researchers and pharmaceutical companies to accelerate drug discovery and development.¬†

¬†

The Role¬†

To apply, please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and interest in the role.¬†

As a Software Engineer at Gelomics, you will play a pivotal role in building and scaling the Gelomics cloud platform. In collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, you will be responsible for developing and deploying cloud infrastructure, machine learning and AI models, and user-centric applications enabling scientists worldwide to plan, execute, and analyse experiments seamlessly.¬†

¬†

Key responsibilities¬†

Cloud Infrastructure Development: Develop and maintain a scalable and secure cloud environment tailored for high-performance biomedical applications and machine learning workflows.¬†
AI/ML Model Development: Develop and optimise machine learning models leveraging experimental data to enhance predictive analytics and decision-making capabilities.¬†
User Application Development: Design and implement intuitive web-based applications allowing end-users to efficiently plan, execute, and analyse biomedical experiments.¬†
Data Pipelines and Integration: Establish robust and efficient data pipelines ensuring seamless integration and real-time processing of experimental data.¬†
Cybersecurity and Compliance: Implement robust cybersecurity measures and data protection frameworks compliant with global data privacy regulations, such as ISO 27001, 27017, 27018, and 27701.¬†
Continuous Improvement: Regularly refine software based on user feedback, real-time performance metrics, and emerging technological advancements.¬†
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive technical documentation and provide regular updates on development milestones and outcomes.¬†
Collaboration: Work closely with internal multidisciplinary teams including hardware engineers, scientists, quality management, and external consultants to ensure cohesive product integration.¬†

¬†

Qualifications, Skills and Experience¬†

Educational Background: Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field is required.¬†¬†
Required Experience: Proven track record in cloud infrastructure development, machine learning implementation, and application development (frontend and backend). Experience in biotech or life sciences industries is preferred but not essential.¬†
Technical Skills: Demonstrated proficiency in Python, JavaScript, or other relevant programming languages; familiarity with cloud services (Azure, AWS, or GCP), machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), and web application frameworks (e.g., React, Angular).¬†
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills, ability to handle complex datasets, and capability to troubleshoot technical issues effectively.¬†
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to clearly document and communicate complex processes and systems.¬†
Motivation: Self-driven, results-oriented, capable of managing projects independently while collaboratively engaging with diverse teams.¬†

¬†

Compensation

Salary range: $75,000 - $85,000 + Superannuation.¬†
Opportunity to participate in the Gelomics Employee Share Option Plan (ESOP).¬†
Opportunities for career growth and salary progression based on performance and company expansion¬†

¬†

About Gelomics¬†

Recognised as the 2024 KPMG Tech Innovator in Australia, Gelomics is a rapidly growing biotechnology startup pioneering the future of biomedical research and drug development. Our cutting-edge 3D cell and tissue culture technologies provide ethical, cost-effective, and predictive alternatives to traditional animal testing, enabling researchers and pharmaceutical companies to accelerate drug discovery with greater accuracy and reproducibility.¬†

At Gelomics, we are driven by innovation and committed to transforming preclinical research through advanced biomaterials, AI-powered analytics, and high-performance cloud solutions. Join our mission-driven team of scientists, engineers, and industry professionals to create impactful solutions for global biomedical challenges.¬†

Gelomics is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive and collaborative workplace.¬† ¬†

¬†

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:

Provide technical guidance to engineering teams, mentoring developers on Identity best practices in .NET and Microsoft platforms.¬†

Work closely with developers, testers, and business analysts to refine acceptance criteria, write Gherkin- based test scenarios, and integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines.¬†

Microsoft .NET & Backend Development (ASP.NET, C#)¬†
Cloud & DevOps (Microsoft Azure, CI/CD with Azure DevOps)¬†
Security & Compliance (ACSC Essential Eight, OWASP)¬†
Architecture & Integration (SAP, Dynamics 365, ITSM)¬†
Frontend & Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 compliance, DTA Digital Service Standard)¬†
Degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering.¬†


IMPORTANT TO NOTE:

SOS Recruitment is committed to the principles of workplace diversity and equity in employment and we encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with disabilities, women, people with family responsibilities, people with diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds, religious beliefs and LGBTIQ people.

title: Software Engineer
description:

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Our Team
COSOL is a global provider of end-to-end asset management solutions that enable asset-intensive organisations to get the best from their people, process, systems and data. We take a collaborative approach to problem-solving, applying our industry, technical and functional expertise combined with best-of-breed technologies to help our clients achieve asset and operational efficiency.
¬†
OnPlan is a COSOL owned technology company in the industrial maintenance space. We‚Äôve built a software platform that helps asset managers standardise and automate processes, maintain institutional knowledge, improve reliability, reduce downtime and work safely.
The Role
¬†
The Senior Software Developer position is an exciting role with OnPlan Technologies - a leader in the mining services industry, delivering enterprise software to big name mining clients and more. This role is a part of a capable development team. Duties include designing, developing, and implementing end to-end software elements as part of our digital technology solutions.
¬†
You can expect your role to also involve:

Technical Leadership - Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior/ mid level developers, and QA / non-technical personnel. Lead by example in coding practices, problem-solving, and by developing meticulous, polished solutions.
Conduct thorough code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices. Play the role of 'defender‚Äô in code reviews; assume new changes are hostile and consider all the ways they could break existing functionality.
Lead complex technical projects and contribute to technical decision-making
System Design & Architecture ‚Äì Design and implement system architectures that are flexible, scalable, and maintainable. Evaluate and implement new technologies and frameworks to improve system performance and functionality. Identify and resolve bottlenecks and other performance issues in the software and systems.
Quality Assurance & Testing - Write unit, integration, and performance tests as required to ensure the reliability and stability of software. Ensure that software meets high standards of quality and security. Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing software applications
Continuous Improvement - Continuously improve software development processes, practices, and tools. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in software development and relevant technologies. Propose and implement improvements to internal systems and development workflows. Project Management ‚Äì Manage the development and delivery of small projects by monitoring and mentoring a few junior and mid-level developers
¬†
What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

Experience in a similar role with an in-depth understanding of Asset Management
Expertise in relevant programming languages.
Full stack capabilities. Expertise in both front (web), and back-end development.
Strong understanding of database systems and best practices.
Strong knowledge of version control systems (git).
Understanding of security best practices and ability to develop secure software
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
Ability to communicate effectively with non-technical, and external stakeholders.
¬†
Interested?
¬†
Please send your CV / Resume following the link below to APPLY NOW.
To be considered, applicants must be eligible to work in Australia. Please note that COSOL will request reference checks, a police check and verification of your right to work in Australia as part of the recruitment process
COSOL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity in the workplace and aim to ensure that every employee and job applicant gets a fair go. Great people come from all walks of life, and we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Our client, a specialist in providing digital solutions to enhance governance and administrative outcomes, is seeking two experienced Full Stack Developers for a 6-month engagement. You will be working in a hybrid environment, with flexible working opportunities allowing you to work from home for 2 days and spend 3 days in the office. The company's unique cloud-based product is a full lifecycle management software designed to reduce administrative burdens and increase social outcomes.

Specialist in digital solutions for governance and administrative outcomes
Unique cloud-based product offering full lifecycle management
Flexible working opportunities with a hybrid work environment

What you'll do:

As a Full Stack Developer, you will play an integral role in our client's dynamic team, contributing to the development of new features and the deployment of serverless technology models. Your strong proficiency in Java will be crucial for backend development, while your expertise in Angular will drive frontend development. You will utilise your extensive experience with AWS services to develop and deploy serverless technology models. Your proven track record in developing new features from scratch will be highly valued. Working closely with other team members, your collaboration and communication skills will ensure the successful delivery of projects.

Develop backend solutions using Java.
Utilise your expertise in Angular for frontend development.
Leverage extensive experience with AWS services, including the development and deployment of serverless technology models.
Take responsibility for developing new features from scratch.
Efficiently deploy serverless tech models.
Collaborate and communicate effectively within a team structure.

What you bring:

As an ideal candidate for this Full Stack Developer role, you bring a wealth of experience and a set of key skills that make you stand out. Your strong proficiency in Java underpins your ability to handle backend development tasks, while your expertise in Angular enables you to take on frontend development challenges. Your extensive experience with AWS services is crucial for the development and deployment of serverless technology models. You have a proven track record in developing new features from scratch, demonstrating your innovative thinking and problem-solving abilities. Your excellent collaboration and communication skills enable you to work effectively within a team structure, contributing to the successful delivery of projects.

Strong proficiency in Java for backend development.
Expertise in Angular for frontend development.
Extensive experience with AWS services.
Proven track record in developing new features from scratch.
Ability to deploy serverless tech models efficiently.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills.

What sets this company apart:

Our client specialises in providing digital solutions that enhance governance and administrative outcomes, particularly within the fund management and social impact sectors. They offer a unique cloud-based product - a full lifecycle management software designed to reduce administrative burdens and increase social outcomes. This is a company that values innovation, collaboration, and the delivery of high-quality digital solutions. They offer flexible working opportunities, with a hybrid work environment that balances the benefits of both remote and office-based work.

What's next:

Ready to take your Full Stack Developer career to the next level? Apply today!

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply, please click "Apply" or contact Kate Samba on +61 7 3032 2211 or kate.samba@robertwalters.com.au for a confidential discussion.

title: Senior Software Engineer | Golang
description:
About the ABC

The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.

About the Role

Lead the development, maintenance and support of new and existing digital web-based products that align with ABC strategy and supports the achievements of Product & Content Technology‚Äôs objectives.

Key Accountabilities¬†

Provide superior technical development skills within ABC Digital Network‚Äôs Technology team, to develop high performance, secure and accessible digital products in an efficient manner across desktop, mobile and potentially other device groups.
Support the engineering leadership by providing development, guidance and support to colleagues.
Lead the analysis, design and development of particularly complex, re-usable components, and functionality for a broad range of uses across various ABC digital properties.
Produce and maintain a professional and comprehensive approach to documentation, including project documentation for ongoing reference purposes.
Deliver high quality product development within agreed time and budget constraints; and ensure efficient and effective use of resources.
Maintain a high level of awareness of best industry practices for web development, particularly in areas such as performance, security, SEO, and accessibility; and share this information with the team and wider business.
Continually improve the quality of output by developing or contributing significantly to the development of best practices and development standards.

About You¬†¬†

Relevant tertiary qualifications or extensive equivalent skills, knowledge and industry experience in web development is essential.
Outstanding back end (API development, database modelling and integration patterns) skills using Golang, with proven experience developing particularly complex workflows to meet needs of users from various cohorts.
Experience working with AWS services using an Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) approach, with the ability to provision infrastructure using CDK or Terraform.
Demonstrated detailed knowledge and experience in assessing, selecting and using modern frameworks, implementing automated/unit testing, and version control branching, merging and versioning strategies.
Demonstrated outstanding verbal and written communication skills with a strong ability to foster an open and creative approach both within and across teams.
Demonstrated significant experience providing technical leadership within a development team and establishing effective and strategic working relationships with other areas of the business.
Outstanding planning and task prioritisation skills with the proven ability to effectively plan and prioritise projects and tasks; while working under pressure to meet tight deadlines.
Experience working on editorial workflows in the digital media delivery space would be highly desirable.
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to solve particularly complex problems with methodical approach and attention to details.

What‚Äôs In It For You?¬†

Come and join the vibrant Digital Product department in the ABC. Our mission is to enable ABC‚Äôs digital future, where ABC transitions from a traditional broadcaster to Australia‚Äôs most trusted and valued digital media organisation. Through harnessing our talents in digital, collaborating with our partners and delivering beyond expectations, we ensure the ABC not just remains relevant but thrives.

As a group of product and platform teams, we develop and maintain the ABC's audience facing digital products across mobile, connected TV, desktop, and smart speakers. Whether it is staying informed of the latest breaking news, bringing some great TV on ABC iview, streaming the Hottest 100 on the triple j app and website, or entertaining the kids with our ABC Kids app - the ABC's Digital Product offerings are some of Australia's most loved and most used platforms.

Your work will be appreciated by millions of audiences across Australia. We are an open and cohesive team where your voice will not get lost. You can get a sneak peek into our product engineering world through our blog: https://www.abc.net.au/digital-product

We are committed to career development and invest in our people to grow and become leaders in their fields. Everyone in the Digital Product department has a designated budget for training and development. We believe in flexible approaches to working and building self-organising and collaborative teams that offer friendly and supportive environments in which all team members can strive and grow.

For further information on this position please contact Jamie Nedved, Digital Talent Acquisition Lead via email¬†nedved.jamie@abc.net.au¬†¬†

We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.

In line with our focus on¬†diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce

For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to¬†Life Page¬†on ABC LinkedIn.¬†

For more information on working at the ABC¬†visit¬†abc.net.au/careers

¬†

title: Software Engineer
description:
About us

aXcelerate is a leading SaaS provider, with our Student and Learning Management System powering millions of learners' course and competency records nationwide. As an industry leader, we‚Äôre on an exciting growth journey, transforming the way training providers and employers manage and support their learners.

Recognised as a Great Place to Work for two years running, we have a culture where people feel valued and supported to thrive. With ambitious growth plans and countless opportunities to develop your career, there‚Äôs never been a better time to join our team and help us shape the future of education technology.

The role:

As a Software Engineer you would hit the ground running and be part of our dynamic engineering team who fuel the aXcelerate system. Your core focus will be on developing high-quality and secure software. Collaborating effectively with an agile team, you'll be working with other juniors, seniors and team leads. At aXcelerate you will have the opportunity to shape the technology and systems that underpin our product.

Our Brisbane-based office offers hybrid work options however we welcome applications from remote candidates within Australia.

Responsibilities

Drive complex projects across teams from technical design to launch.
Foster a collaborative and best-practice culture, promoting code reviews, unit testing, automated testing, operational excellence and knowledge sharing within your engineering team.
Ensure you and your team are balancing technical debt and product development activities and identify opportunities for improvement.
Stay updated on emerging technologies, prototyping and implementing innovative solutions with a focus on reliability, security, performance, and cost.
Build quality relationships to influence and motivate others within engineering, product and design teams.
Use critical thinking, suggest solutions based on industry best practices to tackle complex architecture challenges.
Mentor and coach junior and mid-level developers, fostering their professional growth and sharing knowledge within the team.

About you

3 -5 years experience developing full-stack demonstrating proficiency in various technologies.
Demonstrated commercial experience with frontend development frameworks React OR React Native and TypeScript.
Demonstrated commercial experience with crafting backend services, APIs and serverless functions utilizing frameworks such as Node.js OR Java, Spring Boot, ColdFusion.
Highly proficient with Git.
Experience in preventing, identifying, resolving, customer facing issues in a timely manner.
A proactive approach to learning new technologies, coupled with a genuine curiosity to stay abreast of the latest trends and advancements in software development and technologies.
Experience with containerisation and serverless technologies in AWS (desirable).

What‚Äôs on offer

Hybrid or remote working opportunity.
A central location, close to public transport, cafes and shops, with free on-site parking available.
A vibrant, supportive and team-oriented culture, with regular team activities and social events.
A focus on professional development and learning, with access to our LMS, external and internal training opportunities and your own personal annual PD budget.

title: Junior Full-Stack Developer
description:
About Us

The Australian Blockchain Association (ABA) is a membership-driven organization committed to supporting the responsible development of blockchain technology and cryptocurrency adoption in Australia. ABA combines education, advocacy, and innovation to deliver tangible value to its members.

We‚Äôre proud to call Teneriffe home, with our office located in a vibrant area surrounded by cafes, the Brisbane River, and a creative community. At ABA, we foster a collaborative and supportive work culture, where innovation thrives, ideas are valued, and employees enjoy flexible arrangements to maintain a healthy work-life balance.

Our key initiatives include:

Developing a member portal with integrated dashboards featuring dynamic graphs and real-time metrics to empower data-driven decisions.

Launching a secure, low-cost cryptocurrency exchange designed for retail users, emphasizing transparency and regulatory compliance.

Providing high-quality, accredited training and resources to foster financial literacy and responsible participation in the digital economy.

Role Overview

As a Full Stack Developer at ABA, you will play a pivotal role in designing and developing the technical foundations for our members portal and cryptocurrency exchange. Your contributions will directly support our objectives of fostering financial literacy, providing industry-leading resources, and driving community engagement.

If you‚Äôre skilled in MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js, and thrive in a dynamic environment with a great working culture, this is your opportunity to make an impact.

Key Responsibilities

ABOVE ALL ! Be a Self-Starter and Innovator

If you see something that you feel can be improved, speak up!

In the innovative blockchain space we are always looking to solve challenges and improve systems, processes or products.

Whilst the role is often project focused, there are always opportunities for all staff to develop their own projects if they are aligned with the broader businesses vision!

Portal and Platform Development

Design, develop, and implement a members portal featuring dynamic charts and real-time metrics tailored for crypto traders and enthusiasts.

Collaborate on the integration of the portal with our low-cost cryptocurrency exchange, ensuring seamless functionality and user experience.

Prioritize security, scalability, and performance in all development efforts.

Collaboration and Documentation

Work with ABA‚Äôs education and analytics teams to ensure the portal supports user-friendly financial literacy tools and data insights.

Create and maintain detailed technical documentation for the platform.

Security and Compliance

Implement best practices for data security, ensuring compliance with Australian regulatory requirements, including AUSTRAC guidelines.

Incorporate secure coding principles to safeguard sensitive data.

Continuous Innovation

Stay abreast of advancements in blockchain technology, analytics tools, and full stack development.

Suggest and implement enhancements to improve the platform‚Äôs reliability and user engagement.

Key Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field is highly regarded.

2+ years of experience in full stack development, with a focus on backend systems, APIs, and dynamic dashboard implementation.

Strong expertise in MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).

Familiarity with blockchain technology and on-chain analytics tools is a significant advantage.

Proficiency in secure coding practices, data protection, and regulatory compliance.

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Passion for blockchain technology, financial literacy, and innovation is highly valued.

¬†

title: Software Engineer
description:

The Software Engineer designs and develops software applications. They perform coding, debugging, testing, and troubleshooting throughout the application development process. ¬†

¬†

¬†

Why join Pax8?

Well here are a few points of how we value our greatest assets:

Connecting with our community is important ‚Äì which is why we have our donation matching program, DEI-B events, and our employee resource groups to ensure everyone feels at home at Pax8.

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Work with AI Procurement Technology

Work Directly With Product and Development Teams

Utilise Cutting-Edge AI Models and Tools

About the Opportunity

Zudello is seeking a meticulous and proactive QA Engineer to join our remote team. In this pivotal role, you will ensure the quality and reliability of our AI-driven procurement solutions. Collaborating closely with our development and product teams, you'll design and implement comprehensive testing strategies, encompassing both manual and automated approaches, to deliver exceptional software to our clients.‚Äã

About Us

Zudello is an Australian automation technology company specializing in using Machine Learning to extract data from disparate systems and documents, enabling end-to-end automation of business processes from Procurement to Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable. Our Software-as-a-Service platform is utilized by companies across various sectors, including Manufacturing, Hospitality, Health, and Not-for-Profit.‚Äã

What You'll Do

Manual and Automated Testing: Design and execute both manual test cases and automated test scripts to validate software functionality and performance.‚Äã

API Testing: Develop and perform comprehensive tests for our backend services using tools like Postman or ReadyAPI, ensuring robust and secure APIs.‚Äã

UI Testing: Create and maintain automated UI tests with frameworks such as Selenium or Playwright to validate user interfaces across multiple browsers and devices.‚Äã

Test Management: Utilize platforms like TestRail or Zephyr to organize test cases, track execution, and report on quality metrics.‚Äã

Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate testing into the development lifecycle, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality software.‚Äã

Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the enhancement of QA processes and tools, advocating for best practices in testing and quality assurance.‚Äã

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Proven experience in both manual and automated testing within agile environments.‚Äã

Proficiency with testing tools such as Postman, ReadyAPI, Selenium, Playwright, TestRail, or Zephyr.‚Äã

Strong understanding of software development life cycles and QA methodologies.‚Äã

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.‚Äã

Effective communication skills to collaborate with remote teams.‚Äã

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.‚Äã

Bonus Points:

Experience with ERP systems like NetSuite, Microsoft GP, MYOB Advanced, or Xero.‚Äã

Background in SaaS, system implementation, or workflow automation.‚Äã

What Do We Offer?

Hands-on experience applying the latest AI and automation tools in real business settings.‚Äã

Opportunity to grow your QA skill set within the SaaS industry.‚Äã

Collaborative team environment that values curiosity and initiative.‚Äã

Exposure to a broad range of industries, projects, and clients.‚Äã

The chance to influence how a fast-moving product is implemented and improved.‚Äã

At Zudello, we believe in potential over perfection.

If you're enthusiastic about quality assurance and eager to contribute to innovative solutions, we encourage you to apply‚Äîeven if you don't meet every listed requirement.‚Äã

Ready to make an impact?

Apply now and help us revolutionize finance operations through AI-driven solutions.

title: Software Engineer - Golang - Permanent
description:
About us

Blackmagic Design has built some of the most talked about products in the industry.

We create the world‚Äôs most advanced cameras, video editing products, video converters, routers, colour correctors, film restoration software and waveform monitors for the feature film, post production and broadcast industries.

What you code gets made for the world to use and see

¬†

About the team

The team is building a suite of cloud-based products from the ground up, focusing on quality and reliability.¬†

The team owns their products from the start and is responsible for seeing them through to full maturity.¬†

The new and upcoming products are comprehensive and rich experiences, packed with features, and will complement existing Blackmagic Design products, such as DaVinci Resolve 19.¬†

The team focuses on unlocking and facilitating collaborative and creative spaces for our users and aims to continue to do so with more cloud products coming soon.

About you

Working out of our Southbank offices¬†you‚Äôll work on building a new cloud service from the ground up.

Working within an AWS framework you will be able to¬† deliver highly level readable and maintainable code, help¬†make key architectural decisions and move our platform forward.

Taking submissions now for interviews beginning the week of the 22nd.

¬†What you create gets built here and used all over the world.


¬†

title: Senior Software Engineer

description:

title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)
description:

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
About Rockfield Technologies

Rockfield is a dynamic engineering technology firm delivering advanced computational modelling, innovative design, and comprehensive asset management services. With offices across Australia, we serve a wide array of industries from public infrastructure to heavy industry. Our expertise helps clients manage risk, boost efficiency, and extend the longevity of their critical assets. At Rockfield, we are committed to both technical excellence and strategic growth.¬†

Our Infrastructure Technology (InfraTech) division specialises in instrumentation, monitoring, data collection, and dashboard solutions for private and government clients across Australia.¬† Our software platform is crucial to our monitoring services, handling automatic data collection, processing, alarming, and visualization from on-site sensor networks. As we expand our client base, we are growing our development team to ensure the continued evolution and reliability of our platform.

Your Opportunity

Rockfield Technologies is looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a key part in maintaining and enhancing our software platform, with a strong focus on backend development and cloud infrastructure management. You will collaborate with engineers and developers to ensure the efficient operation, scalability, and ongoing evolution of our platform.

Key Responsibilities

Develop, maintain, and enhance our backend systems using Python3.
Manage and deploy applications on AWS, leveraging services such as Lambda, ECS, and others.
Work with relational and time-series databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB) to store and process measurement data.
Optimize system performance and scalability to support increasing data loads.
Occasionally assist in front-end development where needed, using Vue/React or similar technologies.
Design and maintain cloud infrastructure using AWS CDK.
Troubleshoot, debug, and provide technical support for deployed applications.
Collaborate with engineers, stakeholders, and clients to improve platform functionality and user experience.
On occasion assist with project related work such as data analysis or datalogger programming where needed.

Experience & Skills

We're looking for a driven and capable developer with a strong technical foundation and practical experience delivering robust, scalable applications. Ideally, you will bring:

5-10 years of experience in software development, full stack preferred.
Strong proficiency in Python3.
Hands-on experience with AWS services (Lambda, ECS at a minimum).
Experience deploying and managing applications on AWS.

To complement your core skills, experience in the following areas would be highly valued and help you hit the ground running:

Experience with FastAPI and SqlAlchemy (or similar ORM).
Knowledge of TimescaleDB (PostgreSQL) and database optimization techniques.
Experience with Vue.js/React or other frontend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS CDK for infrastructure management.
Background in data processing using Python libraries

About You

A self-motivated problem solver with a keen interest in structural monitoring and cloud technologies.
A collaborative team player who enjoys working in a small, agile team environment.
Detail-oriented and proactive in identifying and resolving system issues.
Passionate about software development and eager to contribute to meaningful projects.

What we offer

At Rockfield, we value our people and invest in their future. As part of our team, you will¬†benefit from:¬†

Be part of a collaborative and innovative team.
Work on impactful projects that contribute to structural integrity and safety.
Flexible work arrangements.
Competitive salary and benefits.
Opportunities for professional growth and learning.

This is a permanent position, and applicants must have unrestricted work rights in Australia.¬†

title: Fullstack Software Developer
description:
About Us:

Gallantree is a fast-growing investment firm, commercial securities issuer/manager, and investment

structured finance, and institutional investment. Our proprietary cloud-based platform integrates loan management, credit risk modelling, automation, and securitisation capabilities‚Äîbringing new levels of transparency, efficiency, and intelligence to commercial lending and capital markets.

landscape in Australia and beyond.

someone with solid experience across both front-end and back-end technologies who is ready to contribute
meaningfully to a modern, fast-moving product environment.


You‚Äôll be involved in developing user interfaces, APIs, automation workflows, and integrations across the platform.
Working closely with product and engineering leads, you‚Äôll help translate complex financial workflows into clean,
scalable, and efficient technology.

This is an exciting time to join the company as the growth phase will catapult Gallantree into becoming a leader of
the financial services community in APAC. Experience in financial services or structured finance is a plus, but not

Interest in finance, fintech, or enterprise platforms is a plus.

title: Python Developer
description:
Work with AI Procurement Technology

Work with the latest AI models and tools

¬†

About the Opportunity

About Us

Key Skills

Nice to Have

¬†

What do we offer?¬†

Work With Cutting-Edge AI: Leverage the latest AI models‚Äîincluding tools like Claude‚Äîto build intelligent, automated solutions that solve real business problems.

Competitive Compensation: Receive a salary that reflects your skills, experience, and the value you bring to the team.

Diverse and Impactful Work: Tackle a wide range of tasks and challenges across industries, making each day engaging and meaningful.

Professional Development: Grow your skills with ongoing training, exposure to modern technologies, and support from a highly skilled team.

Vibrant Office Environment: Work from our centrally located CBD office at Cathedral Square, Brisbane‚Äîclose to cafes, public transport, and city life.

Supportive Team Culture: Join a collaborative, ethical, and inclusive team that values your growth, encourages new ideas, and supports a healthy work-life balance.

¬†

At Zudello, there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate‚Äô.

Seeing all of these‚Äù ideal‚Äù requirements, as well as the list of responsibilities, can be daunting. We know this may cause you to ask yourself ‚Äúcan I do this?‚Äù We encourage you to apply if you feel this could be you, even if there are some gaps but you feel the role is the perfect role for you. We will help develop your skills and career as you grow and learn with us.

Your ability to demonstrate that you have the enthusiasm and real potential to develop the required capabilities, knowledge and experience to perform in this role is what we would like to hear from you.¬†
