title: Software Engineer ‚Äì 3D Graphics
description:
Our mission to be bold and impactful!

How you'll contribute

As a Software Engineer for the Aura team, you'll play a critical role in our Aura desktop product. Working with C++ to enhance the Aura application features, enabling Emesent customers to process, filter, and visualise 3D LIDAR point cloud data.¬†

Here‚Äôs what we need

Software Engineering:

Design, build, and maintain efficient and reliable code across the Aura stack¬†
Collaborate with UX/UI designers to create intuitive ways to interact with and visualise 3D point clouds¬†
Engineer new solutions to visualise large-scale data streamed from AWS¬†
Application state management and business logic¬†
Make improvements to architecture and tooling to accelerate and automate the software delivery processes.¬†
Enhance automated tests to reduce the overhead of software releases¬†

Technical Leadership:

Architect and implement complex end-to-end system solutions by collaborating with other teams within Emesent¬†
Participate in code reviews, maintaining high development standards¬†
Help grow our next generation of first-class engineers.¬†
Investigate and lead system improvements that improve our engineering efficiency¬†
Create and document technical designs for significant features.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:¬†

Work closely with product managers to scope new work and technically contribute to Product Requirement Documents¬†¬†
Communicate technical challenges and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.¬†
Work with engineering leadership to optimise architecture and processes to increase our delivery speed¬†

¬†

How you'll succeed

A good understanding of 3D rendering with experience in Unreal Engine¬†
Proficient with C++¬†
Understanding of spatial concepts and linear algebra¬†
Excellent problem-solving, organisational, and communication skills.¬†
Familiarity with Agile project management methodologies.¬†

Desirable experience:

Python and/or Typescript knowledge¬†
Testing Frameworks such as Robot Framework¬†
Knowledge of geospatial concepts and data formats.¬†
Familiarity with low-level rendering techniques and other frameworks.¬†
Experience with UI test frameworks and Jenkins.¬†

The added perks

Work alongside a friendly and passionate team on cutting edge technology! - We know that our success and growth is a result of our motivated and inspiring teams.
Take up our genuine learning and development opportunities.
Access to LinkedIn Learning platform.
Employee Assistance Program.
Qoctor, online telehealth
Settle into our great work environment and facilities.
Work in comfort with a casual dress code.
Flexible working.
1 full day of leave, each year for work anniversaries!

Who are we?

Emesent is a world leader in drone autonomy, LiDAR mapping, and data analytics. Our vision is to autonomously map the inaccessible. Founded in 2018, with deep connections to Australia's globally recognised CSIRO, we have established ourselves worldwide with a reputation for delivering high-quality data capture in the mining, infrastructure, survey, and mapping industries. Our team of 100+ roboticists, engineers, and business development experts work side-by-side to deliver revolutionary efficiency, safety, and operational insights to our customers.

Our flagship product, Hovermap, is a smart mobile scanning unit that combines advanced collision avoidance and autonomous flight technologies to map hazardous and GPS-denied environments. Its award-winning technology utilises innovative hardware, advanced algorithms, and machine learning to automate the collection and analysis of the physical world. Equally capable above ground or underground, indoors, or out, Hovermap is a complete mobile LiDAR mapping solution. Hovermap is uniquely versatile, it can be backpack, drone, or vehicle-mounted to map challenging, inaccessible areas enabling our customers to gain insights that were not possible before.

With multiple applications across several industries and a rapidly growing customer base, Hovermap and our other solutions are being used commercially for a variety of applications by enterprise customers around the world.

Why Emesent?

At Emesent, you will have the opportunity to work on ground-breaking technology that is shaping the future. We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, and opportunities for professional growth. Join us in our mission to push the boundaries of robotics and digitalisation to help humanity explore further and understand more.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Cubiko is looking for a senior software engineer to join our growing team. We‚Äôre a small software company that works with medical, dental and specialist practices to provide data analytics to doctors, nurses and practice managers in easy-to-understand dashboards. Our products help them run a successful business and drive patient outcomes.

For this role, you will be working on a mix of holistic platform improvements and stream-aligned development delivering value directly to our end users. As part of a cross-functional team involving data analysts, designers, engineers, and product managers, you will be able to build software to solve concrete problems for our customers and the business. With the broader engineering team, you will contribute to designing, maintaining, and evolving the systems that enable Cubiko to function now and into the future.

Cubiko is still at a size where a talented individual can have an outsized impact. At the same time, we care for and invest in our people and have a strong sense of camaraderie and shared enthusiasm for the work we do.

Depending on the strengths of the candidate, there may be space for the role to shape more into a leadership or management position.

Key skills

Write maintainable and robust software, with good test coverage.
Work on both clearly defined tasks as well as more complicated problems requiring requirements gathering, solution design, and experimentation.
Collaborate with fellow engineers, data analysts, product managers, designers, and subject-matter experts to develop software that delivers value to our customers.
Engage with partners and service providers as needed to develop our product and integrate with external systems.
Communicate effectively with the team to drive quality engineering practices and to share knowledge with fellow team members.

Requirements

Cubiko is a SaaS product comprising a full-stack web application, a data pipeline, integrations with various third-party systems and tools, and a set of cloud infrastructure. Our product is hosted on AWS and Kubernetes, and programmed in a mix of Clojure, Python, SQL, and Typescript. We don‚Äôt expect applicants to be familiar with the exact technical stack used at Cubiko. Instead we‚Äôre looking for:

Roughly 5 or more years of professional software engineering experience
Familiarity with any general purpose programming language (such as Python/Javascript/Java/etc.) and a willingness to learn
Familiarity with cloud computing

Hiring Process

As a small company, we value an efficient and transparent hiring process. As an engineering applicant this is what you can expect.

All applications will be initially read and reviewed by an engineer.
We‚Äôll set up a short phone screening over zoom to discuss cultural fit and make sure we‚Äôre all on the same page around timelines, salaries, and working environment.
We then schedule a technical interview in our offices with a handful of our engineering team. This is a chance for you to get to know some of the people you‚Äôd be working alongside, ask questions about what it‚Äôs like to work at Cubiko, and for us to assess your technical suitability for the role.
Finally we‚Äôll make a decision internally and get back to you.

Conditions

Cubiko handles Australian healthcare data. Because of this, you must
Reside in Australia, with a strong preference for Brisbane
Have full working rights in Australia, now and into the future
Be willing to do a police background check
Our development team vary in how much they work in the office or at home, ranging from one day a week to five, with three being typical. We have the flexibility and trust to support different working requirements, but aren‚Äôt currently looking for fully remote team members.
Direct applicants only, we are not currently accepting candidates from recruitment agencies.

Our Values:

We live these values every day.

One Team:‚ÄØAll for one, and one for all! We are a team that cares for and respects one another. We work in unison to deliver outstanding products, and we have fun doing it. We produce more than the sum of our parts.
Trust through Transparency: Building trust through transparency! We do this by being open, communicating regularly and having honest conversations ‚Äì we tell it how it is. We operate fluidly, and as one team.
Customer-centric: Our customers and community are at the core of what we do! We‚Äôre committed to helping‚ÄØmedical practices‚ÄØdeliver outstanding patient care and improving patient outcomes for individuals within their communities. We achieve this through constant customer communication and feedback‚ÄØallowing us to develop products our customers‚ÄØlove.
Question the conventional:‚ÄØAt Cubiko we don't place status on tradition or hierarchy when it comes to ideas. We all believe we have a responsibility to share our ideas, even if they differ from the norm. We‚Äôre always seeking ways to innovate and improve.

Life at Cubiko:

Flexibility and work/life balance
Personal learning & development
Free snacks, beer, wine & coffee
Standing desks and WFH equipment
Dog friendly - bring your dog to work
Monthly social events and annual retreats
End-of-trip facilities (showers, racks, etc.)

Diversity & Inclusion Commitment:

We're committed to growing and empowering an inclusive community. That's why we actively encourage applications from candidates from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. If you require accessibility assistance at any stage of the process, please let us know. We encourage applicants of all skill levels, do not feel obligated to meet 100% of the outlined requirements to apply.

title: AI Developer
description:
AI Developer ‚Äì Learn, Build & Deploy the Future of Automation¬†

Are you obsessed with AI and want to build real-world tools that make a massive impact?

What We‚Äôll Give You

Hybrid work ‚Äì office days + flexibility to work from home

Freedom to experiment, test, and ship your ideas

Opportunities to work on live AI projects that are rolled out across multiple businesses

A competitive salary, plus potential bonuses and long-term growth opportunities


About Us

We're a rapidly growing company using AI to transform how service businesses operate. We don‚Äôt just talk AI ‚Äî we build, launch, and scale real solutions that create measurable results. If you want to be at the cutting edge, work with a tight-knit and innovative team, and grow your career while doing meaningful work ‚Äî this is your moment.

title: Software Design Engineer
description:
Tell me about this role:

We are looking for Deputy Senior Design Engineer to join our team on a permanent basis. This role will be Brisbane based, supporting the assurance and verification of the software products related to the ARH.

This role offers uncapped training and development opportunities as well as other benefits including subsidised parking, flexible working and different leave arrangements including paid parental, study, reserve and volunteer leave.¬†


What will I be doing day to day?

Investigate aerospace software engineering concepts
Deliver and manage software engineering specifications and resources in support of Defence capability lifecycle
Investigate, analyse and report on software engineering defects and requirements
Undertake continuous improvement, with the ability to stay up-to-date on the latest software releases, updates, and best practices
Create and maintain technical documentation, including the Flight manual and technical note
Liaise with stakeholders to identify Issues and implement issue resolution
¬†¬†¬†¬†
What sort of skills do I need?

Tertiary qualifications in Aerospace Engineering, Software Engineering or related field
Experience in Defence Aerospace related projects
Strong communication skills
Process orientated with good attention to detail¬†
Australian citizenship and a minimum NV1 security clearance
¬†
What‚Äôs in it for me?

Flexibility - We like our employees to have the flexibility they need to live the lives they choose. With flexible working and remote working options.
Inclusion - We like our employees to feel safe bringing their whole self to work offering a number of programs promoting inclusion such as public holiday swap and 40/40/20, our vision for a gender inclusive workplace.
Benefits and Rewards - We have a competitive package of benefits and rewards including additional superannuation; flexible leave options; salary continuation insurance; professional certification bonus; employee discount program.
Exciting work ‚Äì Amentum is continually expanding our opportunities working on prominent defence projects across air, land and sea supporting the critical capabilities that keep Australia safe. We have a growing presence in cyber, space and nuclear programs.
¬†¬†
Why Amentum?

A trusted partner to Australian Government clients, Amentum is a major service provider for some of the most critical national security capabilities. We manage critical infrastructure and facilities and work on major projects in the land, air, maritime, cyber, space, nuclear and digital domains to support the Department of Defence‚Äôs multi-billion-dollar investment in enhanced capabilities.

With more than 880 engineers, project and program managers, training specialists, cyber security consultants, facilities operations experts, essential workers, logistics and technical trades in Canberra, Sydney, Melbourne, south-east Queensland, Central Australia, Townsville, Adelaide, Perth, Newcastle and Nowra, the business has built a reputation for excellence in quality, performance, innovation, value for money and safety by delivering multi-disciplinary expertise on large and technically challenging projects for more than 27 years.

People are our greatest asset and we value unique backgrounds, experience and perspectives.¬† Without our people we would not be where we are today, we therefore value our team as members of an exceptional organisation offering a wide array of benefits that go far beyond expectations.

Apply today to become a member and experience the many benefits and rewards that help us advance the future together. Please contact Jeremy Parkinson, jeremy.parkinson@global.amentum.com.

title: Software Engineer - C++
description:
Our mission to be bold and impactful!

How you'll contribute

We have an opening for an intermediate level software engineer within our Robotics Group. Depending on your skill set, there are opportunities to contribute to core frameworks and infrastructure, robot interfacing and integration, perception, path planning, high level autonomy, and testing and verification tools

Here‚Äôs what we need

Design, estimate and implement new software components.
Work with robotics domain experts to ensure high quality implementation and deployment of algorithms.
Be actively involved with the proposal and planning of new features.
Work on maintenance and improving software health.
Engage effectively with team members and other stakeholders.
Deliver high quality, high performance and well documented code.
Implement automated tests and develop manual testing procedures as appropriate.

Essential Qualifications and Skills

3 to 5 years of software engineering experience using modern C++.
Familiarity with software development in a Linux environment.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
A high level of self motivation.

Desirable Qualifications and Experience

Exposure to ROS, or other robotics frameworks
Experience with hardware interfacing or working on embedded systems
Experience working with git, Docker, CI tools, Python
Experience with GPU and/or parallel programming.
Experience in robotics related subjects e.g. SLAM, path planning, control, perception, state estimation
Exposure to modern software development practices (agile methodologies, continuous integration, etc.

The added perks

Work alongside a friendly and passionate team on cutting edge technology! - We know that our success and growth is a result of our motivated and inspiring teams.
Take up our genuine learning and development opportunities.
Access to LinkedIn Learning platform.
Employee Assistance Program.
Qoctor, online telehealth
Settle into our great work environment and facilities.
Work in comfort with a casual dress code.
Flexible working.
1 full day of leave, each year for work anniversaries!

Who are we?

Emesent is a world leader in drone autonomy, LiDAR mapping, and data analytics. Our vision is to autonomously map the inaccessible. Founded in 2018, with deep connections to Australia's globally recognised CSIRO, we have established ourselves worldwide with a reputation for delivering high-quality data capture in the mining, infrastructure, survey, and mapping industries. Our team of 100+ roboticists, engineers, and business development experts work side-by-side to deliver revolutionary efficiency, safety, and operational insights to our customers.

Our flagship product, Hovermap, is a smart mobile scanning unit that combines advanced collision avoidance and autonomous flight technologies to map hazardous and GPS-denied environments. Its award-winning technology utilises innovative hardware, advanced algorithms, and machine learning to automate the collection and analysis of the physical world. Equally capable above ground or underground, indoors, or out, Hovermap is a complete mobile LiDAR mapping solution. Hovermap is uniquely versatile, it can be backpack, drone, or vehicle-mounted to map challenging, inaccessible areas enabling our customers to gain insights that were not possible before.

With multiple applications across several industries and a rapidly growing customer base, Hovermap and our other solutions are being used commercially for a variety of applications by enterprise customers around the world.

Why Emesent?

At Emesent, you will have the opportunity to work on ground-breaking technology that is shaping the future. We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, and opportunities for professional growth. Join us in our mission to push the boundaries of robotics and digitalisation to help humanity explore further and understand more.

title: Software Solutions Architect

title: Senior Software Engineering - Product & Technology
salary: 5 weeks leave and own a part of Xero with shares!
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.¬†

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

¬†

Engineering @ Xero

We're hiring for multiple positions across Xero, with a focus on two key areas: Xero Product, where you will work to continuously improve the features of Xero software; Xero Platform, where you'll build and maintain critical applications and services consumed by teams throughout Xero globally.

We believe that a solid technical foundation and strong growth mindset are the keys to success in Software Engineering. You won‚Äôt find a long list of must-have tech requirements below!

Generally, if a team is creating a new code base, it may look like the following:

A microservice, written in C# on .NET

Utilising a variety of AWS services

Running in a Docker container, orchestrated by Kubernetes

Accessed by SPA written in React with TypeScript

Deployed with an automated CI/CD pipeline

Monitored by industry leading monitoring, alerting, tracing, and logging tools

¬†

What we look for in a Xero Engineer:¬†

Self-awareness and growth mindset

Openness to learning from failure

Honesty, transparency and encouraging of feedback

Teamwork, collaboration and mentorship

Customer and product focus

Commitment to supporting an inclusive culture and upholding Xero‚Äôs values

¬†

Life @ Xero

As an engineer at Xero, you‚Äôll be joining us on our mission to be one of the most sustainably excellent software engineering companies in the world! You‚Äôll have exposure to a variety of complex challenges at a global scale, whether it‚Äôs linking payments to different global markets, working on our world-renowned third party ecosystem or delivering solutions to small businesses around the world.¬†

¬†

At Xero you will...

Join an inclusive cross-functional team and collaborate with Product, Design and Engineering.

Use the latest engineering and software delivery practices, at scale.

Support your growth with various training and development resources, including the opportunity to become AWS certified.

Get involved with the Xero Mentorship Program, our many communities of practice and Employee Resource Groups such as Rainbow X, Parents @ Xero, Neurodiversity @ Xero and many more.

¬†

Why Xero

Offering very generous paid leave to use however you‚Äôd like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, free medical insurance, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, you‚Äôll do the best work of your life at Xero.

Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we‚Äôre immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully.¬†¬†At Xero we embrace diversity and inclusion and value a #challenge mindset.

Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single competency or experience . If you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be just the right person for this role and Xero. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application and throughout the interview process.

title: Software Developer
description:
A new permanent opportunity is currently on offer for a Software Developer specialising to join this well established, and reputable Queensland Brisbane CBD Based Organisation.

You will be undertaking several application support and software development tasks in a disciplined software development environment include the technical review of mission critical software with a view to ensure best practices in secure development are being applied.

The Software Developer will be tasked with developing and maintaining secure DevOps pipelines and cloud infrastructure for high availability cloud hosted applications. In addition you will be working closely with the Cyber Security team, ICT team, application specialists and vendors to ensure cloud security and infrastructure patches are triaged, prioritised and implemented by vendors in a timely manner.

Further to this, the key responsibilities of the Software Developer will be as follows:

Actively triage and resolve software incidents.
Develop, enhance and maintain application software in a complex environment.
Analyse, review and address change requests in a complex environment.
Ongoing enhancement and development of ISO270001 compliant documentation.
From time to time apply patches and releases outside of standard business hours and provide support on critical system issues.
Prepare releases and patches and apply to various environments.
Work collaboratively with other ICT staff, business support staff or external suppliers and vendors.
Technical leadership of cloud infrastructure and DevOps pipelines.
Ensures cloud infrastructure is resilient and secure, ensuring the smooth operation of high availability applications.
Oversee continuous improvement of cloud infrastructure and application hosting.
Review cloud consumption models and recommend economically effective and ‚Äúfit for purpose‚Äù cloud infrastructure deployment models.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of secure application development and deployment processes and procedures in accordance with organisational standards.
Keep abreast of the latest AWS cloud technologies that may be of benefit to the organisation and make requisite recommendations, supported by documentation, costing etc and present to senior management.
Coach applications developers on ‚Äúsecure by design‚Äù concepts and modern secure software development practices.
To be successful for this role, we are seeking highly experienced technology professionals;

Thorough understanding of the software development lifecycle and contemporary software development practices in a disciplined software development environment.
Experience with Cloud Technologies (AWS)
Aptitude and willingness to learn new skills.
Business application software development expertise and experience in one or more of the following:
o C
o WPF
o .Net Suite of Technologies
o SQL
An ability to lead and prioritise projects and tasks efficiently, and be flexible and able to adapt to changing expectations and requirements
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills with a focus on customer service and with an ability to work well as a member of a team delivering results
Ability to analyse problems and develop creative, sustainable and practical solutions.
Demonstrated experience in the following:
o DevOps and CI/CD pipelines
o Working collaboratively with application developers, cyber security specialists and vendors to achieve a highly resilient and secure cloud infrastructure environment for the hosting of mission critical applications
Cloud infrastructure design and administration
Interested applicants are strongly urged to apply online or reach out to Shameem Prinsloo at shameem.prinsloo@troocoo.com to discuss this position in further detail.

title: Mid-level Full stack .NET Developer
description:

description:

¬†

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
TUFLOW (www.tuflow.com) is a suite of off-the-shelf software products for modelling the flow of water and associated environmental processes and is owned and developed by global consultancy BMT. BMT are a leading international design, engineering, science, digital data technology and risk management consultancy with a reputation for excellence and innovation. Delivering independent, complex design and consultancy capabilities and services for over 30 years, we pride ourselves on being equipped to support our clients to tackle the most complex, real-world issues and challenges. Within the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region, BMT is about 260 people strong with staff based in almost all Australian states and territories along with an Asian hub based in Singapore. BMT thrives on innovation and addressing challenges faced by our clients.

Learn more about your next company - (Welcome to BMT)

Your next job opportunity ‚Äì

As a ‚ÄúSenior Software Engineer‚Äù you will be responsible for contributing to the development and release of new TUFLOW features, specifically with regard to enhancing and expanding the core computational engines and associated software development processes across all TUFLOW products. This newly created role, based in Brisbane, joins our innovative and award-winning team, driven by growth opportunities in key markets worldwide.¬†

Key Responsibilities:¬†

Engage in a planned programme of upgrade and enhancement of the TUFLOW codebase to ensure the future needs of our customers are met.

Deliver software features across all our products, as determined by the supporting Business Planning process. This includes at least algorithm interpretation, code development, testing and development of documentation.

Evaluate, select and apply standard techniques, principles, procedures and criteria to perform technical tasks and address differing variable situations. Deliver solutions where precedent may not exist.

May contribute to technical papers and industry/conference presentations.

In addition to these duties, the post holder may be required to carry out such other duties as may reasonably be required, from time to time, to achieve the above role purpose.¬†

¬†

Qualifications and Skills:

Minimum 7 years post grad professional software development experience

Tertiary qualification in Computer Science or equivalent

Direct industry experience in high performance scientific computing relating to:

o¬†¬† Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) software development

o¬†¬† Scientific software architecture, design and optimisation

title: Support Engineer
description:
What's in it for you?

6 Months contract in a well-established government organisation
Work on cutting-edge and legacy technologies across Visual Basic, .NET, Java, SCADA and SQL
Support a critical software platform used in underground mining operations across Australia

What our client requires:
ESSENTIAL

Proven software development knowledge and hands-on experience
Ability to pass the Coal Mine Workers' Health Scheme medical (fit for work without restrictions)
Flexibility to participate in after-hours support roster and travel frequently, including remote and overseas sites

IDEAL

Experience in VB6, VB.NET, C#, Java, .NET, SQL Server
Exposure to SCADA systems and/or on-site commissioning work
Strong communication and client liaison experience

Are you a Support Engineer looking for a new challenge in the mining tech space?
Or perhaps a Software Developer with a background in hardware systems ready for a hands-on, field-facing role?

Have you ever considered an exciting, fast-paced role where your work keeps entire mine sites safe and operational?


The Company
Join a large Government Department that supports safety and innovation in Australia's mining sector.
This organisation has developed a reputation for technical excellence, practical industry support, and commitment to improving workplace safety for over 30 years.

The Role
Due to the ongoing development and rollout of a new software platform, there is an exciting opportunity for a Support Engineer to join the team. You'll provide direct support to mining clients using the "Safegas" gas monitoring system, troubleshoot issues, and help transition customers from a legacy system to the latest platform.

Typical Duties

Support customers using Safegas at mine sites across Australia
Troubleshoot and maintain legacy systems
Assist with installation and transition to new software versions
Provide technical training and prepare manuals and support material
Liaise with clients and provide expert advice on system design and operation
Participate in an after-hours support roster

Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic organisation. If you have what it takes to thrive in this role and want to know more, please reach out to Lam Nguyen on Lam.nguyen@akkodisgroup.com

Joining Akkodis as a Consultant

Weekly Pay
No payroll processing fees
Upskilling opportunities and training discounts
Consultant gatherings and events
Akkodis SME meetups and info sessions
EAP Support Program
Dedicated Account Management Support Team

Privacy
Due to new privacy laws, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on "Apply for this job", you'll be directed to our Online Centre where you can read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements.

Akkodis is an Equal Opportunity employer. We actively encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

title: Senior Product Engineer
description:
The Role

RedU is hiring our first Senior Product Engineer for a 12-month contract starting at $150k to supercharge our Product Team. We‚Äôre a bootstrapped education platform, funded by our users, and focused on delivering top-tier professional development for nurses and teachers. As our first in-house developer, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our platform, with dozens of updates shipped daily. You will sit next to our product manager and have complete independence on the project.

We‚Äôre seeking candidates based in Brisbane, QLD (or willing to relocate) who are keen to work in our office. At RedU, we move fast and collaborate closely, our hiring process reflects that: a 30-minute phone call with the hiring manager, followed by an in office chat with the hiring manager and another member of the team.

The Work

Our platform is a learning management system (LMS) currently built with Ruby on the back end, driving a smooth and dynamic front end developed using JavaScript, Node.js, and Next.js. While we recommend leveraging these technologies to align with our existing stack, we‚Äôre open to exploring other tools and approaches that you believe could effectively support our goals. In 2025, we‚Äôre gearing up to launch new features, enhance performance, and scale to meet the needs of an expanding community of professionals who depend on our tools for their growth.


As our first engineer, you‚Äôll work hand-in-hand with our Technical Lead and founders for the first few months. They‚Äôll bring you up to speed on our codebase, vision, and pace. After that, you‚Äôll take the reins, driving product advancements and setting the stage for future hires.


What Success Looks Like

Own our codebase and deeply understand the needs of our professional development users

Spearhead the rollout of major features that redefine how people learn and grow

Establish rock-solid development practices through code quality and documentation

Build patterns that make our platform scalable and a joy to work on

Be the go-to voice in shaping our technical direction


About You

Degrees are optional as we‚Äôre after real-world impact, not framed certificates.

You‚Äôre a seasoned developer with deep expertise in Ruby (back end) and JavaScript (especially Node.js and Next.js for front end), plus experience with AWS or similar cloud platforms. You‚Äôre fired up about building an LMS that transforms professional growth. You thrive on cracking tough challenges, whether it‚Äôs optimizing a Ruby API or streamlining a Next.js UI and love seeing your solutions light up users‚Äô lives. Your code is clean but pragmatic; you know when to ship fast and when to refine.

This is a high-ownership role. We want someone curious, self-driven, and ready to set a high bar for what‚Äôs possible as we grow our team.

Why Apply?

See Your Impact

We‚Äôre a lean team, and as the sole developer on this project, your work will directly shape the experience of professionals. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to see your ideas come to life and make a tangible, outsized impact on our customers‚Äô productivity.


Experience Amazing Opportunities

We value exceptional talent and, as a scale-up, we‚Äôre agile enough to offer you room to grow. Whether it‚Äôs taking on new challenges within existing teams or stepping into fresh roles, we‚Äôre committed to helping you excel and seize exciting opportunities.


Solve Deep and Interesting Problems

Professional development is a dynamic, innovative field that demands creative solutions to thrive. We encourage you to harness AI and cutting-edge tools to tackle complex challenges, pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible and driving real progress in our platform.

About RedU

RedU is a fast-growing education platform dedicated to professional development. Our mission? Deliver tools that make learning practical, accessible, and impactful for nurses and teachers. From interactive courses to growth tracking, we‚Äôre crafting a product that changes how people advance their careers‚Äîall from our Brisbane HQ.

Explore us here:https://redu.redunion.com.au/

title: Technical Enablement Lead Engineer
salary: No contractor fees / two pay runs per week
description:

title: Mid to Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Mid-Level Full Stack Engineer to join a dynamic and fast-growing SaaS company. In this role, you‚Äôll work on a large-scale platform that supports businesses across Australia, contributing to both front-end and back-end development. You‚Äôll be part of a high-performing engineering team, building new features, improving system performance, and ensuring the platform remains scalable and reliable as the business continues to expand.
¬†
This is a hands-on role where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with React, TypeScript and Node.js while leveraging AWS cloud technologies to develop robust, cloud-native applications. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and other engineers to deliver seamless user experiences and drive technical excellence.


What You‚Äôll Do:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performing applications across the full stack, with a focus on React, TypeScript and Node.js.

Proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer with strong proficiency in React (or React Native), TypeScript, and Node.js.
Experience building and maintaining cloud-based applications on AWS, utilizing services like Lambda, ECS, DynamoDB, and S3.
A strong understanding of RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and modern development practices.
Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and Git-based workflows.
A problem-solving mindset with a focus on writing clean, maintainable, and scalable code.
Experience working in Agile teams, participating in stand-ups, sprint planning, and technical discussions.
A passion for innovation and continuous learning, with the ability to adapt to new tools and technologies.
This is an exciting opportunity to work on a high-impact SaaS product, collaborate with a talented team, and make meaningful contributions to a platform that is shaping the future in their industry.
¬†
If you‚Äôre looking for a role where you can grow, take ownership, and work with cutting-edge technologies, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

At BLACKROC Recruitment, we are committed to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion. We welcome applications from individuals of diverse backgrounds, including those with lived experiences. title: Javascript Developer
description:
Work with AI Procurement Technology

Help build + enhance critical financial tools

Work with the latest AI models and tools

Open to all Skill Levels and Experience

¬†

About the Opportunity

We are looking for a Javascript Developer who thrives on solving problems and is ready for an exciting change. In this key role, you will be an integral part of our implementation team, working closely with consultants on projects to analyse clients business processes and implement innovative solutions using our advanced product suite. Your ability to understand customer needs, manage projects, and deliver exceptional service will be crucial to your success.

About Us

Zudello is an Australian automation technology company specialising in using Machine Learning to extract data from disparate systems and documents, enabling end-to-end automation of business processes. Our Software-as-a-Service platform is used by companies across a wide range of sectors, including Manufacturing, Hospitality, Health, and Not-for-Profit.

Responsibilities

Test and Validate Solutions: Conduct thorough testing to ensure scripts and automations perform as expected and meet project requirements.

Document Solutions: Create clear, maintainable documentation for custom scripts and automation workflows to support handover and future development.

Continuous Improvement: Iterate on existing automations based on client feedback, edge cases, or changing business requirements.

Key Skills

Business Logic Implementation: Ability to convert business rules and workflows into maintainable, performant code.

Detail-Oriented: Strong attention to detail, with the ability to understand and account for edge cases in complex processes.

Growth-Oriented: Eagerness to learn and grow, with a willingness to adapt to new tools, technologies, and ways of working.

Collaboration & Communication: Comfortable working closely with consultants and cross-functional teams to design and deliver tailored solutions.

Problem Solving Mindset: Creative and logical thinker who enjoys untangling complex challenges and creating simple, effective solutions.

ERP or Accounting Background (Nice to Have): Experience with ERP systems or a basic understanding of financial workflows is a bonus.

Adaptable & Curious: Eagerness to learn new tools, work with AI models, and grow within a highly configurable product environment.

¬†

What do we offer?¬†

Work With Cutting-Edge AI: Leverage the latest AI models‚Äîincluding tools like Claude‚Äîto build intelligent, automated solutions that solve real business problems.

Competitive Compensation: Receive a salary that reflects your skills, experience, and the value you bring to the team.

Diverse and Impactful Work: Tackle a wide range of tasks and challenges across industries, making each day engaging and meaningful.

Professional Development: Grow your skills with ongoing training, exposure to modern technologies, and support from a highly skilled team.

Vibrant Office Environment: Work from our centrally located CBD office at Cathedral Square, Brisbane‚Äîclose to cafes, public transport, and city life.

Supportive Team Culture: Join a collaborative, ethical, and inclusive team that values your growth, encourages new ideas, and supports a healthy work-life balance.

¬†

At Zudello, there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate‚Äô.

Seeing all of these‚Äù ideal‚Äù requirements, as well as the list of responsibilities, can be daunting. We know this may cause you to ask yourself ‚Äúcan I do this?‚Äù We encourage you to apply if you feel this could be you, even if there are some gaps but you feel the role is the perfect role for you. We will help develop your skills and career as you grow and learn with us.

Your ability to demonstrate that you have the enthusiasm and real potential to develop the required capabilities, knowledge and experience to perform in this role is what we would like to hear from you.¬†

title: Senior Python Developer
description:
About Us

Telair is a fast-growing Internet Service Provider with a strong focus on customer self-service, automation, and operational efficiency.

Why Telair?

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
MST‚Äôs dedication to quality & safety has allowed us to become a leader in our industry ‚Äì we are committed to maintaining quality systems and practices that ensure our products and services empower our clients with bespoke solutions.

Our vision is to become the number one choice in digital transformation for harsh industrial environments ‚Äì we are innovative and agile, leveraging vast global resources.




Reporting to the Firmware Engineering Manager, you will be working on exciting product development projects, collaborating with experienced engineers to design, develop, and maintain firmware solutions for the mining industry. You will:

Deliver robust and reliable firmware components
Collaborate closely with the Firmware Architect to prepare well-abstracted and extensible designs
Support integration, testing and deployment
Participate in root cause analysis of reported product issues Ensure completion of deliverables to quality standards and in accordance with agreed timing

¬†




What are we looking for:

3+ years‚Äô experience in software and firmware development in a commercial environment
Expert in bare-metal programming in C/C++, debugging, performance analysis and optimisation
Knowledge of Microcontrollers/Microprocessors, and familiarity with the architecture, peripherals, and interfacing techniques
Soft skills: Strong communication skills (including writing clearly), ability to learn quickly, willingness to ask questions and ask for help, a can-do attitude
Knowledge of basic electronics hardware and its interfacing with software systems
Familiar with Ethernet/WiFi/Bluetooth/Zigbee/LoRa/UWB technologies Experience in Mining technology

The benefits:

In return for your hard work and dedication, you will have:

The support of a knowledgeable and enthusiastic team
Access to our EAP service to support your wellbeing
Great remuneration & staff incentives
Ongoing training, development & recognition for your hard work
Discounts and offers on health insurance, food delivery services, travel & groceries
Wellbeing hub to support your mind, body & habits
Fruit, snacks and coffee ‚Äì we offer a contemporary, well-stocked kitchen with fruit, snacks and a barista style coffee machine.
Free parking on site at our Brisbane office (first come, first serve basis)

title: AI Specialist ‚Äì Drive Innovation in a Fast-Growing Tech-Enabled Company
description:
About Littles Lawyers

Littles is one of Australia‚Äôs fastest-growing personal injury law firms. We are committed to transforming how legal services are delivered ‚Äì using innovation, technology, and automation to provide better outcomes for our clients.

As part of this commitment, we are investing in AI-driven solutions that enhance productivity, streamline workflows, and deliver intelligent insights across the business.

The Role

We are seeking an AI Specialist to lead the development and implementation of AI projects across the firm. In this role, you will work closely with our internal developers and management team to scope, pilot, and roll out cutting-edge solutions powered by AI and machine learning.

This is a strategic and hands-on role, ideal for someone who is passionate about innovation, understands the capabilities of tools like ChatGPT, and has the technical knowledge to turn ideas into results.

Key Responsibilities

Lead AI initiatives and projects from concept through to deployment

Work closely with our internal developers to integrate AI solutions into legal workflows

Develop prototypes and tools using Python (or similar languages)

Leverage Microsoft Azure services, particularly Azure OpenAI and Cognitive Services

Stay across developments in generative AI and identify opportunities for adoption

Collaborate with legal and operational teams to design practical, business-aligned solutions

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Proven experience working with AI/ML technologies, especially large language models (LLMs)

Familiarity with OpenAI and Azure OpenAI services, including ChatGPT integration

Coding experience ‚Äì preferably with Python ‚Äì for prototyping and proof-of-concept development

Strong communication and collaboration skills

Experience working with Microsoft Azure platforms

Bonus: experience in legal tech or professional services environments

Why Join Littles?

Be part of a progressive and tech-driven law firm

Work on meaningful projects with direct business impact

Collaborate with a supportive, forward-thinking team

Flexible working arrangements

Opportunities for growth as we expand our innovation capabilities

title: Android Developer
description:
The Company

This ASX-listed tech company is a recognised leader in digital platform innovation, with a strong presence in both the Australian and international markets. With a customer base in the millions, they continue to scale through user-focused products, data-driven decision-making, and high-performing cross-functional teams. The culture is collaborative and dynamic, with a strong emphasis on continuous improvement, technical excellence, and work-life balance.

Headquartered in Brisbane, they offer a highly flexible work model, an exceptional office experience including gourmet in-house meals, and a range of personal development and wellbeing initiatives that set them apart as an employer of choice.

The Role

As an Android Developer, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing and evolving mobile applications that are critical to the company‚Äôs customer experience. You‚Äôll work on a modern Android codebase with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose, implementing new features, improving app performance, and ensuring stability across a broad device landscape.

You‚Äôll work closely with product managers, designers, QA engineers, and other developers in a fast-paced Agile environment, using feedback loops and analytics to prioritise and refine features. With millions of users and a strong focus on app excellence, this is a role where you‚Äôll see the impact of your work daily.

About You

You‚Äôre a passionate Android Developer who thrives in collaborative teams and enjoys the craft of building elegant, user-friendly mobile experiences. You understand the balance between technical integrity and business needs, and you're always looking for ways to improve apps and processes.

Comfortable in a Linux or Mac environment, you're adaptable, pragmatic, and always up to speed with the latest in Android development.

Skills & Experience

Strong experience with Kotlin and Java.
In-depth knowledge of the Android SDK and Android UI frameworks (including Jetpack Compose and traditional Views).
Experience integrating with RESTful APIs.
Agile development experience (Scrum, Kanban).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative code review processes.
Strong communication skills across technical and non-technical teams.
A passion for user-centric product design and performance optimisation.
Experience in a cross-functional, product-led team environment.
What‚Äôs on Offer

Salary package of $130,000 ‚Äì $150,000 + Super.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in-office, 2 days from home.
Flexible hours with a focus on core collaboration time (10am‚Äì2pm).
Short-term incentive program.
120-day Work-from-Anywhere policy.
Daily chef-prepared lunches and breakfast (Brisbane HQ).
Extensive wellness and EAP support.
Generous parental leave (14 weeks for primary carers, 4 weeks for partners).
A vibrant, social workplace culture with team events, games, and inclusion initiatives.
Apply Now

If you're ready to join a high-impact team building apps that delight millions, apply now! Don‚Äôt miss the chance to shape the future of mobile experiences with a company that truly values its people.

title: University Student - Technical Operatios (Data Science/Computer Science)
description:
The details:

Work part time - 3 to 5 days a week (Monday to Friday), depending on what suits your study needs
Appointment will be for the duration of your undergraduate studies.
$34.68 per hour + 12% super (level 1)
Location: Narangba

We are seeking a friendly, reliable and motivated University Student to work in our Technical Operations, Assets and Systems¬†team!

The team are developing and improving¬†IT systems¬†used by our outdoor Operations crews to manage their workflow and activities. The University Students in the team get to know the day to day operational work the crews are performing, and the various IT systems they interact with, to find solutions that automate, streamline and improve their tasks.

You'll be working alongside professionals from our Operations teams, and our¬†Digital Innovation & Technology team and will gain great knowledge in the area of your studies as you assist the team in creating¬†dashboards, reporting tools for leaders, analysing data to be turned in to Work Orders, and improving data quality.

Your enthusiasm and drive to solve problems that improve the end user's experience, will be paired with good communication skills to¬†provide a great experience for all of our stakeholders.

You will be currently enrolled in relevant university studies¬†ideally with a¬†Data Science or Computer Science focus, but if you have a second relevant major or minor would be beneficial too.

¬†Click here for the Position Description

Why City of Moreton Bay?

What you do with your life matters. It‚Äôs the same with your career.

We‚Äôre the third-largest council in Australia and one of the fastest-growing areas. As Australia‚Äôs newest city, we‚Äôre building something that‚Äôs never been done before: a new kind of city, inspired and empowered by a new kind of council.

This is your opportunity to develop skills and experience in a truly unique place, at a truly unique point in time.

At City of Moreton Bay, we‚Äôre focused on the vital work we do today. But we‚Äôre also focused on the future. On what can be ‚Äì for our city, our Council and your career.

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll love about a career with us:

See it. To build a city of the future, first, you have to see it. The polycentric city we‚Äôre building will bring greater prosperity, sustainability and affordability to our city. This is your chance to contribute to something that‚Äôs never been done before.
Shape it. You‚Äôll get hands-on in a rewarding career, serving and strengthening our communities for today and tomorrow. Our work is diverse, interesting and it matters ‚Äì and it‚Äôs yours to shape and own.
Live it. Contribute to the city you and your family want to live in and enjoy the lifestyle you deserve. And if you don‚Äôt live here, you‚Äôll still find pride and connection in so many ways with our successful, resilient team.

You‚Äôll also enjoy a range of other benefits:

Prioritise your health and wellbeing with discounted health insurance, free annual flu vaccinations and our Fitness Passport Program.
Make your pay go further with salary packaging options on novated leases, superannuation payments, smartphones and devices.
Get support when you and your family need it most with our 24/7 confidential counselling service and Mates in Construction program.

Ready for a career that matters?

Join City of Moreton Bay, and help shape our city of the future.

Click on the 'Apply Now' button below to complete your online application. Please upload a current resume that demonstrates how you meet the requirements for this role.¬† You will also have the option to add a cover letter should you wish.

As part of the recruitment process, applicants will be required to undergo a National Criminal History Check.

To obtain further details please contact our Careers team at careers@moretonbay.qld.gov.au.¬†

For more information about City of Moreton Bay and to stay across what's happening in our city, follow us on¬†LinkedIn.

Your Future City.
See it. Shape it. Live It.

City of Moreton Bay extends across the traditional lands of the Jinibara, Kabi Kabi, and Turrbal peoples, and we acknowledge and pay respects to our Traditional Custodians. We believe diversity of thought, background and experience creates better outcomes for our people and communities, and we strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people of all ages, genders, abilities and cultural backgrounds.

description:

title: Technical Lead
description:
At Swyftx, we're not just building a fintech scaleup; we're shaping the future of Australia's digital currency industry. With over 800,000 users, we have our sights set high, aiming to be Australia's most trusted cryptocurrency trading platform, bridging the gap between defi and tradfi, and expanding to become Australia‚Äôs next global success story.¬† ¬†
¬†
This is more than just a job‚Äîit's an opportunity to shape the future of an industry leader. As a Tech Lead at Swyftx, you'll play a key role in planning, designing, leading, and delivering technical solutions that drive engineering excellence and innovation. With a passion for leadership, you'll coach and mentor your squad, helping them grow and reach their potential, while working closely with the Engineering Manager to support and develop the team.¬†
¬†
Please note this is a Brisbane based role, and we have hybrid working, with two days per week in our beautiful Milton office. ¬†
¬†
How we work¬†

We are organised in product squads, with a product manager, designer and tech lead in each, along with anywhere from 3 to 6 engineers.¬†
Squads are responsible for domains such as deposits, trading and customer onboarding, and look after setting roadmap for delivery of major new features/products, optimizing existing features/products, and dealing with tech debt.¬†
What we build¬†

Our stack is Node.js, AWS and React/React Native.¬†
Our trading platform needs to be highly scalable to deal with sharp peaks in the market.¬†
As custodians of our customers‚Äô money, security is also a key consideration in how we engineer things.¬†
With over 800,000 customers, we place a lot of emphasis on design and user experience so that our customers can have the easiest-to-use and most trustworthy experience.¬†
Some of your key responsibilities in this role will include:¬†

Lead by example, writing high-quality, scalable code while also coaching and supporting your team‚Äôs technical growth.¬†¬†
Conduct code reviews, fostering high standards and continuous improvement.¬†
Provide guidance through 1:1s and technical mentorship, promoting knowledge sharing and career growth.¬†¬†
Champion agile practices, ensuring effective sprint planning, task allocation, and successful project delivery.¬†
Implement and enhance processes, tools, and governance to maintain technical excellence and compliance across all teams.¬†
Leading the team in managing key areas of Crypto and Fiat operations, including portfolio migrations, transactions, and financial reporting, while driving efficiency in reconciliation and internal tools.¬†
To be successful you will have:¬†

Extensive engineering experience, including experience in a technical leadership role.¬†¬†
A strong technical background with a deep understanding of software development principles, architectures, and best practices, with a particular emphasis on front-end engineering and React.¬†¬†
Experience partnering with product management, design, and other stakeholders to define product roadmaps, prioritize features, and ensure that engineering efforts align with business objectives.¬†
Willingness to teach and mentor other developers to achieve exceptional results¬†
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build trust and rapport with diverse stakeholders.¬†
Some of our perks and benefits include:¬†

Fully stocked kitchen, breakfast and lunch foods, unlimited fresh fruit and snacks.¬†¬†
An inhouse barista and weekly catered lunches on a Wednesday.¬†
Unlimited fee-free trading.¬†
Career growth, training, mentorship, and development opportunities.¬†
Social activities, game breaks and end of month awards.¬†

At Swyftx, we're not just building a diverse and dynamic environment; we're celebrating it. We value and embrace the unique experiences, qualities, and characteristics that each member of our team brings, and we're committed to cultivating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to do their best work.¬†¬†¬†
¬†¬†
If you are driven by excellence, a deep commitment to integrity, and an unwavering drive to make an impact then click ‚Äòapply now‚Äô.¬†¬†
¬†¬†
We have an internal Talent Acquisition function, and therefore are not accepting approaches from recruitment agencies.¬†
¬†¬†

title: Frontend Engineer

At Swyftx, we're not just building a fintech scaleup; we're shaping the future of Australia's digital currency industry. With over 800,000 users, we have our sights set high, aiming to be Australia's most trusted cryptocurrency trading platform, bridging the gap between DeFi and TradFi, and expanding to become Australia‚Äôs next global success story.¬†

As a Frontend Engineer at Swyftx, you'll primarily specialise in frontend development, with the opportunity to dive into full-stack tasks as your interests and skills allow. You'll play a key role in our technical advancement, joining a high-performing and passionate team that takes pride in the craftsmanship of their code. Partner closely with our product and design teams to ensure our application is functional, intuitive, beautiful, and user-friendly.¬†

Please note: This is a hybrid role, with 3 days working from home and 2 office-based days at our Brisbane head office.¬†

How we work¬†

We are organised in product squads, with a product manager, designer and tech lead in each, along with anywhere from 3 to 6 engineers.¬†
Squads are responsible for domains such as deposits, trading and customer onboarding, and look after setting roadmap for delivery of major new features/products, optimizing existing features/products, and dealing with tech debt.¬†

Track record in identifying, and resolving, customer facing issues in a timely manner.¬†

A can-do attitude, driven by a strong desire to create a meaningful impact for customers.¬†

At Swyftx, we're not just building a diverse and dynamic environment; we're celebrating it. We value and embrace the unique experiences, qualities, and characteristics that each member of our team brings, and we're committed to cultivating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to do their best work.¬†¬†¬†

title: Senior ML Ops / Software Engineer
description:
Join us in our mission to support a healthier planet.
¬†
CarbonLink is a pioneering company aiding Australian primary producers and landholders in their journey to sequester carbon and regenerate landscape. Regenerative agricultural practices have tremendous potential to combat climate change by drawing down and removing large quantities of atmospheric carbon dioxide into the soil, in addition to increased productivity of farmland, draught resilience, soil health and biodiversity.


CarbonLink has generated over 90% of Australia's soil carbon credits. We bring over a decade of industry-leading experience, ground-breaking technology, streamlined processes, and unparalleled client service to the table. ¬†We combine industry leading measurement and modelling for Monitoring, Reporting and Verification approaches with practical on-farm advice to maximise project outcomes. ¬†Our diverse team includes machine learning researchers, software engineers, scientists, GIS experts, agricultural and soil specialists, and carbon project advisors.
¬†
The Opportunity

As the Senior ML Ops / Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, building, and managing the machine learning infrastructure that powers the soil carbon modelling, measurement, reporting and verification in various projects that further our business objectives and environmental mission.
¬†
What you'll bring to Carbon Link

As a Senior ML Ops / Software Engineer, you will be driving conversations, providing technical suggestions, helping make decisions and collaborating with data scientists, software engineers and stakeholders in the company.
Your Responsibilities:
Machine Learning Infrastructure Development:¬†Design, implement, and manage scalable, efficient, and secure ML pipelines for training, deploying, and monitoring models in production.
Cloud and DevOps Engineering:¬†Develop cloud-based solutions for ML model deployment and integrate best practices in DevOps, CI/CD, and infrastructure as code.
Data Engineering:¬†Build and optimize data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and storing large-scale soil and carbon-related datasets.
Model Deployment & Monitoring:¬†Deploy ML models into production environments and establish robust monitoring systems to ensure reliability, scalability, and compliance.
Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams:¬†Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to align ML infrastructure with business and scientific objectives.
Security & Compliance:¬†Ensure all ML operations adhere to industry best practices for security, privacy, and regulatory compliance.
Performance Optimization:¬†Continuously improve ML workflows and infrastructure for efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and performance.
Software Engineer:¬†Contribute to the migration of legacy code to a modern software stack
You have:
8+ years in software engineering or a related field.
Strong background in ML Ops, software engineering, or cloud infrastructure for ML applications.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn). Experience with R is a bonus.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Familiarity with GIS, remote sensing, and environmental data.
A Bachelor or Master Degree in Software Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Equivalent experience will also be considered.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in small company environment.
You are:
Keen to learn from those around you and eager to share your knowledge with the team, fostering a growth mindset.
Aligned with our mission and values, demonstrating them through your working practice.
Self-motivated and capable of working independently, taking the initiative to ensure that you have everything you need to work efficiently.
Our office is located in the Brisbane CBD, Australia, and requires a minimum of 3 days in the office per week. Occasionally, you may be invited to travel to our lab or visit a customer's farm.
¬†
Our Culture
¬†
We are committed to creating an inclusive and collaborative work culture. At CarbonLink, we believe that diverse teams lead to better results and a better world. We are dedicated to creating a culture of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable sharing ideas and taking calculated risks.
We strongly encourage you to apply if you‚Äôre interested. ¬†We welcome applications from all individuals who are passionate about our mission, regardless of gender, race, age, or background. ¬†Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria ‚Äì unlike majority candidates who may meet significantly fewer requirements.
Join us at CarbonLink and play a key role in our mission to have a positive impact on the environment and the agricultural industry.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
We‚Äôre on the lookout for a Senior Full Stack Developer to help take¬†
a SaaS product to the next level. This role leans heavily on your Laravel expertise but will have you working across the full stack ‚Äì from building front-end experiences to making sure the back-end is solid, secure, and scalable.

The role in a nutshell

Working with APIs, databases, and third-party integrations to create seamless, reliable systems.

Work closely with the team to turn ideas into real features, help others level up through code reviews and advice, and keep an eye on the bigger picture to make sure everyone is building things the right way without piling up tech debt.
About you
4+ years of full stack development experience with a strong focus on Laravel, PHP, and SQL databases.
Solid front-end skills with React or Vue.js, plus experience building and integrating RESTful APIs.
Comfortable with Git, Docker, and AWS (or eager to learn), and familiar with modern dev workflows.
Strong communication skills ‚Äì you're just as comfortable chatting with stakeholders as you are reviewing pull requests.
Proactive and self-driven ‚Äì you don‚Äôt wait to be told what to do next.
Any of the below would be great but don't stress...

Experience with serverless architecture (e.g., Lambda) and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices.
Exposure to Typescript/Node.js backend development.
Previous experience mentoring junior devs or leading small teams.
If you love problem-solving, enjoy collaborating with a smart, friendly team, and like seeing your ideas come to life in production, this could be a great fit.
