BLACKROC Recruitment is committed to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion. We welcome applications from diverse backgrounds, including those with lived experiences. If you require any adjustments during the recruitment process, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact the BLACKROC Consultant.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Are you looking for a role where you can be more than just a code monkey? Where you can voice your opinions and contribute ideas to the product roadmap?
¬†¬†
Well, it‚Äôs your lucky day because we are working with a Brisbane based start up who are looking for exactly that!
¬†¬†
They are looking for a proactive individual who can contribute and promote ideas to the product suite as they gather momentum. The team love hearing new ideas and opinions welcome these with open arms.¬†
¬†¬†
The start-up was founded in 2020 and they have been going from strength to strength ever since. If you have experience working in a start-up/scale-up environment before as well, this would be a big plus!
¬†¬†
In terms of technical skills, they are looking for someone with a background working with:

React
TypeScript
Node
React Native¬†
AWS
They are Brisbane based and have a hybrid working environment (you will be required to go in 4 days a week). You may see them out from time to time as they also love going out as a team for a lunch, drink or to one of the many meetups happening!
¬†¬†
If you‚Äôd like to learn more about the role, please apply below or reach out directly.
¬†¬†
Natalie Youkhana
nat@justdigitalpeople.com.au

title: API Developer
description:
Your new company

You will work through a consultancy to service their client who has been a game-changer in the industry. They are a forward-thinking organisation dedicated to delivering exceptional results across industries. With a strong foundation built on innovation, collaboration, and integrity, they strive to create value for their clients, employees, and communities.

Your new role

You will be part of the engineering team, building a greenfield project. As an API Developer, you will be responsible for technical support, bug fixing and enhancements to their data platform. This is a hands-on role where you will be required to work on features and improvements to the platform in a secure, well-tested, and preformant way. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, Cyber and other stakeholders to maintain a high bar for quality in a fast-paced, iterative environment.

What you'll need to succeed


Strong commercial experience with Python and SQL

Experience with API Development tools and frameworks (Flask, Django, FastAPI)

Strong knowledge of API Authentication: JWT, OAuth2 etc.

Experience with Python data libraries (SQLAlchemy, PySpark)

Proven ability to clearly communicate about technical, architectural, and/or organisational problems and propose through iterative solutions

Good understanding and experience measuring non-functional, like reliability, availability, security and performance

Experience with DevOps ecosystem concerning tooling, Continuous Delivery, Continuous Integration, Infrastructure as Code

Experience in defining, designing and maintaining enterprise platforms and solutions, including working with DevOps tools and services (Git, Azure DevOps, etc.).

SAFe/Agile experience is important for this role.

Must be based in Brisbane as this is an urgent requirement


What you'll get in return

3 days in the office, 2 days out.
Brisbane CBD location.

This is a 12-month contracting opportunity with an ongoing possibility to extend, providing you with stability while contributing to exciting and impactful projects.
You'll gain exposure to innovative technologies and have the chance to work within a supportive, agile environment that values your expertise.



What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now:

Mounia.Serroukh@hays.com.au | 07 3231 2615
Bianca.Redoblado@hays.com.au | 07 3243 3037

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic Capital Markets team in Brisbane. In this role, you will develop deep expertise in our FNZ products and application, business processes, and industry. This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned Java developer to collaborate with experienced Solution Architects and Business Analysts/Testers, while mentoring junior Developers. You will work with global clients to bring their requirements to life and build high-quality solutions, while contributing to the design and development of our products.

¬†

The responsibilities will include:

Software Development

¬∑ Design, develop, test, and maintain applications across multiple platforms and programs.

¬∑ Analyze business requirements to design applications and databases.

¬∑ Diagnose issues with software in a timely manner, including complex issues introduced by environmental factors e.g. network issues. Identify and implement workarounds and/or permanent solutions.

¬∑ Modify applications programs and troubleshoot applications programs in both test and production scenarios.

¬†

Software Quality

¬∑ Ensure software meets user requirements and follows industry standards.

¬∑ Conduct and review code testing, including unit tests and automated test packs.

¬∑ Develop and maintain reusable test artefacts and contribute to test methodology selection.

¬†

Knowledge Sharing

¬∑ Act as a subject matter expert and provide technical guidance.

¬∑ Mentor and train junior team members to enhance skills and problem-solving.

¬∑ Collaborate with senior architects to contribute to design implementation.

¬†

High-Performing Team Contribution

¬†

¬∑ Participate in team meetings, share knowledge, and support continuous improvement.

¬∑ Build strong working relationships and ensure effective communication across teams.

¬∑ Adhere to company policies, legislative requirements, and workplace safety standards.

¬†

What are we ideally looking for in a successful candidate?

¬†

¬∑ 7+ years in software development, including 3+ years in IT, with relevant tertiary qualifications.

¬∑ Experience in Financial Services and/or Capital Markets and familiarity with its problem domain.

¬∑ Advanced proficiency in Java, SQL, XML, and enterprise infrastructure components (e.g., Oracle, Postgres, Tomcat, Spring, JMS, RabbitMQ, Apache Camel, JasperSoft).

¬∑ Experience in Agile development and test frameworks (TDD, BDD).

¬∑ Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and ability to learn new technologies.

¬∑ Familiarity with commonly used frameworks, tools, and open-source components.

¬∑ Ability to design programs that meet user needs effectively.

¬∑ Adaptability to change and willingness to learn new programming languages, tools, and frameworks.

¬∑ Effective communication skills and strong time management abilities.

¬†

Why should you join us?

¬∑ A hybrid 3+2 model combining working from the office and from home.

¬∑ A competitive salary and excellent benefits, including full comprehensive health insurance, Life insurance, additional annual leave days after your first 12 months, sick days, and more.

¬∑ Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services via cloud computing and partners with some of the world‚Äôs largest companies.

¬∑ We provide global career opportunities for our employees at any of our offices in the UK, Czech Republic, Australia, New Zealand, China and more.

If this role appeals to you, please apply by the 6th April 2025.

¬†

*Please note we shortlist as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw advertising at any time.

¬†

For more information, please reach out to us on apac_recruitment@fnz.com.

title: Mid/Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
description:
Do you:

Want to work on large Ruby on Rails applications?
Have a passion for writing clean code and implement coding patterns?
Have > 2 years experience as a full stack web developer?

If so, we would love to hear from you.

¬†

About us

We are a small team of Ruby on Rails developers, based around the world, focusing on creating scalable custom software for our enterprise clients with a large emphasis on writing fast, clean Ruby code. We work primarily with large companies that can't find software that fits off the shelf. As a result we get to work on unique challenges that solve real world problems for businesses.

Our services include designing, developing, hosting and maintaining custom Ruby on Rails apps for our customers.

We embrace AI development.
¬†

Benefits

100% remote first organisation. Work on your terms from anywhere.
Great team of likeminded individuals who have a passion for clean code
Autonomy to build technical solutions without micro-management
Flexible hours
Asynchronous organisation that promotes a distraction free environment
We keep mandatory meetings to a minimum
Annual professional development fund that you can use to improve your skillset (for example courses, books)
Equipment allowance that can be used to purchase a high powered machine and setup your office

¬†

Technology

Ruby on Rails MVC
Postgres
Resque
Git

More information on the app will be provided in our interview.
¬†

Responsibilities

Build and deploy features using Ruby on Rails
Write tests that adequately cover your changes (Unit and/or End to End)
Rectify any code related issues that are raised
Communicate effectively and efficiently with team mates over chat
Create QA videos for the client to approve your work

¬†

No agencies or recruiters please

title: Solution Engineer (Salesforce Developer)
description:
Position is located in Brisbane and the successful candidate will need to enter into a Flexible Work Arrangement upon commencement to reflect the office location you are seeking to work from. If working from a regional office, travel to the Brisbane office might be required.¬†

Key Outcomes and Accountabilities:

The aim of this role is to:

Develop and maintain a detailed knowledge of software process improvement. Adhere to OBCC software development governance controls, methodologies, frameworks and processes.
Design, code, test and document large and/or complex software solutions from supplied specifications using agreed standards and tools, to achieve a well-engineered result.
Provide guidance to internal and external stakeholders in architecting software solutions.

Please see attached role description for further information.¬†

Candidate Attributes:¬†

Demonstrated experience, ability, and knowledge in Salesforce configuration, development, integrations, software tools, development methodologies, automated testing, and system documentation.

Demonstrated technical experience with Salesforce Experience Cloud, Salesforce Service Cloud, Apex, Omnistudio, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, Git, and GitHub Workflows. Willingness to learn new development languages and technologies such as AWS.

Technical experience with systems networking, databases, web development, and user support.

Superior interpersonal, consultative, negotiation, and communication skills to clearly express, influence, and support business improvements and ICT service outcomes.

Self-motivated with excellent problem-solving and crisis management skills, strong analytical skills, and the ability to prioritise, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities. Proven ability to adapt and work diligently, both independently and collaboratively as a valuable member of a team. Capable of handling high-pressure, on-call situations with shifting priorities.

How to apply

Before you submit your application please read the attached applicant information document noting in particular that QBCC cannot employ anyone who is on a visa.¬†

Please submit:

Your resume and include the names and contact details of two referees who have a thorough knowledge of your work performance and conduct, it is preferable to include your current and previous supervisor.
A cover letter (maximum of two pages) telling us why you are interested in this role and how your skills, knowledge and experience complement this role. This should not be a repeat of your resume but rather your opportunity to tell us how you meet the required competencies.

Unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.¬†

title: .Net Developer
description:
Job Listing: .NET Developer
About the Role

We are seeking an experienced .NET Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong skills in both backend and frontend development, with a focus on AWS infrastructure and MongoDB database management.

Key Responsibilities
Cloud Infrastructure

Manage AWS instances, including deployment, scaling, and optimization

Configure and maintain cloud-based application environments

Database Management

Work with MongoDB databases to pull raw data as needed

Add/remove indexes for performance optimization

Perform data manipulation and correction when required

Ticket Management

Review and triage incoming development tickets

Identify and resolve errors through code or data adjustments

Document solutions and implement fixes

Development

Build and maintain ASP.NET Standard applications

Qualifications

Competitive salary

Remote work options

Professional development opportunities

If you're passionate about developing robust .NET applications and have experience with AWS and MongoDB, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Flutter Mobile Developer
description:
About Us

Nexvia is an Australian technology company that provides innovative cloud-based project management software to the construction and fit-out industries. Our solutions help businesses streamline their processes, improve operational efficiency, and drive profitability. We are growing our team and are looking for a Flutter Developer to help us build and maintain our new mobile application.

Job Description

As a Full-Stack Flutter Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our new mobile application using Flutter while also working on the backend services that support them. You will collaborate with product managers and other developers to create seamless, high-performance applications.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain cross-platform applications using Flutter (iOS & Android).

Build and integrate RESTful APIs and backend services.

Optimize applications for performance, scalability, and security.

Collaborate with UI/UX designers to create user-friendly interfaces.

Implement state management solutions

Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.

Debug and resolve technical issues in both frontend and backend systems.

Requirements

Strong experience with Flutter and Dart.

Knowledge of database management (SQL, SQLite, Firebase Firestore, etc.).

Experience with third-party integrations (APIs, authentication etc.).

Familiarity with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud, Firebase, etc.).

Understanding of mobile app deployment processes for both iOS and Android.

Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or in a team.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.


If you are passionate about mobile development and enjoy working on both frontend and backend technologies, we would love to hear from you!¬†

¬†

Why Flight Centre?¬†

title: Development Manager
description:
Our Digital and Technology function aspire to be a trusted, customer centric technology partner enabling the business to deliver services for the people we serve. UnitingCare is currently navigating a period of change with new government regulations, funding arrangements and evolving customer needs and we are a trusted partner and the digital leader for our customers.¬†¬†

¬†

After our digital transformation in 2021, our focus will pivot to ensuring UnitingCare embeds and extends the new enterprise capabilities we have delivered. This new era will ensure we can be more closely integrated with project capabilities to optimize resource efficiency, delivery capability and alignment with customer priorities.¬†

Make a meaningful difference with us:¬†

We‚Äôre looking for someone who wants to make the world a little better through small moments that leave big impacts. To build meaningful relationships and make a difference in the lives of others.¬†

As a Development Manager, you will lead the development team as part of the Digital Engineering function supporting various applications across corporate, clinical and customer facing services. In this role you will work collaboratively across multiple technology teams, supporting different project timelines and deliverables, mentoring team members and contributing code to ensure high-quality software delivery.¬†¬†

Please note, this is a full time, permanent position. Flexibility is important to us, and we know it is to you, too - this role supports hybrid working by agreement.¬†¬†

Your part in our UnitingCare team:‚ÄØ¬†¬†

Lead and mentor a team of software developers, championing best practice and consistent development outcomes addressing quality, testing, security, and documentation.¬†¬†

Identify new ways of working to improve the technology delivery and development services and lead the ongoing development of existing applications and the design and delivery of new applications across UnitingCare.¬†

Develop and maintain cloud-based applications hosted on Azure and manage demand, provide estimates, and maintain delivery across multiple initiatives.¬†

Identify and address technical challenges with a focus on continuous improvement and identify and resolve technical issues, investigate incidents, and implement preventive measures to minimize downtime and disruptions.¬†¬†

Regularly assess system performance, conduct diagnostics, and implement optimizations to ensure efficient operation and response times.¬†¬†

Plan and execute upgrades, updates, and patches to ensure applications are running on the latest versions with optimal features and security.¬†¬†

Take ownership of the DevOps and automation capabilities for existing and new applications.¬†¬†

¬†

What makes a difference for us?¬†¬†

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field, with demonstrated experience in leading software development teams.¬†¬†

Proven experience in software development and cloud platforms ‚Äì Azure is highly desirable.¬†¬†

Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues with strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with stakeholders and team members.¬†

Strong understanding of DevOps principles, practices, and tools and previous experience with automation technologies.¬†¬†

¬†

What makes a difference for you?¬†

The opportunity to be part of the second-largest Queensland employer who has been leading by example as a proud not-for-profit, for more than 100 years.¬†

Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance.¬†

Access to salary packaging, meal and entertainment benefits - up to $15,900 per year tax free as well as up to $2,650 of your pre-tax income to pay for meal and entertainment benefits.¬†

A recognition and rewards platform, providing employee discounts at hundreds of retailers, including everyday expenses, holidays, health insurance, a wellbeing program and employee assistance program.¬†

Career development opportunities to challenge yourself, grow and make a meaningful difference¬†

12 weeks paid parental leave and 2 weeks paid partner leave, available after 6 months service, in addition to the government scheme.¬†

Diversity and inclusive leave, offering paid gender affirmation leave and cultural leave options (paid and unpaid) for those who may celebrate Lunar New Year, Diwali, Ramadan, NAIDOC weeks and other significant cultural events.¬†
¬†
‚ÄØ¬†

Diversity & Inclusion¬†

Our approach is simple ‚Äìeverybody is welcome here. At UnitingCare, diversity is at the core of our who we are, our mission and our values. We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees no matter their sex, race, culture, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.‚ÄØ¬†
‚ÄØ¬†

UnitingCare as part of our commitment to reconciliation and building‚ÄØlong term employment opportunities for First Nations‚ÄØpeoples, would strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants for this position. You can learn more about UnitingCare's Reconciliation Action Plan‚ÄØhere.¬†

title: API Developer - Python
description:
Cognizant is seeking talented API Developers to join our team and contribute to the development and maintenance of our data platform. In this role, you will be responsible for defining, designing, and maintaining enterprise platforms and solutions. You will work with various DevOps tools and services, develop APIs using frameworks such as REST and FastAPI, and utilize Python data libraries for data engineering tasks. Your work will involve improving non-functional aspects like reliability, availability, security, and performance, as well as engaging in data engineering tasks and maintaining system reliability and uptime.

In this roles your key responsibilities will include:

Platform Development: Define, design, and maintain enterprise platforms and solutions.

API Development: Develop APIs using tools and frameworks such as REST and FastAPI.

Python Data Libraries: Utilize Python data libraries (SQLAlchemy, PySpark) for data engineering tasks.

Communication: Clearly and concisely communicate technical, architectural, and organizational problems and propose thorough iterative solutions.

Performance Improvement: Measure and improve non-functional aspects like reliability, availability, security, and performance.

DevOps Tools: Work with DevOps tools and services (Git, Azure DevOps, etc.).

Data Engineering: Engage in data engineering tasks (ETL, Presto, Hive, etc.).

Continuous Integration: Implement and maintain Continuous Delivery, Continuous Integration, and Infrastructure as Code within the DevOps ecosystem.

Technical Support: Provide technical support, bug fixing, and enhancements for the Unity data platform.

Feature Development: Develop features and improvements to the Unity data platform in a secure, well-tested, and performant manner.

Collaboration: Collaborate with Product Management, Engineers, Cyber, and other stakeholders to maintain high quality in a fast-paced, iterative environment.

Security: Respond to automated Security and Vulnerability reports (e.g., generated by Snyk).

Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve issues with data pipeline deployment, including metadata, middle layer, or pipeline-related problems.

System Reliability: Work with the Brisbane team to maintain system reliability and uptime.

To be successful in this role, your expertise and experience should include:

Programming Languages: Proficiency in one or more programming languages (Python, SQL).

API Development: Experience with API development tools and frameworks (REST, FastAPI).

Python Libraries: Familiarity with Python data libraries (SQLAlchemy, PySpark).

Platform Design: Experience in defining, designing, and maintaining enterprise platforms and solutions.

Communication Skills: Strong communication skills to address technical, architectural, and organizational problems.

Non-Functional Requirements: Understanding and experience in measuring non-functional requirements (reliability, availability, security, performance).

Data Engineering: Experience in the data engineering domain (ETL, Presto, Hive, etc.).

DevOps Knowledge: Knowledge of the DevOps ecosystem, including Continuous Delivery, Continuous Integration, and Infrastructure as Code.


Benefits
Joining Cognizant will give you the opportunity to learn and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry, while having your finger on the pulse of emerging industry trends and working on the cutting edge of technology in your field of expertise.¬†We recognize that our people perform at their best when they feel valued as significant contributors and that is why at Cognizant, taking care of our employees is a priority:

You can pursue innovative career tracks and opportunities here

You can enhance your professional development through education and dedicated training¬†

We‚Äôll give you the skills you need to keep pace with the changing workplace while our compensation, benefits and wellness packages help you stay healthy and plan for the future.

Please reach out to our friendly and welcoming team today to apply and register your interest for this full-time hybrid API Developer position.

At Cognizant, we engineer modern businesses to improve everyday life because we're dedicated to making a lasting impact. Cognizant (Nasdaq: CTSH) engineers modern businesses. We help our clients modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they can stay ahead in our fast-changing world. Together, we're improving everyday life. See how at www.cognizant.com or @cognizant.¬†

title: Senior PHP Developer
description:
Our client is currently looking for a PHP Developer on a permanent basis based in Australia working for a growing startup. This organisation has a strong engineering ethos and you will be helping to shape the customer platform which will enhance their experience. You will be integral to the team ensuring the delivery of significant platform upgrades, including tools and operating environment.

Key Responsibilities:





Building new features for our web-app and API using PHP and MySQL.
Designing and implementing high performing and robust code using PHP.
Write code that reads/writes data to the database efficiently. You will also occasionally be required to write custom scripts to retrieve data for colleagues outside of our department.
Troubleshooting, debugging, and resolving software defects and issues - leasing with our customer support team to get further details.
Reviewing other team members code and providing feedback via pull requests.
Collaborating with colleagues in system architecture and design discussions.
Demonstrate willingness to seek clarification and ask questions when needed.

Qualifications:



Engage in direct communication with other developers and stakeholders, exhibiting excellent communication skills.

title: Senior .NET & Angular Consultant
description:
About Lynkz
Lynkz is an IT consultancy company that works with organisations to design and develop solutions for customers that improve data delivery. Using machine learning, artificial intelligence and cognitive services our consulting professionals work with clients to deliver brilliant outcomes with end-to-end digital innovation to solve today‚Äôs challenges and grasp tomorrow‚Äôs opportunities. We are not theorists. We are practical and pragmatic realists, committed to delivering innovative, actionable and manageable solutions which produce results. We also know that the best way to achieve results, is by immersing ourselves in our client‚Äôs business and working alongside them as part of the team. Lynkz consists of highly talented business and IT professionals. We offer a positive, energetic work environment with an emphasis on flexibility, teamwork and supporting each other. We appreciate the creativity and talent of our team and strive to provide ongoing enrichment opportunities.¬†
About the role:
At Lynkz, you will perform as an individual and/or team contributor on our client engagement projects. You will work under the supervision of an engagement director and/or partner, to develop work products, lead specific project initiatives and act as a subject matter expert on consulting projects. Client engagement activities include, but are not limited to, framing issues, problem-structuring, optimising client processes, developing go-to-market strategies and change management.
What you will do:

Identify key issues, analyse and make recommendations to address problems

Develop strategy, plans, organization and/or process design, and effective deployment solutions (communications, KPI development, education, training etc.) to ensure achievement of agreed outcomes for clients

Develop quality work product(s), code and documentation

Assist in coordinating and communicating the results of consulting and internal projects via written reports and oral presentations to management

Perform engagement procedures designed to identify and define issues, review and analyse evidence, and document business processes

What you will bring:
¬†

Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience within the IT industry

Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience in consulting

Familiarity with Agile development methodologies

Be well informed and up to date on technological advancements

Proficient with database languages

Excellent written and verbal communication

Strong interpersonal skills

Creative problem-solving skills

An analytical mindset

Good time management and organisational skills

Extensive experience with the following technologies required:
¬†

Cloud Platforms (Azure) and the services available on these platforms

C#, React or Angular, Microservices Architecture principals and platforms

Other technologies such as Azure Devops

Kubernetes, more specifically AKS

What we offer:
¬†

Attractive Salary

Fun team events every 6 weeks

Inclusive and supportive culture

Keen focus on training and development

Public Holiday ‚ÄòSwap‚Äô Days allowing you to take a public holiday on another day that suits you better

Why join Lynkz?
Lynkz is a flat structured team, and everyone plays a critical part in making us successful. Lynkz is a rewarding place to work and your voice is an important part of this teams‚Äô success. Our culture-first principles are embedded in everything that we do.¬†

title: Senior JavaScript Engineer
description:
Who are we?

CoreLogic is the leading provider of property data and analytics in Australia and New Zealand. We‚Äôre fiercely independent, and we‚Äôre considered the best in the business. Every day, our data scientists and researchers collect data from over 4.5 billion points across the CoreLogic universe. We then rinse and finesse this data to transform it into powerful property market insights that drive the best property decisions.

Who are you?

You're a passionate software engineer dedicated to crafting exceptional software that emphasises reliability, scalability, performance, and security. You are curious, continuously exploring new technologies for scalable software solutions. Quality is your hallmark, and you thrive on creating solutions that exceed customer expectations. As a self-motivated team player, you coach and mentor others, work across multiple teams, and contribute to our culture of engineering excellence.

¬≠¬≠¬≠What is the role?

We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic, fast-paced product management and engineering team. This role involves end-to-end development, including design, build, test, and support for both front-end and back-end solutions. You will leverage your experience with agile methodologies to deliver innovative digital solutions that delight our customers and achieve our strategic priorities.

What will you be doing?

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be design, build, test, and optimise software. This role requires you to deliver high-quality, robust, reliable, and performant software solutions while driving technical excellence and fostering continuous improvement.

Deliver: Design, build, test, ship and maintain high quality software.

Excellence: Strive for technical excellence, ensuring high-quality, reliable, and performant solutions.

Full-Stack: Work with modern JavaScript libraries (React, Node.js, TypeScript) for both front-end and back-end development.

Mentor: Guide and support fellow engineers, promoting continuous learning and development.

Collaborate: Work with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions in an agile environment.

Improve: Enhance code quality, reduce technical debt, and improve processes and standards.

Strategy: Contribute to technical strategy and roadmaps, ensuring good software design and architecture patterns.

Innovate: Propose and implement new technologies and methodologies.

Ensure Quality: Maintain high standards through testing, automation, and observability.

Document: Keep documentation up to date across code bases, architectures and knowledge areas.

Secure: Implement best practices to ensure systems are secure by design.

Focus on Customers: Deliver solutions that meet customer needs and provide exceptional user experiences.

CI/CD: Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines for software builds and releases.

Agile Development: Participate in code reviews, agile sessions, workshops, planning, retrospectives, and Communities of Practice.

¬≠¬≠¬≠¬≠¬≠¬≠Are you the right fit?

Personal Skills:

Customer Focus: A results-oriented approach, taking pride in delivering solutions that exceed customer expectations.

Problem Solver: Strong analytical skills to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

Detail-Oriented: Keen attention to quality.

Communicator: Strong communication skills, facilitating collaboration with team members and providing mentorship to less experienced colleagues.

Growth: You continuously grow yourself and others.

Initiative: Proactive in improving solutions, processes, and standards.

Accountability: A sense of accountability, a passion for adding value, and a knack for solving complex challenges.

Technical Skills:

Software Development: At least 5+ years of experience in software development, using modern JavaScript coding, testing, and automation techniques.

Full-Stack Expertise: Proficient in TypeScript, React, and Node.js, with experience in both front-end and back-end development.

Testing: Strong experience in software testing with tools like Cypress, Selenium, and Jest.

Databases: Advanced knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases.

Cloud: Familiarity with designing and building cloud-native applications.

DevOps: Experience with DevOps tools and practices, with a deep appreciation for a DevOps culture.

Observability: Knowledge of logging and application performance monitoring.

Mentorship: Proven track record in leading by example and mentoring in code quality, standards, best practices, software design, and architecture patterns.

Continuous Improvement: Growth mindset, with a passion for supporting and enabling others to continuously improve and be more productive.

What credentials do you need?

Education: Degree in computer science or 5+ years of relevant experience.

Bonus: AWS Cloud Practitioner or other AWS certifications.

¬≠¬≠¬≠¬≠What does success look like?

Key Performance Indicators are based on:

Culture & Quality: Software Engineering Health

Quality: Focus on quality deliverables, ensuring 99% accuracy for production changes and other software delivery metrics such as DORA.

Efficiency: Identify process improvements, reduce wastage, automate where possible.

Customer Focus: Focus on improving customer experience.

CORE Behaviours: Demonstrate commitment to our core values and behaviours.

Job Qualifications

Education: Degree in computer science or 5+ years of relevant experience.

Bonus: AWS Cloud Practitioner or other AWS certifications.

Why join CoreLogic?¬†¬†

CoreLogic is highly collaborative and yes fun! To support you at work, we offer some fantastic perks:

Opportunity for flexible working conditions that works best for you and the business.

CoreLogic has a culture of collaboration. We champion ownership, initiative and leadership and provide the guide ropes to get you there.

Free mindfulness tools, online health and nutrition courses.

Complimentary access to New Zealand's most comprehensive property research platforms including RP Data.

Exclusive employee-only market updates and access to the industry‚Äôs best property experts.

Two community and volunteer leave days each year to support meaningful causes and our charity partners.

Monthly social get-togethers and a globally recognised rewards platform and points system.

An inclusive and diverse working environment that celebrates cultural weeks and advocacy months.

If this sounds like somewhere you want to work and you are seeking professional growth, don‚Äôt delay, apply today- we ‚Äòre looking for you

title: Java Developer
description:
About us

¬†

Auto & General (A&G) is the fastest growing major Motor and Home insurer in Australia. We provide insurance products and solutions to safeguard a brighter future for our customers, delivered through our multi award-winning brand Budget Direct and partnerships with leading brands - ING, Qantas and Virgin Money.

¬†

Our range of general insurance products protect customer‚Äôs most valued possessions on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, Pet and Travel Insurance products as well as Roadside Assistance.

¬†

Our culture of ‚Äòhigh performance with high integrity‚Äô underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We‚Äôre excited about the future and we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia‚Äôs best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.

The role

¬†

This role is a key Java development role building out the best digital online experience for Auto and General‚Äôs customers. You will be building out applications to allow customers to buy and manage their policies online. Also contributing to the development of internal applications used by our staff to support the business operations.

This role will be developing highly available and reliable Java micro-services deployed on AWS that are business critical.

¬†

Position accountabilities

Design and develop modern Java code to implement the goals of the sprint and deliver value to our business partners.
Contribute the design and development of our modern Java cloud micro-service architecture.
Help build out our CI/CD pipeline and AWS deployment infrastructure.
Take ownership of the product, contribute improvement and innovation ideas.
Work closely with other developers in the cross functional team to provide REST APIs.
Contribute to best practice testing across unit, integration and end to end tests.
Attention to detail for the look and polish of web applications.
Work within a cross functional Scrum team. Participate in all Scrum ceremonies such as planning, estimating and retrospectives. Contribute to the continuous improvement of team processes.
Participate in support and deployment activities as required.
Perform other reasonable and relevant activities as requested from time to time to meet operational requirements.

¬†

What experience you‚Äôll bring

¬†

5 + years proven commercial experience in web development;
Excellent knowledge of Java.
Excellent knowledge of Spring Boot and Spring Cloud.
Knowledge of SQL and ORM technologies.
Understanding of cloud deployment with Docker and AWS.
Experience with monitoring tools such as New Relic/Sumo Logic.
Experience with AWS ecosystem such as S3, EC2, Lambda, SQS.
Strong knowledge of software development, micro-service and message bus design considerations and patterns.
Ability to work in the Atlassian suite of products. JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket and Bamboo.
Source code management with git.
Experience is building highly available and reliable server side code.
Understanding of security implications for web applications (OWASP).
A background in financial services applications is an advantage.

¬†

¬†

Our perks

¬†

Location ‚ÄìOur head office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre ‚Äì a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport. We also have office locations in Kawana (Sunshine Coast) and North Lakes ‚Äì we are happy to consider applications from people wanting to work in these locations
Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You‚Äôll receive a paid ‚ÄòME‚Äô day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year.
Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits.
Workplace giving - If you‚Äôre passionate about a cause, then we are too ‚Äì we offer workplace giving and we‚Äôll dollar match your donations to registered charities.
Development opportunities - We‚Äôre championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
Employee discounts - You‚Äôll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.
Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes.
Onsite facilities - There‚Äôs excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.
Perks App - Access to an employee benefits and discounts app called ‚ÄòPerks‚Äô offering your great discounts, offers and programs across a range of areas.
WFH- Technology offer two days WFH and three days in the office


If you are seeking a new challenge and would enjoy the opportunity to work in a growing and changing business, click on the APPLY NOW button and submit your application.



Auto & General¬†values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all.

¬†

*A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Programmer Analyst - 3DX
description:
Boeing Australia is seeking two experience Programmer Analysts across multiple locations with expertise in the 3DEXPERIENCE (3DX) platform and / or the DASSAULT SUITE to support our critical programs, including the E7 and MQ28 - Ghost Bat. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the transition and enhancement of our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) technology platforms.

We are looking for two candidates of varying experience. One to support various defence programs (Brisbane) and another to support the MQ-28 Ghost Bat Facility build at Wellcamp, Toowoomba (Brisbane, Melbourne or Toowoomba).

MQ-28 Ghost Bat, is an an exciting opportunity for the South-Eastern Queensland region. Boeing have committed to building a brand new, purpose built, state of the art production facility in Toowoomba. Bringing interesting new careers to the SE Queensland/Darling Downs region, Boeing are set to manufacture in Wellcamp the first aircraft to be designed, engineered and manufactured in Australia in 50+ years. You could join Boeing for this monumental occasion!

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with functional and technical subject matter experts to address customer requirements within the 3DEXPERIENCE Platform, including CATIA, ENOVIA, and DELMIA.

Engage with internal customers to analyze requirements related to Model-Based Engineering (MBE) and Model-Based Product Planning (MBPP) to provide effective configuration and functional solutions.

Work with cross-functional teams to implement integrations with ERP, MoM, MES, ALM, JIRA, and other enterprise systems.

Participate in new projects and continuous improvement initiatives, including design, build, testing, end-user engagement, and deployment activities.

Drive business needs and provide functional solutions for MBE and MBPP by configuring and maintaining the 3DEXPERIENCE platform, including FCS, FTS, and indexing areas.

Provide technical and functional guidance to end users, resolving issues and documenting solutions.

Education

Bachelor degree in IT, Computer Science or similar is desirable but not essential

Experience

A background in software or engineering with at least 3-5 years of experience in 3DEXPERIENCE and / or the DASSAULT SUITE modeling, development, customization, and configuration.

Strong understanding of 3DEXPERIENCE and / or the DASSAULT SUITE architectural and schema concepts.

Proven experience in delivering high-impact business outcomes across PLM domains.

Expertise in 3DX Native apps customization, including user interface modeling, V6 Model Customization, EKL, CAA APIs, and VB scripting.

Ability to analyze requirements, define solution designs, and support business processes.

Experience in systems and applications integrations, including CAD, ERP, and MoM, with knowledge of DELMIA and CATIA.

Ability to support testing, root cause analysis, and propose alternate resolutions to technical issues.

Eligibility

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements and obtain Baseline Security Clearance.

About Us

Boeing Australia and New Zealand are shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for both the defence space and the manufacturing of composite components for commercial aircraft. From the seabed to outer space, we have helped shape aerospace, manufacturing and defence innovations in Australia over the past 95 years.

In addition to a competitive salary, our employees benefit from flexible working options, global opportunities, salary packaging, performance incentives, study assistance, wellbeing programs and discounts on health insurance, travel and accommodation.

We‚Äôre also committed to fostering an environment that‚Äôs welcoming, respectful and inclusive for every employee, with great opportunities for professional growth.

As an equal opportunity employer, female candidates, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply. We are also open to candidates from other industries including mining, communications, ICT and oil and gas. If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the criteria for this role although you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

Benefits

Cutting edge projects

Flexible working options

Competitive remuneration and incentive plan available

Discounts for health insurance, travel and accommodation

Salary packaging options

Health and wellbeing benefits

Study assistance

Global opportunities

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
Brooks is a growing, fast-paced technology leader of automation solutions which support the dynamic and expanding semiconductor and life sciences lab markets.

At Brooks, new ideas, technologies, and ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer-focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and collaborate with one another to achieve new heights.

title: Programmer Analyst - 3DX
description:
Boeing Australia is seeking two experience Programmer Analysts across multiple locations with expertise in the 3DEXPERIENCE (3DX) platform and / or the DASSAULT SUITE to support our critical programs, including the E7 and MQ28 - Ghost Bat. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the transition and enhancement of our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) technology platforms.

We are looking for two candidates of varying experience. One to support various defence programs (Brisbane) and another to support the MQ-28 Ghost Bat Facility build at Wellcamp, Toowoomba (Brisbane, Melbourne or Toowoomba).

MQ-28 Ghost Bat, is an an exciting opportunity for the South-Eastern Queensland region. Boeing have committed to building a brand new, purpose built, state of the art production facility in Toowoomba. Bringing interesting new careers to the SE Queensland/Darling Downs region, Boeing are set to manufacture in Wellcamp the first aircraft to be designed, engineered and manufactured in Australia in 50+ years. You could join Boeing for this monumental occasion!

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with functional and technical subject matter experts to address customer requirements within the 3DEXPERIENCE Platform, including CATIA, ENOVIA, and DELMIA.

Engage with internal customers to analyze requirements related to Model-Based Engineering (MBE) and Model-Based Product Planning (MBPP) to provide effective configuration and functional solutions.

Work with cross-functional teams to implement integrations with ERP, MoM, MES, ALM, JIRA, and other enterprise systems.

Participate in new projects and continuous improvement initiatives, including design, build, testing, end-user engagement, and deployment activities.

Drive business needs and provide functional solutions for MBE and MBPP by configuring and maintaining the 3DEXPERIENCE platform, including FCS, FTS, and indexing areas.

Provide technical and functional guidance to end users, resolving issues and documenting solutions.

Education

Bachelor degree in IT, Computer Science or similar is desirable but not essential

Experience

A background in software or engineering with at least 3-5 years of experience in 3DEXPERIENCE and / or the DASSAULT SUITE modeling, development, customization, and configuration.

Strong understanding of 3DEXPERIENCE and / or the DASSAULT SUITE architectural and schema concepts.

Proven experience in delivering high-impact business outcomes across PLM domains.

Expertise in 3DX Native apps customization, including user interface modeling, V6 Model Customization, EKL, CAA APIs, and VB scripting.

Ability to analyze requirements, define solution designs, and support business processes.

Experience in systems and applications integrations, including CAD, ERP, and MoM, with knowledge of DELMIA and CATIA.

Ability to support testing, root cause analysis, and propose alternate resolutions to technical issues.

Eligibility

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements and obtain Baseline Security Clearance.

About Us

Boeing Australia and New Zealand are shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for both the defence space and the manufacturing of composite components for commercial aircraft. From the seabed to outer space, we have helped shape aerospace, manufacturing and defence innovations in Australia over the past 95 years.

In addition to a competitive salary, our employees benefit from flexible working options, global opportunities, salary packaging, performance incentives, study assistance, wellbeing programs and discounts on health insurance, travel and accommodation.

We‚Äôre also committed to fostering an environment that‚Äôs welcoming, respectful and inclusive for every employee, with great opportunities for professional growth.

As an equal opportunity employer, female candidates, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply. We are also open to candidates from other industries including mining, communications, ICT and oil and gas. If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the criteria for this role although you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

Benefits

Cutting edge projects

Flexible working options

Competitive remuneration and incentive plan available

Discounts for health insurance, travel and accommodation

Salary packaging options

Health and wellbeing benefits

Study assistance

Global opportunities

title: Principal Software Developer - C#.NET
description:
Are you an experienced software developer ready to take on a leadership role in driving innovation and excellence? We are looking for a Principal Software Developer to architect, develop, and enhance enterprise-grade software solutions that our customers love. This role is pivotal in shaping the future of our products and mentoring the next generation of software engineers.

At TechnologyOne, we are a leading enterprise software provider, delivering powerful, integrated solutions to organisations across various industries. Our innovative software simplifies complex processes, empowering businesses with intuitive and scalable technology. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to create high-quality, scalable, and secure solutions. Your expertise will guide architectural decisions, development best practices, and future technological advancements.

What you'll be doing ‚Ä¶

Develop simple, elegant, and robust software that aligns with defined product requirements.
Ensure high performance, scalability, and security in all software solutions.
Deliver on-time, high-quality software, meeting key performance indicators.
Write comprehensive code documentation and supporting artifacts.
Actively participate in product showcases to educate stakeholders on new developments.
Work closely with Product Development teams to overcome technical complexities.
Mentor and guide other developers, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous learning
Conduct technical reviews, providing constructive feedback and ensuring high coding standards.
Identify opportunities to enhance business processes and reduce costs.
Ensure compliance with work health and safety policies and software development best practices.
Contribute to ongoing software testing, providing feedback for continuous product improvement.


Your Talents ‚Ä¶

Strong expertise in C# .NET, React, AWS, and cloud-native development.
Solid knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.
Hands-on experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Proven experience in software development, architecture, and technical leadership.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities.


TechnologyOne values diversity and inclusion, welcoming applicants who meet several (but not all) requirements. We offer career growth, competitive salaries, and a supportive environment. Our culture fosters creativity, innovation, and an entrepreneurial spirit. Life at TechnologyOne includes great benefits and charity initiatives, creating a workplace we're proud of.

Benefits‚Ä¶

Competitive remuneration package
Industry leading employee share plan
Amazing Culture: 8 x Australian Business Awards "Employer of Choice" winner
We love our team events & celebrate diversity
Flexible hours: we are family-friendly and value life outside of work
Free gym membership in your region (or, if you are located at HQ, we have a new state of the art Gym onsite, exclusive and available 24/7).
Additional 2.5 days of leave per year dedicated to volunteering at a charity of your choice
Free breakfast and coffee on-site

Who we are‚Ä¶
TechnologyOne (ASX: TNE) is Australia's largest enterprise software company and one of Australia's top 100 ASX-listed companies, with locations across six countries. We provide a global SaaS ERP solution that transforms business and makes life simple for our customers. Our deeply integrated enterprise SaaS solution is available on any device, anywhere and anytime and is incredibly easy to use. Over 1,200 leading corporations, government agencies, local councils and universities are powered by our software.

For more than 36 years, we have been providing our customers with enterprise software that evolves and adapts to new and emerging technologies, allowing them to focus on their business and not technology.

title: Digital Web Developer (FTC)
description:
Digital Web Developer (FTC)

Location: Virginia, Brisbane

9 x month FTC opportunity


¬†

About the job

At Opella, our Digital teams are committed to delivering exceptional solutions and services, with a passion for excellence to build a future where technology rapidly enhances and transforms Fast Moving Consumer Healthcare. Join our Digital M&S IT team as Digital Web Developer and you can help make it happen. Your job? You will be responsible for our Brisbane Manufacturing Site based in Virginia, to develop web-based applications using listed languages and Power Platform. This is initially a 9 x month FTC role. ¬†

At Opella, the Consumer Healthcare business unit of Sanofi, it is the purest and third-largest player globally in the Over-The-Counter (OTC) & Vitamins, Minerals & Supplements (VMS) market.¬†¬† We have an unshakable belief in the power of self-care and the role it can play in creating a healthier society and a healthier planet.

That‚Äôs why we want to make self-care as simple as it should be by being consumer-led always, with science at our core.¬†

Through our unique and balanced portfolio of more than 100 loved brands, including 15 global and local high-growth challengers such as Telfast, Dulcolax and Buscopan, we deliver our mission: helping more than half a billion consumers worldwide take their health in their hands.¬†¬†

This mission is brought to life by an 11,000-strong team, 13 best-in-class manufacturing sites, and 4 specialized science and innovation development centers.¬†

We are also proud to be the first major fast-moving consumer healthcare company to achieve B Corp certification.¬†

Join us on our mission. Health. In your hands.

Main responsibilities:

This is an IT role for a Digital Web Developer with expertise in Application Integration, Infrastructure and Networking skills

Oversee the M&S (Manufacturing & Supply) solution portfolio, roadmap, and projects globally for the Consumer Healthcare Global Business Unit (GBU). This includes supporting existing and future solutions for integrated functions (i.e., Manufacturing ERP, Procurement, Laboratories, Analytics, Engineering, Network)

cting as the intermediary between the business and digital- the Digital Web Developer will use a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help multi-functional stakeholders achieve their desired outcomes by:

Delivering Functional and/or technical analysis and expertise for Projects, Products or Solution within their area of specialty and solving complex problems as an individual and a team

Create prototypes and co-design innovative solutions

To lead and execute Functional /Technical expertise end-to-end through the lifecycle (plan, design, build, run) of Digital Product belonging to his/her domain of expertise

Act as 2IC and backup for the Digital CHC Site manager in their absence

Address and communicate to teams the necessary information and deliver prompt, efficient and quality service

Work with Digital and Business stakeholders to elicit high-level requirements and capture the core needs; understand the customer journey and define user requirements

Engage with and influence project decisions; assess the risks of various solutions and prioritize competing business demands

Promote architectural consistency and usability standards; define and execute test cases

Proactively monitor solutions status and act when requires, act as business escalation point for operational issue for his domain

Coordinate Roadmap delivery with our partners including incremental improvement

Analyse, document and test program development, logic, process flows and specifications

Document training materials for implemented solution- Deliver training to the end users and support teams (Owns training in his/her functional/ technical domain)

Ensure on time/scope/quality & cost delivery of features

Support the analysis and resolution of solution issues

Manage change management of existing and future solutions.

Work with Digital Site Manager to define the minimum viable product (MVP) that satisfies the business need.

Identify gaps in existing functionalities, options for improvement and opportunities for process automation.

Ensure that Role design/change (security & compliance) will be consider during the solution design

Partner with business and Digital to elicit, analyze, translate, and document business requirements, pain points or opportunities into IS/IT requirements

Ensures that Digital Products/Solution/Computerized systems meet all controls to address applicable quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements and be responsible of deliver/validate compliant documentation on his domain of expertise

Ensure compliance with the architecture standards and guidelines and the correct interface between applications under the scope of responsibility

Support Sanofi for audits and inspections involving computerized systems

Contribute actively to Operational excellence: facilitating risk management and conducting/contributing to Problem root causes analysis, act as L2 support on her/his domain of expertise

About you

Qualifications:

Bachelor Degree (Industrial Engineering, Information Technology etc.) or another technical field

Experience:

Ideally a minimum 5 x years experience in an Information Technology role, developing web based applications and integration process points with execution systems (SAP, LIMS, MES)

Background in Pharmaceutical, Health or Consumer Goods (Manufacturing) industry within operational excellence, continuous improvement, process transformation or similar an advantage

Solid understanding of GxP business processes

Technical Skills: ¬†¬†

Agile practices and Networking Infrastructure engineering (nice to have)

Full cycle project implementation in Digital systems

Power BI, Power App and Power Automate experience an advantage

Development Languages: JavaScript, TypeScript and C#

Frameworks: React, Next.js, .NET, Redux

Soft Skills:

Curious and passionate to learn

Hands-on, team player

Fluent in English!

Strong written/spoken communication

Results and processes oriented, highly analytical

Why choose us?

Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it‚Äôs through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.

Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.

Multi-national organisation of globally loved Consumer Healthcare brands and exciting portfolio of OTC and VMS (multivitamin and supplement) brands!

Clean, air-conditioned, State-of-the-art facilities with manufacturing made on-site at our beautiful Brisbane based HQ

Highly collaborative and supportive team environment and working culture

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let‚Äôs be those people.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

title: Senior .Net Developer

title: Senior Software Engineer DevSecOps
description:

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
About ConnX
¬†
ConnX is a multi-award winning HR solution catering to medium-size enterprises across Australia and New Zealand. We‚Äôve been passionate about delivering world class software solutions and services to our clients for over 20 years and are embarking on a new phase of growth which is opening opportunities across our business.

¬†

About the Role...¬†

Are you a passionate leader ready to shape the future of software development, including leveraging the power of AI? We're seeking a dynamic Software Engineering Manager to join our high-performing development team. As a leader, you'll guide our team towards a cutting-edge tech stack, refine our architectural roadmap, and ensure timely software releases. Your expertise in agile delivery will be invaluable in streamlining our development process. If you're excited to mentor, innovate, and drive success, we invite you to apply. Challenge yourself by leading the migration of our legacy application to a modern tech stack.

¬†

How you'll make a difference...¬†
¬†
You are passionate about delivering insanely great products and solutions to complex technical and people problems.¬†By combining your technical superiority and your amazing people management talents, you will be the driving force behind our growing team of Developers and Quality Assurance Engineers.¬†
¬†
By working closely with your peers and reporting to the Head of Product, you will be in a fantastic position to shape our product and our work practices.¬†

¬†

What we‚Äôre asking you to do...¬†



‚Ä¢¬†Team Leadership: Build, mentor, and inspire a high-performing team, including leading the Quality Assurance Team to ensure quality manual testing and implement test automation. Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment and participate in the recruitment of new employees.¬†¬†

‚Ä¢¬†Agile Methodology: Drive the adoption and continuous improvement of SCRUM practices. Facilitate agile ceremonies (sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives). Have a full understanding of the projects in each release.¬†

‚Ä¢¬†Project Management: Oversee project planning, execution, and delivery. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and meet quality standards. Work closely with the Head of Product on delivering our feature roadmap.¬†

‚Ä¢¬†Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with product owners, business stakeholders, and other teams to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet business objectives. Report team metrics back to the business. Understand your audience and communicate effectively.¬†

‚Ä¢¬†Problem Solving: Identify and resolve technical challenges and roadblocks. Foster a culture of continuous improvement.¬†

‚Ä¢¬†Hands on Coding: Get hands-on when needed and take an active role in developing our product with physical code. We believe in people managers being able to ‚Äòwalk the talk‚Äô.¬†

¬†
What you need to be successful...¬†
¬†
Your people management experience will include:¬†

¬†
‚Ä¢¬†Leading .NET software development teams including Quality Assurance (not ICT teams);¬†
‚Ä¢ Hiring and onboarding technical roles and building, managing, and inspiring a software development team;¬†
‚Ä¢ Effective relationship skills supporting a collaborative and trusting stakeholder engagement approach;¬†
‚Ä¢ Self-motivated team player who is well organised, with effective communication and reporting skills;¬†
‚Ä¢ Effective problem-solving skills and a strong "nonsense" filter;¬†
¬†
¬†
Your process management experience will include:¬†

¬†
‚Ä¢ Leading the team from planning, resource allocation, design, coding, deployment, and support;¬†
‚Ä¢ Policy and process development and implementation, resource management and change management processes;¬†
‚Ä¢ CI/CD principles and practices;¬†
‚Ä¢ Experience with Agile or other iterative development methodologies. We use Scrum;¬†
‚Ä¢ Secure software development experience;¬†
‚Ä¢Test Automation;
¬†
¬†
Your technical experience will include:¬†

¬†
‚Ä¢ Being a .NET software developer so you know what it‚Äôs like to be hands on;¬†
‚Ä¢ Being aware of current web technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies, and software development best practices;¬†
‚Ä¢ Modern best practice web development disciplines, procedures, and policies;
‚Ä¢ Modernising legacy applications;
‚Ä¢ Understanding the potential of AI and its integration into software development workflows and applications;

¬†
¬†
Location¬†
¬†
The ‚Äòhome location‚Äô for this role is our office based in Milton, Brisbane.¬†That office is within easy walking distance to Park Road, shops and transportation, plus the office itself is modern with excellent facilities, lots of TVs, smartboards and other gadgets.¬†
¬†
¬†
Salary¬†
¬†
An attractive remuneration package is available based on your talent and experience.¬†
¬†
¬†
Apply Now¬†
¬†
If this role has your name written all over it and you have the experience and skills to strengthen our team, then we want to hear from you!¬†

¬†
ConnX welcomes and values diversity in the workplace.¬†

title: Software Engineering Lead
description:
At WorkCover Queensland our vision is to be the best worker‚Äôs compensation insurer, to make a positive difference to people‚Äôs lives and to keep Queenslanders working. Our flexible work environment allows you to be your best every day and contribute to the big picture.¬†¬†

You‚Äôll contribute to:¬†

¬†

You can find out more about our Employee Benefits by visiting Working at WorkCover Qld. ¬†
