title: Senior Back End Developer
description:
We are a leading AI firm dedicated to developing innovative solutions that transform industries and enhance human capabilities. Our team is composed of passionate professionals committed to pushing the boundaries of artificial intelligence and machine learning.

Job Overview:¬†

We are seeking an experienced Senior Backend Developer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain the server-side components of our AI-driven applications, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and security. You will collaborate closely with front-end developers, data scientists, and product managers to deliver seamless and efficient AI solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Backend Development: Design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable, and secure server-side applications and APIs using Node.js and TypeScript.
Cloud Architecture: Develop and manage cloud-based solutions, primarily utilizing Microsoft Azure services. Experience with AWS and self-hosting is advantageous.
Automation Flows: Implement and manage automation workflows to streamline processes and enhance system efficiency.
Agentic Architecture: Design and integrate agentic AI systems capable of autonomous decision-making and goal-oriented behaviour.
Collaboration: Work closely with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic, ensuring a cohesive and responsive user experience.
Database Management: Design and manage efficient database schemas, optimise queries, and ensure data integrity and security.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and enhance application performance, addressing bottlenecks, and ensuring responsiveness to front-end requests.
Security Implementation: Implement security best practices to protect data and applications from vulnerabilities and breaches.
Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, adhering to industry best practices and company standards.
Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
Innovation: Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends, evaluating and integrating new tools and methodologies to enhance development efficiency and product quality.

Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in backend development, preferably within AI or technology-driven environments.

Technical Proficiency:

Strong experience with server-side programming using Node.js and TypeScript.
Proficiency in designing and implementing Microsoft Azure architectures; relevant certifications are highly desirable.
Experience with Azure, AWS and self-hosting environments is preferred.
Proficiency in database management systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
Experience with RESTful API design and implementation.
Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Understanding of microservices architecture and distributed systems.
Experience with automation tools and frameworks to streamline development and deployment processes.
Knowledge of agentic AI architectures and their implementation in real-world applications.

Skills:

Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, agile development environment.
Demonstrated leadership and mentorship capabilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in AI and machine learning applications.
Knowledge of data processing frameworks and tools.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.
The chance to work on cutting-edge AI projects that make a real-world impact.

title: Senior Back End Developer - Max Term contract
description:
Who is Transmax?

Transmax is a transport solutions provider of the ITS platform, STREAMS. We exist to improve people‚Äôs quality of life and helps move millions of commuters around Australian road networks every day. We partner with customers to deliver creative solutions that optimise transport networks and support safer and more reliable road journeys.

It‚Äôs an exciting time in our history as we modernise our core STREAMS product and work with customers to enable the future of mobility.


About the role:

Transmax has grown significantly over the last 2 years, and we are not slowing down!

We‚Äôre in the next exciting stage of our growth phase which is why we are now recruiting for multiple Back-End Developers ‚Äì Level 3 (Senior) for max-term contracts.

The role of Senior Back-End Developer will see you be responsible for conceiving and creating a coordinated suite of cutting-edge microservices, applications and APIs to equip our end-users with the technology they need to achieve community outcomes.

You will work closely with your product team to consistently deliver high-quality, relevant products with rich ITS functionality, useability and performance.

Your day-to-day will include:

Undertake software design, development, maintenance and test coding/automation activities to implement microservices, applications and APIs compliant with an approved technical reference architecture.
Collaborate with other back-end developers and architects to identify and evaluate technology and process improvements to improve quality and commercial outcomes.
Actively lead and engage in contemporary software engineering practices, including use of coding guidelines, peer code reviews, test automation, knowledge sharing and team development, and by being a vocal supporter of scrum.
Document, present and communicate findings and actions so they become reliably repeatable, automating them wherever possible.
Inspire the continuous improvement of people, processes and technology, including mentoring and coaching junior team members, as required.
¬†

Requirements

About You:

Coming from a team-focused, outcome driven software-as-a-service environment you will be preferably tertiary-level qualified in Software Engineering, Information Technology or Computer Science; however, your professional experience is what is most important and how your skills can complement our team!

You will be:

An empathetic team player with excellent problem solving and communication skills, proficient when working using agile principles, roles and practices.
Experienced with working in a software-as-a-service environment that utilises DevOps and SRE practices to continuously develop, test, deploy and support scalable, highly available software services.
Proficient in developing cloud-native microservices, applications and APIs using technologies such as C# / .NET Core, containerised workloads (e.g. Docker), in-memory databases (e.g. Redis), message queues (e.g. RabbitMQ) and related technologies.
Comfortable working in both Windows and Linux environments, and with utilising both on-prem and public cloud infrastructure, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Adept with internet protocols and application interface technologies such as REST, gRPC, JSON, XML and Protobuf.
Experienced with SQL and NoSQL (e.g. Elasticsearch) database technologies.
Competent with source code control and CI/CD pipeline technologies.

¬†

Benefits

What does Transmax offer?

We offer:

A competitive salary
A high-trust, high-empowering, openly supportive working environment & culture
WFH options (2 days in office per week)
Uncapped training budgets to support your career development
Employee Assistance Program with access up to 12 sessions
Excellent EPPL scheme
A recently renovated office in Milton (with some pretty great views, if you ask us)
Corporate private health discounts through Bupa
Flexible working hours & arrangements (the right to disconnect & enjoy life!)
Lots of support for your career plans and advancement
An environment where you‚Äôre encouraged to succeed.


With our culture of recognition, career development, and a supportive and stimulating and satisfying work environment - your next career chapter is waiting for you at Transmax.

If you‚Äôre interested in pursuing this opportunity, please apply by submitting your CV and a brief cover letter outlining your experience and suitability for the role. We would love to hear from you!


Successful applicants will be subject to a National Criminal History Check and a Qualification check.
Applicants must hold full working rights within Australia.
We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Cyber and Software Engineer
description:
L3Harris Communication Systems Australia

Senior Cyber and Software Engineer

Hamilton, Brisbane

¬†

If you‚Äôre ready to take the next step in your career developing innovative Battlespace Communications Systems solutions, the Land C4 (Command, Control, Communications & Computers) Sovereign Capability team are seeking a talented Senior Cyber & Software Engineer experienced in Software development with a focus on Information Security and accreditation. The successful applicant will support cyber worthiness of Land C4 Mission Systems and could extend design and develop core features that manage and control the data plane of deployed communication networks.

Applicants that have expertise in Software Defined Networking (or the ability to develop) is considered highly desirable.

¬†

What the role will involve

The responsibilities of the role will include the following:

Ensure Mission Systems are security accredited and operationally supported through ongoing management of accreditation documentation and reporting

Work closely with the customer and business support teams to ensure security protection needs are implemented, system maintenance requirements are met, and incident response requirements are managed.

Develop and maintain software components within an Agile, Systems Engineering-based environment

Product improvement through innovation

Develop low-level requirements, design and verification procedures

Improve system performance through analysis, review & defect fixing

Contribute to and lead security discussion at customer workshops and technical reviews.

¬†

What you‚Äôll bring

The role requires the following experience and skills:

Extensive Experinece in Software Engineering

Minimum 2+ years cyber security experience

Tertiary qualifications in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, or an equivalent

Proven development skills within the following areas:

Object-oriented Development (Java/C#)

RESTful application development

Networking protocols (e.g. ICMP, RIP, PIM)

IPv4/IPv6 unicast/multicast routing, VLANs, VXLANs

Secure network & encryption standards (SSL/TLS, AES/SHA)

Some experience in frontend or backend web development (e.g. React, C#.NET)

Experience with network security and networking technologies with system, security and network monitoring tools

Practical implementation of ISM and DSPF requirements, ICT or Cyber Industry Training and/or demonstrable knowledge

Strong communication skills

¬†

About L3Harris Communication Systems and this opportunity

L3Harris Communication Systems is a Brisbane based subsidiary of L3Harris Technologies and part of our Tactical Communications Division. We are a world leader in ground tactical and airborne mission radio solutions and a global provider of ground based C4 systems and transportable SATCOM terminals. We are focused on delivering advanced systems to meet the needs of our customers, uniting multiple forms of communication together, and covering communication over air, ground, sea, and space. L3Harris Technologies is a trusted sovereign design and production partner to the Australian Department of Defence and an established exporter to global defence primes.

A few of our employee benefits are:

5 Weeks annual leave

9 day fortnight option

Flexible working hours

Flexible annual leave (buy & sell up to 2 weeks)

Salary continuance insurance (SCI pays 75% of your base salary and bonus for up to¬†2 years)

Discounted private health insurance

Life & Total Permanent Disability Cover

Novated Car Leasing

¬†

Important to know

Due to the nature of our work many our roles require an Australian nationality and the ability to obtain a security clearance. Applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment must meet eligibility.

Eligibility and clearance process information can be found at;

https://www.defence.gov.au/security/clearances/about/overview

L3Harris respectfully requests no agency submissions at this time.

title: Automation & AI Process Flow Engineer | n8n, Relevance.ai
description:
Position Title:

Automation & AI Process Flow Engineer

Role Overview

As our Automation & AI Process Flow Engineer, you will be responsible for identifying, designing, and implementing workflow automations that integrate multiple systems, including Pipedrive, Zendesk, WooCommerce, and Unleashed. You will partner with cross-functional teams to capture requirements and deliver secure, scalable solutions that reduce manual workloads and enhance our ability to respond to real-time business needs.

Key Responsibilities

Automation & Workflow Development

Create and maintain automated workflows using platforms like n8n, Relevance.ai, and Blaze.ai.

Define process-flow requirements in collaboration with Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, and Software Engineering teams.

Systems Integration

Integrate various platforms (CRM, eCommerce, ERP, support tools) to enable seamless data exchange and process consistency.

Troubleshoot issues and develop robust fixes or enhancements.

Data Analytics & AI Implementation

Leverage AI/ML models to deliver predictive insights, automate decision-making, and optimize resource allocation.

Develop reporting dashboards or analytics solutions to help stakeholders monitor key performance metrics.

Continuous Improvement

Conduct regular audits of existing automations and system integrations; recommend improvements and implement best practices.

Stay updated on new AI tools and automation solutions that can benefit the company.

Collaboration & Communication

Work closely with stakeholders to document needs, set priorities, and manage expectations.

Clearly communicate technical concepts and solution designs to non-technical team members.

Security & Compliance

Ensure all solutions meet data protection standards (e.g., GDPR), organizational security policies, and other relevant regulations.

Maintain appropriate access controls and system permissions.

Qualifications & Skills

Technical Expertise: Experience with n8n or similar workflow automation platforms (e.g., Zapier, Make), and familiarity with AI-driven tools (Relevance.ai, Blaze.ai).

Integration Skills: Knowledge of API integration methods, data mapping, and best practices for syncing platforms like Pipedrive, Zendesk, WooCommerce, and Unleashed.

Programming Abilities: Proficiency in one or more scripting languages (Python, JavaScript) to create custom functions and connectors.

Analytical Mindset: Ability to apply AI/ML methodologies for data analysis and automation, turning data-driven insights into practical solutions.

Communication & Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate business needs into technical tasks and explain complex concepts to stakeholders.

Project Management: Experience planning, organizing, and executing projects from concept to completion, ensuring on-time delivery.

Preferred Attributes

Previous experience working in a cross-functional environment, aligning multiple stakeholders.

Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices in securing integrated systems.

Experience in an Agile or DevOps environment, collaborating with software engineering teams.

Why Join Us?

Opportunity to shape the future of automation and AI within our organization.

A supportive team environment that encourages continuous learning and professional development.

Competitive remuneration package (base salary + superannuation) and potential for additional benefits.

How to Apply

Include your resume

Please include examples or descriptions of past automation or AI projects you‚Äôve worked on.

title: Technical Lead
description:
¬†

Take hold of a monster opportunity as a Technical Lead in our Digital Applications team. If you‚Äôre a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we‚Äôd love you to apply.

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role
We‚Äôre all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. Australian Retirement Trust (ART) is looking for a Technical Lead to join our Digital Applications team on a permanent basis. In this role, you'll be at the forefront of ensuring our technology aligns with and supports our business strategy. You'll work closely with our internal architecture team, cross-organisational stakeholders, vendors, and technical specialists to lead the development and design of cutting-edge technology platforms. Your expertise will be crucial in promoting high-quality solution design, championing governance standards, and implementing best practices.

As a Technical Lead at ART, you'll provide effective technical leadership, manage risks, and foster collaboration and mentoring within the team. If you're ready to make a significant impact and help us drive technical innovation and stability, we want to hear from you!

About you
It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you‚Äôll tick some of the following boxes too:

Demonstrable experience with Agile delivery methodologies (SAFe, SCRUM etc) including Agile solution design and documentation techniques.
Demonstrable knowledge of Solution Architecture processes, methods and frameworks.
Demonstrable extensive experience in IT, with proven experience in roles relevant to Technology Architecture or Systems Analysis within a large or mid-sized corporate environment.

Demonstrated experience in communicating effectively with business stakeholders, vendors, technical specialists, and management.

Our 2.3 million members trust us to take care of almost $300 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you‚Äôll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now
Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close midnight Sunday, 13 April 2025.

We don‚Äôt want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you‚Äôll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you‚Äôve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us ‚Äì and recruitment is no different.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:

How to Apply

title: Graduate Systems Engineer
description:
The Opportunity

We are a seeking talented Graduate Systems Engineers to join the Boeing Defence Australia Graduate Program in Adelaide, Brisbane and Williamtown. This program offers graduates a permanent full-time position, providing a solid career foundation from day one.

Graduate opportunities are across a range of engineering business units at Boeing which include:

E-7A Wedgetail - The centrepiece of Australia's national air defence capability, incorporating powerful airborne surveillance, communications and battle management capability.
MQ-28 Ghost Bat - Development and integration of mission systems for uncrewed teaming aircraft designed to be a force multiplier in support of advanced multi-mission air combat operations.
Sustainment Operations - Maintenance, repair, overhaul and upgrades of military aircraft including F/A-18F Super Hornets, CH-47F Chinooks and P-8A Poseidons, as well as training design and delivery.
Joint Systems - Design, development and sustainment of defence communications systems and networks.

As a Graduate Systems Engineeryou will:

Analyze customer requirements alongside the development of innovative solutions that ensure the full product lifecycle is optimized.
Coordinate with other design and specialty disciplines (e.g. software, hardware, safety, security and support system engineering) to ensure that your team's products are properly integrated into the solution and delivered in a way that delights the customer.
Verify and validate designs and products to ensure they meet operational and functional requirements.
Develop engineering documentation and support configuration management of the system.
Communicate and collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team in a conscientious and inclusive way to successfully deliver innovative solutions to the Australian Defence Force.

Your attitude, motivation, willingness to learn and ability to self-task under supervision will determine your success in our team!

Education

Tertiary degree qualification in an engineering, computer science or information technology (or anticipated graduation before July 2025).

Eligibility

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet Defence security requirements.

How to apply

Please submit your CV together with a cover letter and your university transcript to be considered.

Our Graduate Program

Our 24-month Graduate Program is designed to equip you with essential skills for a successful transition into full-time work, while also fostering your growth into an experienced professional. Throughout the program, you will engage in professional learning and development, as well as social and collaborative opportunities to expand your Boeing network.

While the Graduate Program has defined learning objectives and a structured framework, your individual journey will be tailored in collaboration with your manager, shaped by business needs and your personal professional development goals. To enhance your exposure and learning, you will remain within one business unit for the entire duration of the program, allowing you to immerse yourself in team dynamics and project work. Over these 24 months, you will not only acquire the technical skills necessary for your role but also develop the interpersonal skills that are vital for a fulfilling career.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.¬† Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with an inclusive team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place.¬† From the seabed to outer space you can contribute to work that matters.¬† We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth.¬† Find your future with us.

As an equal opportunity employer, female candidates, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

Benefits

Cutting edge projects
Flexible working options
Discounts for travel and accommodation
Salary packaging options
Health and wellbeing benefits
Study assistance

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader, click Apply Now.

Applications Close:¬†Wednesday 30 April 2025

¬†

title: Software Development Team Leader (C# .Net React)
description:

title: Kubernetes Platform Engineer (remote)
description:
This global gaming business is migrating away from AWS to a new Kubernetes platform that is currently being built.

Reporting to the Australian based Engineering Manager you will be the first of a small local team to join the global business and help administer and build the platform.

The role will see you design, build and maintain a Kubernetes based Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure Platform as well as implement and manage scalable secure and resilient infrastructure solutions across on-premises and cloud environments.

You will implement automation, orchestration and Network / Data security solutions, as well as deploy and maintain monitoring and observability tools.

You will also build and manage Docker containing images and ensure their seamless deployment on Kubernetes clusters.

The successful candidate will have hands on experience with infrastructure engineering with a focus on Kubernetes. You must have experience administering a Kubernetes platform where you have installed, managed and operated a cluster.

Importantly you will enjoy working in a smaller - semi start up type environment, where there is greater freedom to make decisions and move things forward at pace, where you can see problems, propose solutions and execute the solutions. Whilst there are daily standups, it will be up to you to actively engage with the team (local and international).

title: Product Engineer
description:
Join a consultancy firm that's changing the landscape of healthcare and public services in Australia and worldwide!
Earn $150,000 - $170,000 p.a. + bonuses + superannuation
Flexible working arrangements available, WFH anywhere within Australia, with occasional co-working in Sydney
Our Story:

Rebbeck is a boutique international consultancy transforming health systems and public services through commissioning practices. Our team brings strategic, collaborative thinking to solve some of the most pressing challenges in health and social care, creating real impact for people and communities.

Our work is underpinned by five core values:

People: We put people first, fostering a high-performing and socially conscious
team where everyone thrives and grows.
Impact: We deliver meaningful outcomes, driving lasting change for people and
communities.
Insights: We apply real-world insights to inspire positive change, becoming a
trusted voice for system transformation.
Clients: We support long-term transformation, providing advice that empowers and builds client capability.
Sustainability: We are growing a vibrant company, building a sustainable and thriving business.
Your Next Opportunity:

Rebbeck is looking for a full-time Product Engineer to join our dynamic and collaborative team based remotely from anywhere within Australia, with monthly/bi-monthly travel to Sydney. This role focuses on optimising workflows, leveraging AI-driven productivity, and enhancing internal processes to support our consulting work.

More specifically, your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Developing and refining AI-enabled products and digital tools
Automating processes to enhance operational efficiency
Integrating AI tools to improve structured thinking and insights
Designing and implementing workflow automation using Power Automate and Microsoft 365
Supporting the development of best practices in business process engineering
Providing training and guidance to colleagues on products, workflows and AI-tools as relevant
What You‚Äôll Bring to the Team:

To qualify, you will need:

A bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a relevant field (preferred but not essential)
5+ years of experience as a Product Developer, Product Engineer, Product Analyst or similar, preferably in a professional services setting
Strong technical expertise in Microsoft 365, Power Automate, SharePoint, and Power BI
Experience in workflow automation, process optimisation, and ML Ops
Proficiency in VBA, Python, or other scripting languages
Familiarity with AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and Perplexity
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills

Additionally, the following skills and background will be highly valued:

Knowledge of Zapier, VBA scripting, and automation tools
Experience integrating AI tools with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Exposure to public services, healthcare, or consulting environments
Understanding of finance systems, CRM tools, and project management platforms

As our ideal candidate, you will possess the following soft skills and attributes:

A structured, process-driven thinker who can systematise consulting methodologies
A growth mindset, eager to continuously learn and apply the latest AI advancements
Resourceful and innovative, capable of delivering high-value solutions with limited budgets
An effective communicator and collaborator, able to work cross-functionally in a remote setting

Be Rewarded:

In addition to a competitive salary of circa $150,000 - $170,000 p.a. (commensurate with skills and experience) + bonuses + superannuation, you will receive a host of generous benefits from Rebbeck, including:

Flexible working arrangements ‚Äì Work remotely with occasional Sydney co-working sessions
5 weeks of paid annual leave
Ongoing professional development opportunities
Career development in AI tool design, automation, and strategic deployment
An inclusive and diverse workplace committed to equity and inclusion

Ready to Apply?

If you‚Äôre an experienced Product Engineer looking to join a high-impact organisation, we want to hear from you - apply now!

title: Senior Analyst Programmer
description:
The Opportunity

Our energy sector client is looking to hire a talented and experienced Senior Analyst Programmer to assist with the development of a new energy trading platform, contributing to the design, development, and maintenance of software solutions with a focus on modern technologies. Experience with .Net Core, Microservices (Docker and Kubernetes) and Vue, Angular or React is essential.

Monitoring and managing production solutions, including capacity planning and server configurations.
Mentoring and coaching team members, fostering adherence to best practices and development standards.
Ensuring alignment with architectural frameworks and conducting code reviews to maintain quality


About You

In order to be a successful applicant, you will have extensive experience in software development and product delivery. You will also have:

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
The opportunity

The Boeing MQ28 - Ghost Bat is a globally-significant program that will deliver a disruptive advantage to support Defence operational capabilities. Developed in partnership with the Royal Australian Air Force, it is the first military combat aircraft to be designed, manufactured and assembled in Australia in 50 years.

Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) are seeking an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to support the integration, verification and test of new capabilities within the MQ-28 Ghost Bat.

The role is based in Brisbane but may also be performed from Williamtown.

As an experienced Senior Systems Engineer you will:

Lead, develop and document verification strategies for the MQ-28 System.
Lead and develop verification requirements, test plans, procedures and reports.
Coordinate and chair Test Readiness Reviews and other pertinent design reviews.
Coordinate, plan and conduct integration and formal verification testing.
Collaborate to develop design solutions that meet the capability objectives and requirements of the MQ-28 System.
Support ground and flight test operations for the MQ-28 System.
Lead and develop engineering documentation (Specifications, Design Documents, Interface Definitions, Test Procedures etc) to support development of ground test equipment.


To be considered for the role you will have:

Minimum of 7 years' experience in complex technical development and integration projects
Hold Tertiary qualifications in either Aerospace, Avionics, Electrical or Mechatronics, that satisfies the requirements for membership with Engineers Australia (MIEAust) or equivalent technical experience in a Systems Engineering discipline.
Demonstrated experience in systems and software development lifecycle.
Demonstrated experience in integration, verification & testing.
Experience with aircraft avionics and UAV systems (desirable).
Familiarity with engineering change processes.
Experience with requirements management tools (DOORS) and Model Based Systems Engineering methods (highly regarded)
Experience with Agile delivery methodologies (highly regarded)
Experience with Autonomous Systems projects (highly regarded)
Experience with aerospace and / or Defence projects (highly regarded.)

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet Defence security requirements.


You may require a Foreign Work Authorisation (FWA) in order to perform this role. This is not a requirement set or determined by Boeing but by the Department of Defence under laws issued in 2024.

What's on offer?

Boeing values the health and wellbeing of our employees and offer true flexibility including working from home, compressed work weeks, and opportunities for part time arrangements, allowing you to balance your career with what is important to you outside of work.

Other benefits:

Work on cutting edge projects with opportunities to work across platforms.
Attractive remuneration and annual bonus.
Formal mentoring and training as well as on the job learning.
Formal reward and recognition program.
Access discounts for health insurance, travel and accommodation.
Paid study leave, paid parental leave and Defence leave.
Salary packaging options available.
Health and wellbeing benefits including annual flu vaccinations and Employee Assistance Program.
Social and community groups.

BDA works with strong links with our global Boeing community and we strongly encourage collaboration with our international counterparts.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and veterans are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

¬†

title: Ubuntu Linux Kernel Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are hiring Linux Kernel Engineers for different levels. Canonical has a large and rapidly growing kernel team that underpins Ubuntu and open source more widely across a very wide range of hardware and use cases. We partner with the biggest kernel contributors - the silicon companies - to ensure that their work reaches the widest possible audience as quickly¬† as possible, with a 10 year enterprise security commitment.

The Canonical Linux Kernel Team is responsible for developing and maintaining all supported Ubuntu Linux kernels, which run on a variety of platforms and architectures from small embedded devices to standard desktop/server systems to large-scale cloud environments. ¬†

¬†

Location: This is a remote role

¬†

The role entails

Collaborating regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team

Learning from senior mentors to demystify the inner workings of the Linux kernel and how it is distributed

Working closely with external silicon, cloud, or hardware manufacturer delivery teams on bleeding-edge platforms

Diagnosing and resolving issues in the kernel reported by customers, the community, and discovered by your own rigorous testing

Being responsible for the delivery of various flavors of the Ubuntu Linux kernel

Improving tooling and automation for delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels

Submitting, reviewing, and applying kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers

¬†

What we are looking for in you

Well-organized and motivated self-starter able to thrive in a remote work environment requiring proactive engagement with colleagues rather than being passively directed

Demonstrated ability to present oneself in a professional manner when interacting with colleagues, business partners, and the open-source community

Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral

Programming experience in C

Familiarity with version control practices, ideally with git

Understanding of operating system kernel fundamentals

Willingness to travel internationally 2-4 times a year for internal events

¬†

Nice to have skills¬†

Python and Bash scripting ability

Prior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging

Demonstrated experience with kernel patching and debugging

Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP‚Äôs, and other low level system engineering

¬†

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person

Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year

Annual compensation review

Recognition rewards

Annual holiday leave

Maternity and paternity leave

Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform

Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues

Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

¬†

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004.‚Äã Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

¬†

title: Software Development Project Manager
description:
About us

NXTwork (rebranded to ‚ÄòCode Squirrel‚Äô) is a software development company focusing on delivering innovative and creative solutions to our clients. ¬†We take a very modern approach to software development, with teams of mixed specialities sharing the work across multiple projects. title: Senior System Safety Engineer
description:
The Opportunity

¬†We are seeking a talented Senior System Safety Engineer to join BDA in growing the capabilities of the world leading communications and battle management systems.

Battlespace Communications System (BCS) is a next generation networking product that is the centerpiece for multiple projects and campaigns. The BCS combines both developmental and off the shelf hardware and software to provide world leading communications capability for ADF personnel. It can be rapidly deployed from anywhere, and its modular design provides a flexible, scalable solution that can be customized for various mission needs.

Inclusivity is part of who we are, and our leaders will be committed and active participants in creation of a diverse, and inclusive culture.

The role is based in Brisbane (QLD) - support for relocation from other locations will also be considered.

Responsibilities:

Perform Systems Engineering activities to plan, design, develop and verify systems specialising in the System Safety domain.
Support projects in understanding requirements and design implications pertaining to System Safety and identify potential and realised performance and safety considerations.¬†
Provide guidance and mentorship to junior team members.
Lead specific scopes of work in System Safety engineering for projects.
Actively promote the benefit of System Safety across the organisation and contribute to the development and growth of these disciplines within BDA.

Experience/Qualifications

Essential:

Tertiary degree qualification in an engineering or related technical discipline;
Experience in Systems Engineering or Safety Engineering in a complex project environment;
Demonstrated experience in the application of safety-related legislation, standards and safety engineering techniques to product design
Excellent communication skills that enable you to influence outcomes in a team environment;
A continuous improvement mindset;
Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

Desirable:

Experience within Defence or complex engineering project environments;
Preferably RPEQ or CPEng qualified in a relevant discipline or able to gain RPEQ/CPEng certification.
Understanding of Systems Engineering principles and lifecycle management;
Experience developing and executing against Systems Engineering artifacts including Systems Engineering Management Plan and Verification and Validation Plan;
Experience in technical problem solving;
Experience in soliciting, analyzing and communicating customer requirements in a cross-disciplinary technical environment.

We invite a diverse range of people to apply, including people from outside of the defence industry.

¬†

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force.¬† As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.¬† Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place.¬†¬†

¬†

Benefits

Flexible working options
Study assistance
Salary packaging
Employee Incentive Program
Global opportunities

¬†Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

title: Senior Mobile Engineer
description:
At Swyftx, we're not just building a fintech scaleup; we're shaping the future of Australia's digital currency industry. With over 800,000 users, we have our sights set high, aiming to be Australia's most trusted cryptocurrency trading platform, bridging the gap between defi and tradfi, and expanding to become Australia‚Äôs next global success story.¬†¬†¬†

This is more than just a job‚Äîit's an opportunity to shape the future of an industry leader. As a Senior Mobile Engineer at Swyftx, you'll play a key role in planning, designing, leading, and delivering mobile solutions that ensure our customers have an exceptional experience on iOS and Android. We're looking for someone with deep expertise in React Native, iOS, and Android development, who can drive engineering excellence and innovation. With a passion for mentorship, you'll also support and guide junior and mid-level team members, helping them develop their skills and grow within the team.¬†
¬†
Please note this is a Brisbane based role, and we have hybrid working, with two days per week in our beautiful Milton office. ¬†
¬†
How we work¬†

We are organised in product squads, with a product manager, designer and tech lead in each, along with anywhere from 3 to 6 engineers.¬†
Squads are responsible for domains such as deposits, trading and customer onboarding, and look after setting roadmap for delivery of major new features/products, optimising existing features/products, and dealing with tech debt.¬†
What we build¬†

Our stack is Node.js, AWS and React/React Native.¬†
Our trading platform needs to be highly scalable to deal with sharp peaks in the market.¬†
As custodians of our customers‚Äô money, security is also a key consideration in how we engineer things.¬†
With over 800,000 customers, we place a lot of emphasis on design and user experience so that our customers can have the easiest-to-use and most trustworthy experience.¬†
Some of your key responsibilities in this role will include:¬†

Develop and maintain high-performance mobile applications using React Native, ensuring a seamless user experience on both iOS and Android.¬†
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, front-end and back-end developers, to deliver feature-rich applications.¬†
Translate design mock-ups and wireframes into responsive, functional components while ensuring UI/UX consistency.¬†
Write clean, reusable, and efficient code, following best practices and coding standards.¬†
Optimize applications for speed, performance, and scalability.¬†
Conduct code reviews and provide mentorship to junior and mid-level developers to foster knowledge sharing and maintain code quality.¬†
Troubleshoot and debug issues, identify performance bottlenecks, and implement effective solutions.¬†
Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, tools, and best practices in mobile development and React Native.¬† ¬†
To be successful you will have:¬†

Extensive experience developing mobile applications using React Native.¬†
Exposure to iOS and Android development, with some understanding of their respective ecosystems.¬†
Proficiency in mobile security best practices, ensuring secure and reliable application development.¬†
Passion for creating exceptional user experiences, with a focus on performance, accessibility, and customer value.¬†
Experience writing testable code and working with mobile testing frameworks to maintain code quality and reliability.¬†
Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with a focus on collaboration and delivering effective solutions.¬†
A strong product mindset, with a deep understanding of how users interact with mobile applications.¬†
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapting to new challenges and driving continuous improvement.¬†
Some of our perks and benefits include:¬†

Fully stocked kitchen, breakfast and lunch foods, unlimited fresh fruit and snacks.¬†¬†
An inhouse barista and weekly catered lunches on a Wednesday.¬†
Unlimited fee-free trading.¬†

title: IOS Engineer (Remote)
description:
Start your game...

As an iOS Engineer at Entain Australia & New Zealand, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the technical foundation that powers our new Ladbrokes and neds platforms. This role is focused on building and enhancing the core capabilities that enable other teams to excel, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency across our systems.

Your mission will centre around developing robust internal tools, libraries, and frameworks that empower teams across the organization. You‚Äôll also propose and implement architectural improvements to streamline development processes, improve system performance, and drive innovation across our platforms.

Where and how you can work...

This position can be based in any of our offices across Australia or New Zealand. We embrace flexibility by offering a hybrid working model, allowing employees to spend two days a week in the office to promote work-life balance and accommodate individual preferences. This role is open to remote candidates across Australia & New Zealand.


Your day-to-day...

Develop internal tools and frameworks to simplify workflows, enhance productivity, and ensure consistency across projects.
Create and maintain shared libraries that promote reusability, scalability, and adherence to best practices.
Identify and implement architectural enhancements, uncovering opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness while driving the adoption of innovative solutions to optimize platform performance and reliability.
Advocate for the mobile platform and collaborate with engineering and design teams to establish best practices and leverage native frameworks effectively.
Support the development lifecycle, from ideation and design to deployment and continuous improvement.
Mentor and guide other engineers, setting technical standards and promoting knowledge sharing within the team.
Advocate for the mobile platform and collaborate with engineering and design teams to establish best practices and leverage native frameworks effectively.

What you'll bring...

Commercial experience with Swift 6,¬†is an absolute requirement for this role.
Commercial experience in building and maintaining iOS applications using Swift and SwiftUI.
Expertise in architectural design and implementing changes for performance, scalability, and reliability.
Commercial experience with iOS frameworks such as UIKit, Core Data, and Combine.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
A collaborative mindset and effective communication skills.

Entain Lifestyle...

Embrace your need for a work-life balance through our 9-day fortnight.
Celebrate the joy of starting a family with 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
Indulge in a range of wellness benefits through our wellness calendar, including heavily subsidised gym memberships and other paid-for services.
Enjoy the convenience of a free onsite barista and a fully stocked fridge and pantry, ensuring breakfast and lunch are taken care of.
Company-wide events designed to honour and celebrate the outstanding achievements of our exceptional team.
We LOVE Entertainment, and Racing and Sports are at the heart of everything we do. So, it only makes sense that we provide access to staff giveaways to sporting and racing events.

Who we are?

At Entain Australia & New Zealand, we're on a mission to revolutionise the world of sports and gaming venue entertainment. We're the home of Australia and New Zealand's best gaming and tech talent, with a passion for pushing boundaries and creating unforgettable experiences.

We have a host of leading brands under the Entain umbrella ‚Äì our customers can experience the best of sports betting and entertainment with Ladbrokes Australia and neds, where together they provide thrilling avenues for sports enthusiasts and racing aficionados alike. Through Entain Venues, our venue partners offer non-stop entertainment through our line-up of brands from the Australian Poker League and SportsPick to the challenges of InnQUIZitive and many more.

We're also proud to support racing and sport in New Zealand through our 25-year strategic partnership with TAB NZ. The TAB brand in New Zealand connects enthusiasts to the heart of the action, whether it's horse racing, greyhounds, or a variety of thrilling sports.


A culture where you belong

As a global employer, Entain is committed to providing a safe, fun, and inclusive culture where our people feel like they truly belong. We are a multicultural business that values, celebrates and respects individual differences, so whatever your sexuality, gender, gender identity, ability, age, race, religion, or belief, you will have a voice here, and the space to do your best work. Our diverse internal networks provide support for you to express your views and make a positive difference.

For more information, please reach out to us at careers@entaingroup.com.au or hit apply now.

title: Firmware Test Engineer
description:
EM Solutions (EMS) is a Brisbane based growing high tech company with operations across the globe.¬†As a world leader in the design and manufacture of ‚Äúon-the-move‚Äù satellite communication terminals, we are proud to offer an exciting and innovative workplace with a talented workforce.¬†

We are looking for a motivated individual who will be responsible for designing and implementing testing frameworks used to validate the company‚Äôs satellite communications products.¬†

Duties and responsibilities:

Design, develop and improve the testing framework for various embedded product platforms
Test firmware and software releases to ensure requirements are met
Document test design and procedure
Provide engineering support to the Manufacturing team
Introduce new ideas, techniques to improve existing and upcoming projects
Follow the EM Solutions Quality and WHS requirements

Skills and competencies required:

Proficient with scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash, TCL).
Advanced understanding of neworking funtionatlity and features
Knowledge of test engineering, with a focus on embedded systems or Linux-based devices
Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team
Strong communication skills, including documentation and working effectively with other group members

Desired experience & qualifications:

Degree in electronics/digital/software or other relevant engineering field¬†
Industry experience would be preferable but not essential
Competent with Python, Git and Jira
Possession of, or the ability to qualify for, an Australian defence security clearance (baseline minimum, NV1 preferred)

As part of the recruitment process, candidates will be required to confirm their right to work in Australia (must be Australian citizenship) and successfully complete pre-employment checks (professional references, police clearance, proof of qualifications and ITAR screening).

EM Solutions does not accept unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles from external agencies or suppliers via any method.¬†

title: Technical Engineering Lead
Technical Lead (AI-Focused)
salary: Earn a Competitive Salary + Super & benefits!
description:
NetEngine: From Software Development to AI Innovation

For over a decade, NetEngine has been delivering digital innovation, building custom software solutions that empower businesses across industries‚Äîincluding travel, healthcare, recruitment, government, and not-for-profits. Our expertise in workflow automation, data visualisation, and legacy system integrations has helped clients stay ahead with intuitive, scalable technology.

Now, we are embedding AI-driven solutions to automate workflows, enhance decision-making, and create powerful, intelligent user experiences. Our team has already been integrating AI into business solutions, including:

AI-powered automation to streamline business processes and improve efficiency.
Machine learning models that enhance decision-making in client applications.
AI-driven chatbots and customer experiences to streamline interactions.
Predictive analytics that help businesses forecast trends and optimise operations.
The Opportunity: Lead AI-Driven Development at NetEngine

As part of Scout Talent Group, NetEngine is scaling AI adoption across its software solutions, and we‚Äôre looking for a Technical Lead (AI-Focused) to help drive this evolution.

We‚Äôre looking for a technical leader with deep experience in software engineering and a strong understanding of AI‚Äôs practical applications. In this role, you‚Äôll drive our AI development roadmap, mentor a high-performing engineering team, and help shape the future of AI adoption for our clients.

Your Impact
Shape NetEngine‚Äôs AI Roadmap ‚Äì Guide the adoption of AI-first development strategies.
Develop Industry-Leading AI Solutions ‚Äì Embed AI into client solutions to drive efficiency and creativity.
Inspire and Lead a High-Performing Team ‚Äì Mentor developers and oversee AI-driven projects.
Drive Innovation and Growth ‚Äì Deliver AI-powered solutions that create real business impact.
What Makes This Role Unique?

At NetEngine, we believe in the power of in-person collaboration. While many developers prefer remote work, we are intentionally building a high-energy, creative, and collaborative in-office culture. If you believe that innovation happens best when great minds come together, and you‚Äôre excited to create an environment where AI developers thrive, this is the place for you.

This is not a remote or hybrid role. We know this goes against the grain, and we are proud of it. If you thrive in an environment where collaboration, fast decision-making, and real-time problem-solving are key, this is the role for you.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
Technical leadership experience in AI-driven software teams.
Hands-on expertise in Ruby on Rails, .NET, front-end/back-end development.
A track record of delivering AI solutions‚Äîbeyond research, with real-world application.
Ability to balance high-level strategy with hands-on leadership.
A passion for driving automation, efficiency, and innovation.
A strong belief in in-office collaboration to foster creativity and success.
Why Join NetEngine?

Be at the forefront of AI innovation. This is a rare opportunity to shape how businesses adopt AI at scale.

Lead a transformation. NetEngine is evolving, and this is your chance to define what‚Äôs next.

Work with an ambitious, high-performing team. Our culture thrives on innovation, collaboration, and making a real impact.

Have the license to create. You‚Äôll have the freedom to build an in-office environment that makes NetEngine the best place to work for AI engineers.

Vibrant team culture and experiences. From Tour de Office charity events to our exclusive Global Gathering for top performers, we reward and celebrate success.

Career development and leadership opportunities. Any team member can apply for leadership roles, and we nurture professional growth through training and collaboration.

A vibrant office environment. Our Brisbane HQ offers stunning riverside views, easy access to transport, and conveniently positioned near a variety of dining and lifestyle facilities.

Next Steps: Let‚Äôs Connect

Tell us about yourself and how you see AI shaping the future of business. Apply now and be part of our AI-driven future.

title: Senior Engineer - Syft Integration
salary: 5 weeks leave and own a part of Xero with shares!
description:
Our Purpose¬†

At Xero, we‚Äôre here to help you supercharge your business. We do this by automating routine tasks, surfacing actionable insights and connecting businesses with the right data, advisors and apps. When that happens, we‚Äôre not only making life better for small business, we‚Äôll be building a stronger economy that can change the world.

About the team:

This specific position is pivotal in supporting the integration of Syft Analytics into our ecosystem to accelerate our mission to provide powerful insights. Syft Analytics is a leading global cloud-based reporting, insights, and analytics platform.

For more information, please check out the link below on a post from our CEO, Sukhinder Singh Cassidy!

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/sukhinders_we-are-thrilled-to-share-that-xero-is-acquiring-activity-7241591849751060480-QmjZ/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop

About the role:

As a Senior Software Engineer at Xero, you‚Äôll play a crucial role in building reliable, scalable solutions. You‚Äôll contribute directly to our products while helping your team adopt strong development practices.

This is a hands-on, "on the tools" role. You'll play a key role in integrating analytics tools into our ecosystem and building beautiful analytics from the ground up, creating experiences that turn complex data into clear, actionable insights for our customers.

What you'll do:

Deliver impactful projects: Take ownership of semi-annual/annual outcomes, ensuring successful delivery while improving team effectiveness.

Lead by example: Act as a role model for engineering excellence, promoting best practices and guiding the team in adopting effective processes.

Support team growth: Provide mentorship and technical guidance, helping teammates develop their skills and grow professionally.

Drive improvement: Identify and implement enhancements to team workflows, ensuring scalable and efficient delivery of high-quality solutions.

Foster collaboration: Build strong, productive relationships with cross-functional teams to align efforts and achieve shared goals.

What you'll bring with you:

Proficiency in .NET and React is essential, as these will be core technologies in your day-to-day work.

Previous experience as a Senior Software Engineer, with a track record of delivering high-quality software solutions at scale.

Deep understanding of the full development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and deployment.

Experience auditing codebases to maintain high standards for security, scalability, and testability, while ensuring code changes are manageable and efficient.

Ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences, including engineers, product managers, and stakeholders.

Skilled in contributing to or facilitating discussions on application design and implementation, with a focus on scaling products effectively.

Demonstrated ability to guide and mentor engineers, fostering growth and excellence within the team while embodying Xero's values.

Hands-on experience with designing and building modern engineering stacks, with exposure to platforms like AWS or GCP being highly beneficial.

Why Xero?¬†

Offering very generous paid leave to use however you‚Äôd like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, health insurance, life insurance, and income protection, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, you‚Äôll do the best work of your life at Xero.

Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we‚Äôre immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. Our goal is to make sure you feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.¬†

At Xero we embrace diversity and inclusion and value a #challenge mindset. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single competency or experience . If you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be just the right person for this role and Xero. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application and throughout the interview process.

title: Tech Lead - Architect (React, Node)
description:
About the Company¬†

Allura Partners are exclusively partnering with a well-regarded Australian brand to hire an experienced Tech Lead who will play a key role in both the strategic planning and hands-on delivery of solution design and implementation.


About the Role

Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with a high-performing team of developers, technical directors, and project managers to deliver exceptional outcomes.


Benefits

$180k + super ¬†
Flexible work arrangements
Strong career development opportunities
Work with a collaborative and high-performing team
Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and best practices
¬†

Key responsibilities

End-to-End Architecture: Design scalable, secure, and high-performing software solutions aligned with client goals and technical needs.
Hands-On Problem Solving: Step in to resolve critical development issues and support engineering teams when needed.
Technical Leadership: Define technical footprints, select appropriate tools/technologies, and guide teams to ensure architectural alignment and code quality.
Governance & Standards: Enforce best practices, coding standards, non-functional requirements (e.g., performance, security), and manage architectural backlog.¬†
Client & Team Collaboration: Engage directly with clients to gather requirements, provide tech guidance, and collaborate with cross-functional/nearshore teams to drive delivery.
Documentation & QA: Produce clear technical documentation and ensure solutions meet both functional and non-functional specifications.


Skills & Experience

7+ years in software development with at least 2 years in a tech lead or architect role; strong hands-on experience building and testing large-scale web applications.
Proven skills in modern web technologies including React, Node.js, microservices, APIs, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Deep understanding of non-functional requirements (performance, security, scalability), modern architecture patterns, and strong coding background.
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions with strong communication skills to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


How to apply

If you‚Äôre interested in this opportunity, please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù and Marie Higgins will call suitable candidates with full details.


About Allura Partners

Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we‚Äôve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.

At EY, we offer more than just an internship. We offer you the chance to build a truly exceptional career. description:
Lead a high-performing team of Engineers within Insurance & Enterprise Technology

Expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and scripting languages (Python, Groovy, Bash)

Whether you‚Äôre guiding people through life‚Äôs biggest moments or providing them with support in times they need it most, you‚Äôll be driven forward by our shared customer obsession and supported at every step of the journey.

As part of Scout Talent Group, NetEngine is scaling AI adoption across its software solutions, and we‚Äôre looking for a Technical Lead (AI-Focused) to help drive this evolution.

In this role, you‚Äôll drive our AI development roadmap, mentor a high-performing engineering team, and help shape the future of AI adoption for our clients.

Your Impact
Shape NetEngine‚Äôs AI Roadmap ‚Äì Guide the adoption of AI-first development strategies.
Develop Industry-Leading AI Solutions ‚Äì Embed AI into client solutions to drive efficiency and creativity.
Inspire and Lead a High-Performing Team ‚Äì Mentor developers and oversee AI-driven projects.
Drive Innovation and Growth ‚Äì Deliver AI-powered solutions that create real business impact.
What Makes This Role Unique?

At NetEngine, we believe in the power of in-person collaboration. While many developers prefer remote work, we are intentionally building a high-energy, creative, and collaborative in-office culture. If you believe that innovation happens best when great minds come together, and you‚Äôre excited to create an environment where AI developers thrive, this is the place for you.

This is not a remote or hybrid role. We know this goes against the grain, and we are proud of it. If you thrive in an environment where collaboration, fast decision-making, and real-time problem-solving are key, this is the role for you.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
Technical leadership experience in AI-driven software teams.
Hands-on expertise in Ruby on Rails, .NET, front-end/back-end development.
A track record of delivering AI solutions‚Äîbeyond research, with real-world application.
Ability to balance high-level strategy with hands-on leadership.
A passion for driving automation, efficiency, and innovation.
A strong belief in in-office collaboration to foster creativity and success.
Why Join NetEngine?

Be at the forefront of AI innovation. This is a rare opportunity to shape how businesses adopt AI at scale.

Lead a transformation. NetEngine is evolving, and this is your chance to define what‚Äôs next.

Work with an ambitious, high-performing team. Our culture thrives on innovation, collaboration, and making a real impact.

Have the license to create. You‚Äôll have the freedom to build an in-office environment that makes NetEngine the best place to work for AI engineers.

Vibrant team culture and experiences. From Tour de Office charity events to our exclusive Global Gathering for top performers, we reward and celebrate success.

Career development and leadership opportunities. Any team member can apply for leadership roles, and we nurture professional growth through training and collaboration.

A vibrant office environment. Our Brisbane HQ offers stunning riverside views, easy access to transport, and conveniently positioned near a variety of dining and lifestyle facilities.

Next Steps: Let‚Äôs Connect

Tell us about yourself and how you see AI shaping the future of business. Apply now and be part of our AI-driven future.

title: Senior Analyst Programmer
description:
About us

Ausco Modular is Australia's leading transportable hire and modular construction company with over 16 locations across Australia. We are an organisation that enjoys consistent and rapid growth, offering our employees secure employment, career progression and a safe work environment that encourages and brings out the best in our people.¬†

Your New Role

We are seeking a Senior Analyst Programmer who will report to the Development Manager. In this position, you will be responsible for supporting, managing, and delivering front-end, back-end, and integration solutions aimed at enhancing operational excellence and improving the customer journey at our Redbank Office in Brisbane.

Key Responsibilities:

Development of enterprise grade full stack solutions that improves customer experience and operational delivery, primarily utilizing Microsoft Azure, Dynamics 365 and Power Platform.
Project manage small projects including timelines and budgets.
Development and implementation of architectural roadmaps aligned with architectural vision and delivering strategic business outcomes.
Develop integration applications and services with cloud first approach as well as managing the development and support for ERP, fleet and contracts management system.
Implement and mentor team in industry standard toolset eg. Visual Studio and Azure DevOps.
Engage with both technical and business Stakeholders, in functions such as facilitating workshops, developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams and readable code.
What You Will Bring to the Role:

Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent industry experience.
Demonstrated ability in Microsoft web development technologies, including C#, ASP.NET MVC, Web API, and SQL Server.
Familiarity with Microsoft‚Äôs latest cloud offerings, including Dynamics 365, Power Platform, and Azure DevOps for task management and CI/CD.
Experience in industries such as rental operations, logistics, warehousing, or manufacturing is a plus.
A keen interest in current industry and technology trends.
Proficiency in front-end technologies: JavaScript/TypeScript, CSS4, HTML5, and related frameworks.
Strong competency in Visual Studio.
Experience with Microsoft SSIS is advantageous.
Familiarity with systems like Dynamics NAV/Business Central, InspHire, Salesforce, or similar platforms is a plus.
Why us

At Ausco Modular we recognize there is so much more to our people than work so we have programs in place including flexible working so we can support you to realize your full potential.¬†¬† We are a values-based organisation where the safety and wellbeing of our people is our number one priority.¬† We also respect and celebrate differences so that everyone will experience a sense of belonging, contribution, and fulfillment.

As an organisation, we are committed to operating sustainably and in an environmentally and socially responsible way with various targets associated with a reduction energy and water use and waste.

If you are looking for a role where you can collaborate with your peers and leadership to help drive great outcomes for customers, please¬†apply below.

You must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this position. We support diversity and strongly encourage Women and those from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities and defence veterans¬†to apply.

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
We are currently working with a significant state government department and are seeking an experienced ServiceNow Developer to play a key role in enhancing and improving their IT Service Management (ITSM) tool. This will be a daily rate contract through until 30 June 2025, potential beyond.

This is an exciting opportunity to work closely with ServiceNow SMEs, Solution Architects, and the ITSM Manager to deliver impactful solutions in a complex enterprise environment.

About the role:
Lead the design, development, and enhancement of ServiceNow solutions, ensuring alignment with Queensland Government Enterprise Architecture (QGEA) standards.
Configure and implement core ServiceNow functionalities, including Business Rules, Client Scripts, UI Policies, Workflows, and Access Control Lists.
Develop and optimise web applications and integrations using SOAP, REST, JavaScript, AngularJS, Bootstrap, and HTML5.
Define architecture and design elements for the implementation of ServiceNow solutions, including data models, workflow diagrams, and security access models.
Provide technical expertise and guidance in end-to-end SDLC development and delivery within a large-scale organisation.
Work collaboratively with business and technical stakeholders to translate requirements into functional solutions.
Skills & Experience:
Strong ServiceNow development experience, with a Certified Implementation Specialist certification (mandatory).
Proven expertise in configuring and customising ServiceNow in an enterprise setting.
Experience with Flow Designer, Workflow Orchestration, and Integration Hub to streamline processes and automation.
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive, hands-on approach to project delivery.

For further information or for a confidential conversation, please reach out to Matthew Cameron directly on 0450 207 555 or matthew.cameron@empiregroup.com.au

description:
