title: Technical Lead, UniVerse
description:
About the role¬†

As a Technical Lead within our Technology & Transformation division, you will play a pivotal role providing technical leadership and guidance in the design, deployment, development, maintenance and support of customer-centric platforms. The Tech Lead will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful execution of customer platform solutions, aligning them with business objectives, and ensuring reliability, scalability, and an outstanding user experience. This role will be heavily involved in a major data migration project.

Responsibilities¬†

Technical Expertise: Application of UniVerse technical expertise throughout the role.
Technical Leadership: Provide expert technical leadership and guidance to the development team, ensuring the successful execution of projects and initiatives related to customer platforms.
Solution Architecture: Collaborate with architects and other stakeholders to design scalable, reliable, and secure customer platform solutions that meet business requirements, strategic goals and security and compliance requirements.
Software Development: Lead and actively participate in the development, implementation, and enhancement of customer platform applications, adhering to coding best practices and quality standards.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product owners, delivery leads and analysts, to ensure effective collaboration and seamless integration of customer platforms with other systems and applications.
Agile Methodology: Drive the adoption of agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, and promote continuous improvement within the team.
Technical Mentoring: Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members, fostering their technical growth and promoting knowledge sharing within the team.

¬†About you¬†

You have strong expertise in successful delivery and support of customer-centric platforms that are usable, stable, secure, compliant, and aligned to business objectives. You will achieve this by providing strong technical leadership and mentorship to the team, and ensuring stakeholder satisfaction.¬†

Knowledge and Experience

Technical Experience: Strong experience with UniVerse code development is essential to be successful in this role.
Finance Experience: Experience within the banking sector is vital for success.
Communication and Influencing Skills: Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, both technical and non-technical.
Documentation and Written Communication Skills: Quality documentation skills, to accurately and concisely record information that can be easily understood.
Technical Acumen: Prior experience designing, delivering and/or maintaining complex technical solutions and the ability and experience of identifying and resolving complex technical issues.
Teamwork: The ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external parties with an attitude of working together for the benefit of our customers and in line with our values. Prior experience designing, delivering and/or maintaining complex technical solutions and the ability and experience of identifying and resolving complex technical issues.¬†

Why you‚Äôll love working with us:

People First Bank ‚Äì our new brand ‚Äì says exactly what we‚Äôre all about: people. We're committed to supporting and growing our team and creating an outstanding work environment.

You‚Äôll have access to financial and lifestyle benefits to support your success and individuality:

Flexibility and hybrid working arrangements.
Enhance your salary with discounts on banking, health insurance, and shopping across Australia.
Advance your career with training, study support, and project opportunities.
Competitive leave benefits that empower employees to take time for themselves and loved ones.
Wellbeing support with our Employee Assistance Program, wellbeing leave, mental health app, and mental health ambassadors‚Äô program.
Make a difference with paid volunteering, Workplace Giving, and diverse community initiatives.
Be recognised for your contributions through our peer-driven recognition program.

A bit about People First Bank:¬†

In March 2023, People‚Äôs Choice and Heritage Bank merged to form Heritage and People‚Äôs Choice Limited - Australia's leading mutual bank.¬† We are now on an exciting journey to bring together our products, services, and technology under a single brand -¬†People First Bank.

We have over 700,000 members and 1,900 employees, with dual head offices in Adelaide and Toowoomba, an Australian-based contract centre and branches across five states.¬†

With a vision ‚ÄòTo deliver positive change through banking‚Äô, People First Bank serves members and contributes to the community, while offering an inclusive, flexible work environment. We‚Äôre big enough to make an impact; but agile enough to influence and do interesting work.

Apply online now:

If this sounds like you, this could be the next step in your career. Click 'Apply' now and submit your application, including a cover letter and current resume by 27th April 2025.¬†

We are committed to diversity and inclusion and support candidate requests for adjustments to enable everyone to equitably participate in our selection process.¬†

title: Chapter Lead (Capture & Workflow & Full-Stack)
description:
Lead a high-performing team of Engineers within Insurance & Enterprise Technology
Hybrid Working Environment + Bonus + Flexi Days (up to 5 days extra leave)
Brisbane location

About the role

As a Chapter Lead (Capture Services & Workflow Content & Full-Stack), you are responsible for developing world-class capability within your chapter. You will provide strategic and technical leadership in document capture, workflow, and content management, ensuring the team delivers efficient and scalable solutions.

Bringing deep domain expertise, you will coach, mentor, and develop your chapter members, fostering T-shaped capabilities across business process automation and system integration. Collaborating with Chapter Leads, Player Coaches, and key stakeholders, you will shape the chapter roadmap, drive innovation, and embed best practices through a combination of coaching, training, and hands-on delivery.

What you'll do

Lead and develop a team of engineers, providing technical direction and best practices
Recruit, mentor and retain Chapter members supporting career growth and performance management
Drive team performance to meet strategic goals, targets, and budget requirements
Enable continuous delivery and automation practices to enhance delivery speed and efficiency
Works with cross functional team members to deliver low latency platforms and services
Provide ongoing support for platforms as required e.g. problem and incident management

What you'll bring¬†

8+ years in technology, including 4+ years in leadership roles
Proven ability to develop, coach, and engage technology professionals
Expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and client-side technologies such as React, Node.js, JavaScript, and TypeScript
Experience with cloud development, including AWS/Lamdba
Solid understanding of TDD, including JUnit and mocking frameworks
Knowledge of CI/CD best practices (Gradle/Maven, Jenkins) and version control (Git)

What we can offer you

Variety of flexible work arrangements and leave options
Industry leading 20 weeks paid parental leave and 4 weeks secondary carers leave
Generous discounts on insurance products + 5 Flexi days per year
Exclusive offers on more than 400 of retailers including Myer, David Jones, Coles and Woolworths
Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs

About Suncorp Group

We‚Äôre proud to be a part of the Suncorp Group family alongside some of Australia‚Äôs most trusted and diverse names in insurance. Together, we share a drive to make the complex simple and bring our customers peace of mind when it matters most ‚Äì while helping to evolve and innovate the ways we can serve our community every day. That comes with all kinds of exciting opportunities for you to grow your own career. Whether you‚Äôre guiding people through life‚Äôs biggest moments or providing them with support in times they need it most, you‚Äôll be driven forward by our shared customer obsession and supported at every step of the journey.

At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented, and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

If you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process or in the workplace, we encourage you to contact phillip.jarratt@suncorp.com.au for a confidential conversation.

title: ServiceNow Technical Lead
description:
Are you looking to develop your Career in ServiceNow Technology? This could be the opportunity for you.

The Administrative Review Tribunal (ART) is currently seeking applications for an ServiceNow Technical Lead, to join the Enterprise Technology Group.

This ongoing hybrid role can be in Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Hobart, Melbourne, Sydney or Perth.

Remuneration:¬†The annual salary range for the position is APS6 - $94,563 - $106,394 p.a., plus a generous employer superannuation contribution of 15.4%.

About the Tribunal:

The Administrative Review Tribunal plays a crucial role in the Australian legal landscape, providing a process for individuals and organisations to seek an independent review of decisions made under a wide range of Commonwealth laws.

You can learn more about the Tribunal¬†on the ART website.

What we offer:¬†¬†¬†

flexible working options, including flexi-time and remote working to support you with your commitments outside of work.¬†
competitive salary including generous superannuation employer contribution of 15.4%
salary packaging options
gym membership payment plan
supportive career development opportunities
holistic health and wellbeing support including free annual influenza vaccinations and free eye tests
generous leave allowances including Christmas to New Year office closure with no deduction from your leave balance
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
positive and inclusive culture.

Read our Enterprise Agreement for more information about our terms and conditions of employment.

About the opportunity:

Reporting to Assistant Director Technology Management, the ServiceNow Technical Lead is responsible for providing ongoing support and development to business-critical systems on the ServiceNow application/platform.

The role will provide quality hands on ServiceNow development support whilst delivering authoritative advice and guidance to operations teams. The Technical Lead will develop using the ServiceNow low-code system to increase application delivery capacity and speed the delivery of solutions.

In this role you will work and develop with a dedicated team of enthusiastic and friendly colleagues across the country. This role offers development opportunities, and the team are committed to providing the necessary support to achieve this.

About you:

The ideal candidate will be knowledgeable, hardworking, and keen to learn and advance.

To be successful you will have:-

Demonstrated experience in System Software - installing, managing, controlling, deploying, and maintaining infrastructure systems software, to meet operational needs and service levels.
Experience in Project Management - to enable you to deliver agreed outcomes from projects using appropriate management techniques, collaboration, leadership and governance.
Experience in Programming/software development - developing software components to deliver value to stakeholders.
Experience in Software Design ‚Äì to design software components and modules to meet defined requirements by following agreed design standards and principles.
Demonstrated experience in User Experience Design ‚Äì producing design concepts and prototypes for user interactions with and experiences of a product, system or service.

Essential:¬†

Must have or be able to obtain and maintain a baseline security clearance
Vocational certification in ServiceNow Technology

Desirable:

Academic qualification (degree, postgraduate) in technology and/or aligned qualifications
Vocational certification in modern technologies (e.g. Agile, network, cloud, platforms)

More information about this position, the scope of the role, duties and required capabilities and experience, is contained within the Position Description, which is linked below and available on our Career Opportunities page.

How to apply:

To be considered, all applications must be submitted online via the Career Opportunities page.¬†¬†Please click on the job title you are applying for. Please do not apply via SEEK Apply portal. Click Apply at the top of the page and follow the instructions on the online application.

¬†Position Eligibility requirements:

The Tribunal requires Australian Citizenship as a condition of engagement.
All employees are required to undertake an Australian Federal Police Check and a Health Assessment.

Please submit a CV (e.g. of no more than 4 pages) and cover letter (of no more than 2 pages) addressing how you feel your experience matches the capabilities and experience of role, referring to the Position Description.

Applications close: Sunday 20th April 2025 at 11:45pm¬†- AEST

Should you wish to discuss this position, please contact:

Name¬†Grant Nicholas

Title:¬†¬†¬†Director, Development and Operations

Tel:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†02 9276 5432

email:¬†grant.nicholas@art.gov.au

Please contact the recruitment team on (02) 9276 5443 or¬†recruitment@art.gov.au¬†should you require assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.

We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to responding to every applicant.

Please note a merit list/pool may be created to fill future like vacancies. Suitable candidates on this merit list/pool may be contacted in relation to identical or similar non-ongoing and ongoing roles in the Tribunal, or the broader APS, within 18 months from the original advertised date in gazettal.

The Administrative Review Tribunal is an Equal Opportunities employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion for all employees. We encourage and welcome applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, all genders, LGBTQI+ community and mature age people. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us if invited to interview.

RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited¬†to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information visit:¬†https://www.apsc.gov.au/recruitability

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced ServiceNow Developer to join our industry leading client and play a key role in shaping the future of their ServiceNow environment.



In this role, your focus will be to understand the business, how it operates and work to develop a roadmap of growth and optimization of the ServiceNow ecosystem. You will act as a trusted advisor and be a critical to the successful implementation of a multitude of ServiceNow modules.

Collaborate with our clients to understand their operational challenges and design effective solutions and aligning them to platform capabilities and business requirements

title: TM1 Developer
description:
The Business
Our client is a well-established organisation with a strong footprint in Brisbane and operations across Australia and internationally. Renowned for innovation and a progressive culture, they offer a supportive, inclusive workplace where ideas are valued and employees are empowered.

The Role
As part of a growing FP&A team, this role offers the chance to work on the design, build and optimisation of a key financial forecasting system that supports critical decision-making across the business.

Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure solutions are fit-for-purpose

title: Power Platform Specialists
description:
Osborne Richardson are public sector recruitment specialists with over 30 years‚Äô experience.¬† Our IT Division is headed up by an IT Project Manager with over 20 years experience running complex projects, so when you engage with Osborne Richardson, you are working with a recruitment consultancy who has walked the walk!

12 month contract

$negotiable

CBD / Hybrid

About the role:

A large QLD state government department is seeking 1 x Power Platform Technical Specialist and 1 x Functional Specialist.

Technical Specialist:

This person will design, build and maintain scalable, secure and integrated software solutions that address complex business challenges.¬† They combine strong technical expertise with a deep understanding of enterprise environments.

Proven experience in building solutions using Microsoft Power Platform

Strong knowledge of Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Dataverse

Proven experiencing building solutions using Azure, .Net, C#, React and TypeScript

Experience with complete application lifecycle management for enterprise solutions, including CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices

Apply best practice in software design, security and maintainability

Contribute to solution architecture and provide technical guidance to the team

Experience working in Agile or hybrid delivery environments

Ability to facilitate business problems/ needs into an appropriate solution/ way forward

Ability to collaborate with technical and business stakeholders

Familiarity with enterprise integration and governance patterns

Experience working in government or large-scale enterprise environments (preferred)

Dynamics 365 experience (preferred)

Familiarity with Bicep, Terraform, or Infrastructure as Code (preferred)

Functional Specialist:

This role will focus on understanding business needs and translating them into scalable, user-friendly solutions which best align with the native capabilities of the Power Platform.

Proven experience in building solutions using Microsoft Power Platform

Strong knowledge of Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Dataverse

Experience working in Agile or hybrid delivery environments

Ability to facilitate business problems / needs into an appropriate solution / way forward

Ability to collaborate with technical and business stakeholders to deliver end-to-end solutions.

Experience with complete Application Lifecycle Management

Familiarity with enterprise integration and governance patterns

Experience working in government or large-scale enterprise environments (preferred)

Azure, .Net and React experience (preferred)

Dynamics 365 experience (preferred)

Thank you for your interest. We regret that, due to the number of applications received, we will not be able to respond to all applicants.

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
Our Why

Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in people‚Äôs lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow.

About the Role (your why)

We are seeking a talented Azure .NET Developer to join our team, who will be responsible for both project development and providing support for our clients‚Äô applications and services. This role requires expertise in developing cloud-native applications using Azure services, as well as the ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues to ensure the smooth operation of our systems. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in .NET development, proficiency in Azure services, and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions and support.

Our offices are based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, and Sydney - We like to bring people together in person when we can, but we are mindful of the benefits of working from home for work/ life balance. We therefore leave it to you and the team you join to figure out what works best!

To be successful in this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen and eligible to obtain baseline clearance or NV1

What you‚Äôll do

In this role, you will be responsible for the following:


Develop, maintain, and enhance .NET applications leveraging Azure services such as Azure App Service, Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Azure Storage, etc.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and implement features according to project timelines.
Architect, design, and implement scalable and reliable solutions on the Azure platform, following best practices for cloud-native development.
Ensure code quality, performance, and security standards are met throughout the development lifecycle.
Provide ongoing support for application-related incidents, including troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving issues in a timely manner.
Monitor application performance and availability, proactively identifying potential issues and implementing solutions to prevent downtime.
Collaborate with DevOps teams to automate deployment processes, ensure continuous integration and delivery, and maintain infrastructure as code.
Document technical specifications, configurations, and troubleshooting procedures to facilitate knowledge sharing and improve support efficiency.
Participate in on-call rotations and respond to critical incidents outside of regular business hours as needed.
Mentor junior developers and contribute to their professional growth through knowledge sharing and code reviews.

We are a pretty agile company, and are keen to respond to customer, technology and internal stakeholders‚Äô changing requirements and this can mean we evolve in our roles to meet those needs.

What you‚Äôll bring

We are looking for an experienced Azure .NET Developer with the following skills and experience:


Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field.
Proven experience as a .NET Developer with expertise in C# and ASP.NET.
Strong proficiency in Azure services, with hands-on experience in building cloud-native applications.
Solid understanding of cloud architectures, microservices, and RESTful APIs.
Experience with Agile development methodologies and tools such as Azure DevOps.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration abilities, with a customer-focused mindset.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks accordingly.
Microsoft Azure certifications (e.g., Azure Developer Associate) are a plus.
Prior experience in providing production support and participating in on-call rotations is desirable.

Why join us here at Datacom?

Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealand‚Äôs largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.

We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.

We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealand‚Äôs largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.

We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.

title: Group General Manager - Software Engineering
description:
As the Group General Manager (GGM) for Education & Core Services, we are seeking a candidate with a strong software engineering background, as this is essential for the role. You will be responsible for defining and executing the strategy to manage TechnologyOne's product portfolio. Your leadership will be key in driving market share growth by developing innovative, high-quality software solutions that align with customer needs and business objectives.


What you'll be doing‚Ä¶

Lead and collaborate with highly technical teams, ensuring you leverage your deep software engineering expertise to effectively guide and support them.
Oversee the Higher Education & Core Services teams in developing MxP, embedding the TechnologyOne Way, Leadership Model, and Compelling Customer Experience while driving change, fostering continuous improvement, and aligning product strategies with business objectives.
Mentor and develop product leaders, ensuring best practices, strategic alignment, and career progression while overseeing the development, delivery, and execution of TechnologyOne's product roadmaps with a focus on quality, innovation, and market relevance.
Own and drive the Products & Technology strategy, identifying technological advancements, market opportunities, and effective product positioning through collaboration with the SLT and other stakeholders.
Lead and inspire a high-performing team of engineers, architects, and product managers, fostering innovation, collaboration, and adherence to TechnologyOne's product and project management methodologies.
Stay ahead of market trends and competition, leveraging industry knowledge to guide product development, mitigate risks, and form strategic partnerships that drive long-term success.
Take full accountability for the P&L of group products, ensuring growth and profitability targets are met, presenting compelling business cases for investment decisions, and optimizing resource management.
Enhance customer support models, drive continuous product innovation, improve operational efficiency, and ensure compliance with company policies, work health and safety requirements, and industry best practices.
Lead a team of Product General Managers with specialists in Product Development, System & Product Architecture, Project Management, Product Success, Product Delivery & Training, Product Testing, Product Releases & Practices, and Customer Support.

Your Talents‚Ä¶

Mandatory: A strong technical background in software engineering is essential for this role.
Proven experience in developing and executing product roadmaps for highly commercial Software and SaaS solutions.
Deep expertise in the full product lifecycle, from concept through market release and continuous improvement.
Strong leadership experience within a medium ASX-listed company, with a demonstrated ability to drive transformational change.
A track record of successfully leading large, high-performing teams across geographically dispersed locations.
Extensive knowledge of TechnologyOne, relevant industry groups, and key technical domains.
Executive-level communication, negotiation, and public speaking skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders effectively.
Well-established industry network across mid-to-large enterprise customers in Australia and New Zealand.
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; a Master's degree is preferred.

Benefits‚Ä¶

Attractive remuneration package with competitive benefits.
Industry-leading employee share plan, giving you the opportunity to invest in our success.
Award-winning culture - 8x Australian Business Awards "Employer of Choice" winner.
Inclusive and vibrant workplace - we celebrate diversity and love our team events.
Flexible working hours - we value work-life balance and support family-friendly arrangements.
Free gym membership in your region, or if you're at HQ, enjoy our state-of-the-art, 24/7 exclusive onsite gym.
Additional 2.5 days of leave annually to volunteer for a charity of your choice.
Onsite perks - enjoy free breakfast and barista-made coffee every day.
Structured career growth - clear pathways for progression with a defined career framework.


Who we are‚Ä¶

TechnologyOne (ASX: TNE) is Australia's largest enterprise software company and one of Australia's top 100 ASX-listed companies, with locations across six countries. We provide a global SaaS ERP solution that transforms business and makes life simple for our customers. Our deeply integrated enterprise SaaS solution is available on any device, anywhere and anytime and is incredibly easy to use. Over 1,200 leading corporations, government agencies, local councils and universities are powered by our software.

For more than 36 years, we have been providing our customers with enterprise software that evolves and adapts to new and emerging technologies, allowing them to focus on their business and not technology.

title: Software Engineering Manager - Ubuntu Linux Kernel
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are looking for either an experienced manager of high performing software development teams, or a very proficient technical lead who is excited to take on a management responsibility. You will need to be passionate about Linux and aspire to be an integral part in it‚Äôs distribution to millions of users worldwide.

As an engineering manager at Canonical, your primary responsibility is to your team: helping them grow as engineers, do important and satisfying work, and have a great time while doing it. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop strong engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

¬†

Location: This is a remote role

¬†

The role entails

Leading a distributed team of engineers in your time zone
Developing your team through coaching, mentoring, leading by example, and feedback
Supporting timely delivery of core and specialised Ubuntu kernels
Overseeing commercial engagements that require custom kernel engineering
Ensuring an ongoing commitment to strict quality and reliability standards
Engaging with other teams at Canonical, the open source community and commercial partners
Working from home with travel globally 2-3 times a year for up to two weeks, for internal and external engineering events

¬†

What we are looking for in you

Significant programming experience in C, with Python, Golang, or other like languages also highly regarded
Substantial experience with Linux kernel internals and concepts
Solid understanding Linux kernel development principles
Demonstrated experience managing or leading a team of software engineers
Contributed to an open source project in the past
Understanding of agile software development methodologies
Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral

¬†

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

¬†

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004.‚Äã Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

¬†

title: EY 2026 Indigenous Graduate Program
description:
How will you gain the skills to shape your future with confidence?

Join us as a graduate and you‚Äôll have the chance to build a truly exceptional career. We‚Äôll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential.

Through our coaching and training programs, you‚Äôll develop the skills you need to stay relevant today and, in the future, ‚Äì all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.¬†

As your career evolves, you might consider expressing an interest in being part of our national First Nations Advisory practice. This practice is drawn from, and operates across, all service lines of EY. We believe that our First Nations Advisory practice can play an important role in empowering First Nations people and their communities through meaningful impacts and support, ensuring they are included and recognised in that world.

What we can offer you

Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs
Discover the various ways our benefits can cater to your needs, across wellness, financial wellbeing and leave
Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society

We‚Äôre currently looking for students from a range of degrees.¬† You can find out more about our service lines and teams here.

Find out where your studies might best match here.

Assurance
Consulting
Strategy and Transactions
Tax

Eligibility

To apply for our Indigenous Graduate Program, you are required to:

Identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander, or both
Be due to graduate from your degree in 2025. Or if you have already completed your studies, your graduation date must be within the past 24 months at the time of application

What you can expect¬†

All candidates are required to submit an online application attaching their passport (or alternative ID), CV and academic transcript. If you are unable to do this due to accessibility, email our First Nations Recruitment team for a confidential discussion: EYFirstNationsRecruitment@au.ey.com
Once we review your application, you may be invited to an interview or Recruitment Day. We‚Äôll guide you through this process with as much or as little support as you need¬†

Please note that it can take up to six weeks to hear from us as we have a rigorous recruitment process in place for our student program roles.

We recommend applying early as we will be recruiting on an ongoing basis, and positions will close once filled. We ask that you only submit one application.

Apply now - We‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders ‚Äî past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation.

¬†DE&I are core to who we are, how we work and how we live our values. We hold a collective commitment to continue to drive an environment where all differences are valued, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging ‚Äî where people are inspired to team and lead inclusively in their interactions every day. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, cultures, sexual orientations, and gender identities and are committed to providing an equitable and barrier free recruitment experience for all. Learn more.

¬†We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at ‚ÄØcontactrecruitment@au.ey.com‚ÄØ or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.¬†

Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

¬†

title: Senior Frontend Developer - Next.js
description:
Osborne Richardson are public sector recruitment specialists with over 30 years‚Äô experience.¬† Our IT Division is headed up by an IT Project Manager with over 20 years experience running complex projects, so when you engage with Osborne Richardson, you are working with a recruitment consultancy who has walked the walk!

12 month contract
$ ¬†negotiable
Hybrid working / CBD

About the role:

We are looking for an experienced and highly skilled Senior Frontend Developer with expertise in Next.js and extensive experience deploying and managing applications on Azure Cloud. The ideal candidate will lead the frontend development of scalable, production-grade applications, working collaboratively with backend teams while independently managing deployment pipelines and cloud integrations.

This role demands proficiency in modern JavaScript/TypeScript, advanced knowledge of Next.js features, and the ability to leverage Azure services to build performant and maintainable web applications.

Key Responsibilities:

Frontend Development

Architect and implement scalable, responsive user interfaces using Next.js.
Utilize Next.js features like Server-Side Rendering (SSR), Static Site Generation (SSG), Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR), and API routes to optimize performance.
Design and develop dynamic routing and middleware for robust application flows.

Azure Cloud Integration

Deploy and manage Next.js applications on Azure App Services or Azure Static Web Apps.
Optimize application performance using Azure services like Azure CDN, Azure Application Gateway, and Azure Monitor.
Work with Azure DevOps to implement CI/CD pipelines for automated builds and deployments.

API Integration

Integrate with RESTful APIs securely and efficiently using fetch or Axios.
Implement secure authentication mechanisms such as TUO (Tell Us Once), OAuth, JWT, or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

UI/UX Design

Develop pixel-perfect, responsive designs (compatible with Desktop/Tablet/Mobile browsers) using modern CSS frameworks like TailwindCSS, Bootstrap, or Styled Components.
Collaborate with design teams to ensure seamless user experiences that adhere to modern UI/UX principles.

State Management

Use tools like Redux, Zustand, or React Query to manage application state effectively.

Build and Deployment

Configure and optimize build processes with tools like Webpack, Vite, or esbuild for Next.js applications.
Leverage Azure services like Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Functions, and Azure Storage for advanced deployment strategies.

Testing and Quality Assurance

Write and maintain robust test suites using Jest, React Testing Library, and Cypress or Playwright for E2E testing.
Perform API contract testing using tools like Pact.js and Mock Service Worker (MSW).

Monitoring and Maintenance

Use Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and Log Analytics for performance tracking, debugging, and application health monitoring.

Documentation

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for frontend components, workflows, API integrations, style guides, and accessibility standards to support developer reference and collaboration.

Collaboration and Communication

Work closely with backend teams to ensure seamless integration with Spring Boot REST APIs.
Provide input on backend workflows and database structures, demonstrating an understanding of SQL, NoSQL, or GraphQL (optional).
Required Skills and Experience

Core Technical Expertise

Minimum 5 years of professional experience with React and Next.js.
Proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript.
In-depth knowledge of React concepts (hooks, context, state management, component lifecycle).

Azure Cloud Skills (Not all mandatory)

Experience deploying applications on Azure App Services, Azure Static Web Apps, or Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
Familiarity with Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipelines.
Knowledge of Azure services like Azure CDN, Azure Functions, and Azure Key Vault is a plus.

Frontend Development Excellence

Strong understanding of Next.js features and modern UI/UX principles.
Experience with responsive design using CSS frameworks and styling libraries.

Testing Expertise

Hands-on experience with testing frameworks and tools like Jest, Cypress, and React Testing Library.
Familiarity with API contract testing using Pact.js or MSW.

Version Control

Proficiency with Git and workflows like GitFlow, working with platforms like GitHub, Bitbucket, or Azure Repos.
Desired Skills
¬†10+ years of dedicated frontend experience
Experience leading the greenfield design and development of the frontend application in NextJS
Experience integrating REST APIs ‚Äì knowledge of Spring Boot is desired but not mandatory
TypeScript/JavaScript ‚Äì TypeScript preferred
ReactJS, React Native
NodeJS, Vite, esbuild, SWC for TypeScript, Turbopack
Automated frontend testing¬†‚Äì Jest (unit testing), Vitest, Playwright (end-to-end testing), Storybook (component testing)
Experience with containerization using Docker and orchestration with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
Familiarity SQL and server-side technologies to communicate effectively with backend teams.
Knowledge of modern monitoring tools for tracking application performance and uptime.

Thank you for your interest. We regret that, due to the number of applications received, we will not be able to respond to all applicants.

title: Dot Net Developer Lead
description:
Australian Citizenship with Baseline Clearance required
Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane or Canberra location
ASAP till 31st December 2025 with possible extension

Our client a large federal government agency is looking for a Strong lead .Net developer to join their team in Brisbane or Canberra

The role will be responsible for, but not limited to:

This role is a leadership role where you will work with a team of .Net Developers as part of an Agile Delivery Team (ADT).
The role is responsible for undertaking very complex and/or sensitive work, under broad direction, utilising expertise across a range of activities relating to the design of software applications.
In partnership with clients and other stakeholders, apply strategic and systems expertise to enhance and improve existing software, including designing, developing, implementing and testing software systems, in line with business requirements and software development standards.

Key Skills and attributes

Demonstrated experience with Agile Software Development Methodologies & documentation, including estimation and planning.
Backend development experience using web API and SQL technologies.
Strong experience in Developing automated application build and deployment scripts using the .NET environment (.NET Core), and additional Microsoft technology stack.
Demonstrated experience with cloud-based applications development.
Exposure to Microsoft Azure Dev Ops..

If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Abhi Naik at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 427 997 851.

At Clicks, we embrace diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity.

We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with a disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

title: PowerApps Developer
description:
Power Platform Specialist

Position Summary: The Power Platform Specialist will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing software solutions using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI) that meet business requirements. The ideal candidate will have experience in implementing solutions with multiple data sources and APIs.

Key Responsibilities:

Implement software solutions using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI) that meet business requirements
Firm understanding of implementing solutions with multiple data sources (APIs / Snowflake)
Collaborate with other power platform specialists and the Integration & Application Architect
Compile and implement application development plans
Write scripts and code for applications, as well as install and update applications
Run diagnostic tests and perform debugging procedures
Perform application integration, maintenance, upgrades, and migration
Document application development processes, procedures, and standards
Integrate trends in application architecture in application development projects

Requirements:

A minimum of 4 years experience as a Power Platform Specialist, preferably in a related industry
Highly proficient in programming languages
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Superb organizational and time management skills
Great collaboration and communication skills
Experience with Jira/Confluence and Agile Methodology
Mining Industry experience or climate related experience is favourable.

This is an initial 3 month contract.

Please note this role is open to Brisbane based candidates only.

If you are interested in applying please use the button below or alternatively email your CV to brid.coughlan@talentinternational.com

title: Senior Developer ‚Äì Integration & Automation
description:
Ashurst is a leading global law frm with a determination to go beyond the ordinary by outpacing change. We have a community of 4800+ people across over 30 offices globally and are a trusted adviser to top corporates, fnancial institutions and governments. What sets us apart is our ambition for our people and our clients.

What makes Ashurst a great place to work?

Flexible work options
Market leading parental leave of 26 weeks paid leave irrespective of gender
Health and wellbeing benefits, gym membership and corporate health plans
Genuine opportunities to grow your career through secondments or global opportunities
Extensive Learning & Development opportunities including tailored professional development for all employees, coaching, mentoring and study support for further education
We have a strong commitment to social impact, demonstrated by our extensive volunteering and pro-bono opportunities, as well as our award-winning social inclusion and mobility programs
We are committed to reaching net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

The Opportunity:

We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Integration & Automation Developer to join our Global Integration & Automation team, as part of our broader IT Platforms Infrastructure team. This role is located in our Brisbane Ann Street office on a full-time, permanent basis.

In this role you will develop and maintain new and existing applications for the Ashurst business. You will provide programming and systems analysis skills to a range of IT projects based around commercial systems, third-party products, and in-house developed applications.

Operating within an agile scrum team, you will move flexibly within the development team with exposure to a variety of systems and technologies; fromSQL, middleware, RPA technology, and Azure DevOps through to industry-leading workflow and content management products such as Sitecore.

Main responsibilities:

Within an Agile delivery team, collaborate with members of IT, Ashurst Advance Digital and wider business service functions to deliver client-facing products and experiences to deliver legal advice and drive engagement.
Lead the development and implementation of new and existing API integrations, microservices and accompanying software, working with cloud technologies on the Azure platform.
Contribute to the design and architecture of software, prototyping and iterating new APIs, related data sources and integrations.
Participate in development workstreams, providing end to end ownership including; input into specification and design, estimation and planning, build, release and support.
Provide 3rd line support to the applications developed and upgrading existing software as the organisation's needs change.

A full job description including a breakdown of responsibilities can be found attached at the bottom of the advertisement on our careers page http://careers.ashurst.com/

We are interested in hearing from people who have:

Familiarity with DevOps practices and experience in streamlining deployments with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) using tools such as Azure DevOps, Unicorn, TeamCity, and Octopus Deploy.
Strong experience in developing and consuming RESTful APIs.
Proficiency in using middleware and integration technologies such as Boomi to ensure seamless integration and automation across various systems and platforms.
Specific experience with Automation Anywhere for robotic process automation (RPA) and Boomi for integration platform as a service (iPaaS) solutions.
A tertiary qualification in a software development subject or the ability to demonstrate equivalent commercial experience.
Effective team-working, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to maintain and build working relationships with colleagues and clients.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think efficiently and creatively.

Technical capabilities:

Experience with SOAP/XML webservice integrations.
Understanding of Test Driven Development principles.
Understands object oriented programming principles, preferably with experience in Java and/or Groovy.
Knowledge/experience with MS SQL, especially an ability to work with SSIS - this will be a key focus for the next couple of years.

We value diverse perspectives at Ashurst, so even if you don't feel you meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

For more information or if you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process or in the workplace, we encourage you to contact: globalresourcing@ashurst.com for a confidential conversation.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply directly to Ashurst. We prefer to talk with you personally and are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

description:
Automation Engineer¬†

¬†

title: Senior Developer (.NET/Dynamics)
description:
Note: a competitive remuneration package will be negotiated for the successful candidate based on qualifications, skills and experience

Position Overview¬†

Reporting to the Manager of the Database and Development Team, the CRM Dynamics 365 Developer will play a crucial role in supporting and enhancing the Business Applications of the Courts. Key responsibilities include:¬†

Providing support and maintenance for existing Court applications and platforms.¬†
Integrating new applications with existing and emerging systems.¬†
Developing new components or platforms.¬†
Analysing upgrade paths, enhancements, and effort estimates.¬†
Coordinating changes with relevant teams, including test, security, development, vendor, and other teams.¬†
Contributing to the development and maintenance of the Court's complex technology landscape of existing and emerging applications across Family Law, General Federal Law and Native Title.¬†
Adhering to the Court's change management, security, release, and maintenance policies and procedures, including the ITIL framework.¬†

Skills and Experience¬†

Required¬†

Dynamics 365 experience:
configuring Dynamics 365 on-prem,¬†preferably including deployment of Dynamics 365 CE, security management, system settings;
D365 in the cloud;
Form development, JavaScript, plugins, custom code activities, workflows, APIs (SOAP and REST), views, system jobs;
Development and deployment of on-prem reports including SSRS reports.
.NET stack, C#, including experience with Web APIs (Dynamics. 365 APIs (SOAP and REST).¬†and back-end integration. Deployment and scheduling of executables in task scheduler.
Competency modifying websites, MVC and ASP.NET.
SQL Server including, TSQL, stored procedures, linked servers, querying the Dynamics. 365 database, batch jobs, etc.
Experience using Azure DevOps and/or GITHub or similar.
Developing stories, bugs, tasks, etc., in the Azure DevOps platform or similar platforms.
Competency and familiarity using MS Visual Studio 2022, Visual. Studio Code.
Understanding of, and competency in GIT version control.¬†

Desirable¬†

SharePoint, SharePoint Online and SharePoint solutions development
Experience with cloud platforms like Azure¬†
Experience with Oracle databases¬†
Configuration and development of Azure DevOps pipelines, e.g. YAML¬†
High-level ability to understand complex technical environments and work to design robust, practical and supportable solutions.¬†

Selection Criteria

1. Demonstrated experience in working with a team including the ability to work collaboratively and co-operatively with staff and their managers across the Entity to ensure that system changes meet business and technical objectives.

2. Demonstrated experience as a developer in the following technologies:¬†

Dynamics 365
.NET stack, including experience with Web APIs and back-end integration¬†
MS SQL Server¬†¬†

3. Strong ability to understand new technologies and complex technical environments.

4.Technical analysis, business analysis, integration or development experience.

Other Requirements¬†

Relevant industry or tertiary qualifications in IT would be well regarded.¬†

Eligibility¬†

Employment with the Court is subject to the conditions prescribed in the Public Service Act 1999, and the following:¬†

Australian citizenship ‚Äì the successful applicant must hold Australian citizenship;¬†
Security and character clearance ‚Äì the successful applicant must satisfy a Police Records Check, and may also be required to complete security clearances during the course of their employment;¬†
Successful applicants engaged into the APS will be subject to a probation period¬†

Interested candidates who have received a redundancy benefit from an APS agency are welcome to apply, but note that they cannot be engaged until their redundancy benefit period has expired.¬†

Diversity and Inclusion¬†

Federal Court Australia is committed to supporting an inclusive and diverse workforce and welcomes and encourages applications from People with Disability. First Nations peoples, LGBTIQA+ people, people from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse backgrounds, Mature age workers, as well as young workers and supporting an inter-generational workforce and supporting gender equity and families.¬†

Federal Court Australia will provide reasonable adjustments for candidates to participate equitably in the recruitment process and discuss workplace adjustments to fulfil the inherent requirements of the role.¬†

RecruitAbility¬†

RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information visit: https://www.apsc.gov.au/recruitability

How to Apply

To apply, please complete the application form on the Court‚Äôs careers portal. If you have any issues with applying, please email recruitment@fedcourt.gov.au.

As part of your application, you will be required to submit a one page response outlining your suitability for this position having regards to the selection criteria and duties of the position which are described in the position description (maximum word limit 500). Please ensure this document is attached before submitting your application.

You will also need to upload an up-to-date resume and relevant qualification.

Contact officer

For more information contact Mark Bryant, Manager, Database and Development Team, by email Mark.Bryant@fedcourt.gov.au.

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
About the ABC

The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.

About the Role

Ensure high quality software is delivered for the ABC‚Äôs Content Management system and APIs in line with ABC strategy and Product & Content Technology‚Äôs objectives.

Key accountabilities

Under broad direction, collaborate with the Quality Assurance and Development Teams to ensure successful execution of the team‚Äôs test strategy and test plans.
Develop and maintain complex automation frameworks to verify the functionality & performance of UI, backend and monitoring, integrated into the CI/CD pipeline.
Create test plans for complex systems, execute test cases and correctly report test results across all functional areas of the platform.
Develop an outstanding understanding of the system‚Äôs requirements and lead the development and implementation of an automation strategy with appropriate dependencies, assumptions and constraints.
Drive and guide the platform team‚Äôs strategy and approach to automation testing and actively promote and educate the platform teams on automation techniques.
Analyse particularly complex software systems and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to improve the design, including governance measurement to ensure applications perform to specification.


About You

Demonstrated experience in development or testing highly data driven applications.
Hands on experience with tools for testing & automation such as Playwright, Cypress, WebDriver IO, Postman & Cucumber.
Outstanding programming skills in at least one language (ideally JavaScript, TypeScript or Go)
Extensive experience in developing automation frameworks and tests for front end apps and restful APIs. GraphQL experience would be well regarded.
Extensive experience working with DevOps and CI/CD tools such as GitLab and Bamboo
Experienced writing & maintaining performance tests using tools like K6
Experience with AWS ‚Äì Lambda, EC2, ECS, SNS, Dynamo DB, RDS, CloudWatch etc
Foster a coaching mindset and collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement shift-left testing opportunities.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills with the ability convey complex technical information to various stakeholders.
Experience with the following tools & technologies is desirable to have: Atlassian Jira and Confluence; Content Management System (e.g. Core Media, Adobe CQ5); Log parsing and analysis using regular expressions, Splunk/Datadog, Elastic Search & Solr


What‚Äôs In It For You?¬†

Come and join the vibrant Digital Product department in the ABC. Our mission is to enable ABC‚Äôs digital future, where ABC transitions from a traditional broadcaster to Australia‚Äôs most trusted and valued digital media organisation. Through harnessing our talents in digital, collaborating with our partners and delivering beyond expectations, we ensure the ABC not just remains relevant but thrives.

As a group of product and platform teams, we develop and maintain the ABC's audience facing digital products across mobile, connected TV, desktop, and smart speakers. Whether it is staying informed of the latest breaking news, bringing some great TV on ABC iview, streaming the Hottest 100 on the triple j app and website, or entertaining the kids with our ABC Kids app - the ABC's Digital Product offerings are some of Australia's most loved and most used platforms.

Your work will be appreciated by millions of audiences across Australia. We are an open and cohesive team where your voice will not get lost. You can get a sneak peek into our product engineering world through our blog: https://www.abc.net.au/digital-product

We are committed to career development and invest in our people to grow and become leaders in their fields. Everyone in the Digital Product department has a designated budget for training and development. We believe in flexible approaches to working and building self-organising and collaborative teams that offer friendly and supportive environments in which all team members can strive and grow.

For further information on this position please contact Brett Whyte, Digital Talent Acquisition Specialist via email whyte.brett@abc.net.au ¬†

We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.

In line with our focus on¬†diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.

For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to Life Page¬†on ABC LinkedIn.¬†

For more information on working at the ABC¬†visit abc.net.au/careers

title: Technical Lead - Digital Client Solutions
description:
Ashurst is a leading global law firm with a determination to go beyond the ordinary by outpacing change. We have a community of 4800+ people across over 30 offices globally and are a trusted adviser to top corporates, financial institutions and governments. What sets us apart is our ambition for our people and our clients.


What makes Ashurst a great place to work?

Flexible work options
Market leading parental leave of 26 weeks paid leave irrespective of gender
Health and wellbeing benefits, gym membership and corporate health plans
Genuine opportunities to grow your career through secondments or global opportunities,
Extensive Learning & Development opportunities including tailored professional development for all employees, coaching, mentoring and study support for further education.
We have a strong commitment to social impact, demonstrated by our extensive volunteering and pro-bono opportunities, as well as our award-winning social inclusion and mobility programs.
We are committed to reaching net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.


The Opportunity

As the Technical Lead for our Digital Client Solutions product team, you will join a global team to drive the technical and architectural direction of our client and public facing digital services, including the Ashurst website. Drawing upon your deep experience in Azure based solutions, you will be key in shaping strategy, making key decisions and driving the adoption of digital tools as part of the firm's digital transformation. Key duties will include:

Oversee technical confiduration, development and deployment within the product team.
Provide technical guidance, governance and change evaluation for solution development.
Work closely with vendors, overseeing third-party implementations and identifying improvements.
Establish and enforce governance standards for the Microsoft Power Platform to ensure secure, scalable and efficient use

A full job description including a breakdown of responsibilities can be found attached to the role on our careers page http://careers.ashurst.com/


We are interested in hearing from people who have:

Strong Azure development, architecture and deployment expertise
Proven leadership in cloud technology implementations, including:
Azure Integration Services (Logic Apps, API Management)
Azure Security and Identity services (Azure B2C, Azure AD)
Azure web apps and function apps.
Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Pages)
Skilled in solution design, impact analysis, cost management and security compliance
Demonstrated ability to architect solutions that meet a wide variety of data protection, data residency and regionalisation requirements.
A high degree of commercial awareness and understanding of impact analysis, cost management and security compliance.
Proven technology leadership experience, including exceptional initiative and stakeholder management skills.

We value diverse perspectives at Ashurst, so even if you don't feel you meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

title: Senior API Support Specialist
description:
About us

¬†

Through local expertise and global scale, we at¬†Global Payments¬†deliver market-leading technology solutions through five regional sub-brands ‚Äî Eway, Ezidebit, Sentral, Pigeonhole Software and Storman.

These brands are anchored by Global Payments, a Fortune 500¬Æ brand and commerce leader powering millions of companies around the world, from ambitious startups to enterprise giants.


We make a positive impact on our customers and communities through our values of¬†Passion, Care, Accountability, Excellence and Ingenuity.

Underpinning our values is an unwavering commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, woven into our cultural DNA through a multi-year Oceania program focused on two core pillars of action -¬†Reconciliation and Gender Equity.


As pioneers within the Australia and New Zealand payments landscape,¬†Eway¬†is a leading business-to-business ecommerce provider and¬†Ezidebit¬†a digital recurring business-to-consumer payments processing platform.

¬†

About the role

¬†

We‚Äôre looking for a¬†Senior API Specialist¬†to join our Premium Support Specialist Team at¬†Global Payments AU/NZ. This role is crucial in providing high-level support to software development partners and merchants, ensuring seamless API integrations across our payment products and services.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

API Support & Troubleshooting¬†‚Äì Be the go-to technical expert for API integrations, resolving issues efficiently and ensuring a smooth customer experience;
Customer Engagement¬†‚Äì Collaborate with software partners, merchants, and developers to optimise API functionality and enhance user experience;

Innovation & Security¬†‚Äì Design and develop scalable, secure API solutions, staying ahead of industry trends and best practices;
Collaboration¬†‚Äì Work closely with product managers, development teams, and stakeholders to align API solutions with business needs.

¬†

About you

You are a¬†curious and tech-savvy problem solver¬†with a passion for APIs, customer experience, and troubleshooting complex technical challenges. You thrive on¬†investigating issues, sharing insights, and creating seamless user experiences. Personable and analytical, you enjoy working closely with customers and stakeholders to optimise API functionality.¬†

Excellent¬†customer service and communication skills¬†‚Äì you‚Äôll be working closely with partners and merchants;

Knowledge of¬†PCI DSS compliance¬†and enterprise software solutions however not essential.¬†

¬†

Salary

Our Benefits

All final applicants¬†for this position¬†will be asked to consent to a criminal history check. Each application will be considered on its merits.

title: Cloud Engineering Lead
description:
At Swyftx, we're not just building a fintech scaleup; we're shaping the future of Australia's digital currency industry. With over 800,000 users, we have our sights set high, aiming to be Australia's most trusted cryptocurrency trading platform, bridging the gap between defi and tradfi, and expanding to become Australia‚Äôs next global success story.¬† ¬†
¬†
This is more than just a job‚Äîit's an opportunity to shape the future of an industry leader.¬†As a Cloud Engineering Lead at Swyftx, you will play a pivotal role in guiding engineering teams to adopt best practices, empowering developers to autonomously manage infrastructure, and embedding security-first principles throughout our ecosystem. Your leadership will have a direct impact on boosting the productivity and maturity of developer teams, while ensuring the platform remains reliable, scalable, and secure
¬†
Please note this is a Brisbane based role, and we have hybrid working, with two days per week in our beautiful Milton office. ¬†
¬†
What you'll do

Deliver secure, scalable, and efficient technical solutions that maintain platform stability and empower developers to move fast with confidence.
Act as a trusted technical leader, guiding and mentoring others while fostering a collaborative, growth-focused team culture, working closely with the Senior Engineering Manager to drive continuous improvement.
What we build¬†

Our Tech stack for this role is in the AWS ecosystem, particularly AWS EKS, MSK, and RDS, with experience in lifecycle automation and scaling.
Hands-on experience with AWS, Terraform, Kustomize, and Helm for managing cloud-native infrastructure.
Strong understanding of CI/CD workflows using ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, and integration with Vault-based secrets management.
Our trading platform needs to be highly scalable to deal with sharp peaks in the market.¬†
As custodians of our customers‚Äô money, security is also a key consideration in how we engineer things.¬†
With over 800,000 customers, we place a lot of emphasis on design and user experience so that our customers can have the easiest-to-use and most trustworthy experience.¬†
Some of your key responsibilities in this role will include:

Lead by example as the senior technical team member across all engineering aspects within your designated squad.
Design and maintain scalable, cloud-native AWS infrastructure using Terraform, Terragrunt, Kustomize, and Helm. Automate provisioning, scaling, and monitoring with GitOps and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles.
Promote containerization best practices with Kubernetes and Cilium, and design solutions for high availability and efficient storage. Support developers by debugging pipelines, improving workflows, and fostering collaboration to reduce dependency on the platform team.
Guide teams on security best practices, ensure compliance in CI/CD pipelines, and maintain platform observability for reliability and performance.
Support with planning and allocating work in line with squad deliverables and business priorities.
Assist with the growth and development of squad members to build technical and engineering excellence.
Work with the Senior Engineering Manager to review squad output and lead the successful delivery of technical solutions that meet objectives.
Contribute to the programming and advancement of technical solutions being developed and deployed.
Solve technical issues within your own work and the work of the squad, collaborating with other Technical Leads, Engineering Leaders, and key stakeholders to drive efficiency, precision, and innovation.
To be successful you will have:

Expertise in the AWS ecosystem, including AWS EKS, MSK, and RDS, with experience in lifecycle automation and scaling.
Hands-on experience with AWS, Terraform, Kustomize, and Helm for managing cloud-native infrastructure.
Strong understanding of CI/CD workflows using ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, and Vault-based secrets management.
Proven ability to identify complex issues and design practical solutions.
Experience in a senior technical role, acting as a go-to subject matter expert for complex problems.
Strong initiative, adaptability, and a proactive approach to work.
Ability to prioritise tasks and manage software delivery for a team.
Excellent team player with the ability to influence and motivate others.
Passion for mentoring and teaching developers to achieve outstanding results.
Some of our perks and benefits include:¬†

Fully stocked kitchen, breakfast and lunch foods, unlimited fresh fruit and snacks.¬†¬†
An inhouse barista and weekly catered lunches on a Wednesday.¬†
Unlimited fee-free trading.¬†
Career growth, training, mentorship, and development opportunities.¬†
Social activities, game breaks and end of month awards.¬†

At Swyftx, we're not just building a diverse and dynamic environment; we're celebrating it. We value and embrace the unique experiences, qualities, and characteristics that each member of our team brings, and we're committed to cultivating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to do their best work.¬†¬†¬†
¬†¬†
If you are driven by excellence, a deep commitment to integrity, and an unwavering drive to make an impact then click ‚Äòapply now‚Äô.¬†¬†
¬†¬†
We have an internal Talent Acquisition function, and therefore are not accepting approaches from recruitment agencies.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
The opportunity

The Boeing MQ28 - Ghost Bat is a globally-significant program that will deliver a disruptive advantage to support Defence operational capabilities. Developed in partnership with the Royal Australian Air Force, it is the first military combat aircraft to be designed, manufactured and assembled in Australia in 50 years.

Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) are seeking an experienced Systems Engineer to support the integration, verification and test of new capabilities within the MQ-28 Ghost Bat.

The role is based in Brisbane but may also be performed from Williamtown.

As an experienced Systems Engineer you will:

Lead, develop and document verification strategies for the MQ-28 System.
Lead and develop verification requirements, test plans, procedures and reports.
Coordinate and chair Test Readiness Reviews and other pertinent design reviews.
Coordinate, plan and conduct integration and formal verification testing.
Collaborate to develop design solutions that meet the capability objectives and requirements of the MQ-28 System.
Support ground and flight test operations for the MQ-28 System.Lead and develop engineering documentation (Specifications, Design Documents, Interface Definitions, Test Procedures etc) to support development of ground test equipment.


To be considered for the role you will have:

Experience in complex technical development and integration projects
Hold Tertiary qualifications in either Aerospace, Avionics, Electrical or Mechatronics, that satisfies the requirements for membership with Engineers Australia (MIEAust) or equivalent technical experience in a Systems Engineering discipline.
Demonstrated experience in systems and software development lifecycle.
Demonstrated experience in integration, verification & testing.
Experience with aircraft avionics and UAV systems (desirable).
Familiarity with engineering change processes.
Experience with requirements management tools (DOORS) and Model Based Systems Engineering methods (highly regarded)
Experience with Agile delivery methodologies (highly regarded)
Experience with Autonomous Systems projects (highly regarded)
Experience with aerospace and / or Defence projects (highly regarded.)

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet Defence security requirements.


You may require a Foreign Work Authorisation (FWA) in order to perform this role. This is not a requirement set or determined by Boeing but by the Department of Defence under laws issued in 2024. Please refer to the Department of Defence website to understand these requirements.


What's on offer?

Boeing values the health and wellbeing of our employees and offer true flexibility including working from home, compressed work weeks, and opportunities for part time arrangements, allowing you to balance your career with what is important to you outside of work.

Other benefits:

Work on cutting edge projects with opportunities to work across platforms.
Attractive remuneration and annual bonus.
Formal mentoring and training as well as on the job learning.
Formal reward and recognition program.
Access discounts for health insurance, travel and accommodation.
Paid study leave, paid parental leave and Defence leave.
Salary packaging options available.
Health and wellbeing benefits including annual flu vaccinations and Employee Assistance Program.
Social and community groups.

BDA works with strong links with our global Boeing community and we strongly encourage collaboration with our international counterparts.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and veterans are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.
