title: DevOps Engineer - Azure
description:
Position:¬†Devops Engineer

Datacom Location:¬†Brisbane preferred, though anywhere in Australia ok

Security Requirements: Baseline or NV1/2 Security Clearances (active or inactive)

¬†

Our Why¬†

Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in people‚Äôs lives and help them to use the power of tech to innovate and grow.¬†

About The Role

We are currently seeking an Azure DevOps and Terraform experienced DevOps engineer used to working on Hybrid Cloud, VMware, AWS, and particularly Azure, though the successful applicant may not have experience in every one of these areas. The DevOps Engineer role is responsible for guiding and implementing automation initiatives, dealing with software development, operations, and services. This role involves performing hands-on automation tasks, in areas including software development, operations, and services. Improving communication, collaboration and integration between software developers and IT operations personnel.

Our offices are based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, Perth and Sydney. We like to bring people together in person when we can, but we are mindful of the benefits of working from home for work/life balance. We therefore leave it to you and the team you join to figure out what works best!

** As above, you must have NV1/2 or Baseline security clearances (active or inactive) **

¬†

What You‚Äôll Do

The Dev Ops Engineer is responsible for (but not limited to):

Influencing architectural decisions, implementing, and managing core infrastructure, developing internal tools, and looking to automate as many processes as possible
Performing hands-on automation tasks to treat infrastructure as code
Performing routine analysis of the production environment and ensure that operations for each project run smoothly
Providing execution of activities related to infrastructure, security, continuous integration, continuous deployment, IT operations and metrics
Collaborating with other System Administrators, Developers, Testers, Architects and Business Analysts
Using business-oriented operations to achieve successful development and identify alternative solutions for reducing the gap between the productions and deployment period

We are a pretty agile company and are keen to respond to customer, technology and internal stakeholders‚Äô changing requirements and this can mean we evolve in our roles to meet those needs.¬†

¬†

What You'll Bring

3+ years‚Äô experience as a DevOps Engineer/Automation Specialist
Used to working on most/all of Hybrid Cloud, VMware, AWS, and most importantly, Azure
Working knowledge of Ansible, Linux and Windows is highly desirable
Strong knowledge of various software and performance monitoring techniques
Working knowledge of common systems monitoring and alerting tools and also of common build, release, and deployment tools
Experience of modern DevOps Tools and utilities and build, release, and development tools
Experience of automation and programming and scripting languages
Knowledge of competing product offerings
Strong and varied practical hands-on experience in Azure automation and familiar with Git, repos, and DevOps processes
Strong financial management practices with a clear understanding of the relationship between costs, utilisation, and project revenue
Certified with AZ-204 (Developing Solutions for MS Azure) or AZ-400 (Designing and Implementing MS DevOps Solutions)
Added advantage for AZ-500 (MS Azure Security Technologies)
The successful candidate will go through assessment test for using Infrastructure as Code (ARM templates, Bicep, Terraform and CDKTF, etc.) and automation (PowerShell coding skills, Azure DevOps, ability to code Azure functions)

Why Join Us Here at Datacom?¬†

Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealand‚Äôs largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.¬†

We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.¬†

We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealand‚Äôs largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.¬†

We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.¬†

title: Lead Devops Platform Engineer
description:
The Opportunity

At APA, our purpose is to secure Australia's energy future. We're not doing it alone. We're doing it with our customers and communities as Australia's energy infrastructure partner, a role our unique experience and expertise positions us to play.

We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Lead DevOps Platform Engineer based in Sydney, Adeliade, Melbourne or Brisbane on a full-time permanent basis.

In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, optimising, and integrating the DevOps toolchain to enable cloud and application engineering teams to achieve their platform, automation, and operational objectives. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the toolchain integrates seamlessly into CI/CD workflows while upholding reliability, security, and efficiency. This position demands technical expertise in managing and enhancing tools, ensuring compliance, driving automation initiatives, and empowering engineering teams to fully leverage the toolchain's capabilities.

Key Responsibilities

Toolchain Management: Administer and optimise tools like GitLab, Terraform, Prisma, Vault, Nexus and Test Automation to ensure security, performance, and stability.
CI/CD Integration: Build and maintain reusable CI/CD pipeline templates and scripts, integrating the full toolchain for automation and efficiency.
Enablement and Support: Provide training, documentation and troubleshooting support for engineers to ensure effective tool usage and compliance with best practices.
Automation: Identify and implement automation opportunities to improve operational efficiency and streamline processes.
Proactive Monitoring: Monitor and resolve performance and reliability issues across AWS cloud platforms and toolchains.

Your background

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline.
Advanced experience with DevSecOps frameworks, best practices and standards
Expansive skills in designing, building, integrating, administering and optimising toolchains such as GitLab, Terraform Enterprise, Vault, Prisma and Nexus.
Strong understanding of CI/CD, automation frameworks, scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash) and reliability engineering concepts, with demonstrable outcomes in an environment that has driven these outcomes
Familiarity with AWS and data platforms like Databricks

About the Team

Technology drives everything we do at APA, from connecting millions of Australians to energy sources to achieving our net zero ambitions. Our technology teams are focused on delivering innovative solutions that position APA as a world leader in energy infrastructure. We're looking for people who are ready to make an impact-those who are courageous, nimble, and willing to take risks.

We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Lead DevOps Platform Engineer based in Sydney, Adeliade, Melbourne or Brisbane on a full-time permanent basis.

Working at APA

At APA we're committed to fostering a safe and inclusive workplace where you can achieve your best. We'll provide you with access to targeted career development programs, competitive remuneration, employee benefits, flexible working arrangements, and wellbeing programs. We also have an inclusive parental leave policy providing 18 weeks leave including superannuation to support parents at work and in life.

We employ more than 2700 people across Australia and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture, where everyone feels safe, valued, and trusted to do their best every day.

We are APA

APA Group is a leading Australian energy infrastructure business.

We proudly own, operate and manage a diverse $26 billion portfolio of gas, electricity, solar and wind assets which deliver essential services to communities and customers across Australia.

And we own more than 15,000 kilometres of gas pipelines which deliver energy to households and businesses across every corner of Australia.

As the partner of choice in delivering infrastructure solutions for the energy transition, we're focused on bundled remote grid energy solutions, electricity and gas transmission, and future energy, including hydrogen and carbon capture and storage.

Our customer centric approach means we understand our customers and offer them reliable, innovative, and cost-effective energy solutions that support their decarbonisation ambitions.

We are committed securing Australia's energy future by delivering infrastructure solutions for Australia's energy transition and supporting the decarbonisation ambitions of our customers and communities .

Join our team and be part of securing Australia's energy future.

We'd love to hear from you.

APA is an equal opportunity employer. The safety, health and wellbeing our people, community and environment a priority. We embrace diversity in our people to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we operate in.
Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.

This vacancy works with critical APA data, systems or infrastructure and candidates are subject to background vetting (including Police checks) before & during employment.

Role closes Saturday 19 April 2025. Role Reference number JR2420.

APA Group will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies.

We will contact successful candidates after the closing date.

The successful candidate will also be responsible for investigating and resolving production issues and preparing and maintaining technical and functional documentation.

title: Mechatronics Engineer
description:
Randstad has partnered with a leading innovative business that manufactures advanced Reverse Vending Machines (RVMs) designed to promote recycling and sustainability. They are committed to developing cutting-edge technology that makes recycling convenient and efficient.

They're looking for a skilled Senior Mechatronics Engineer to drive innovation to their dynamic team in Brisbane.

Program control systems using Codesys for real-time automation and machine control.

4+ years of experience designing and developing mechatronic systems.
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient software developer (Python, CodeSys).
Working knowledge of AS/NZS 3000, AS/NZS 61439, AS/NZS 4024.
Creative problem solver and autonomous professional.

Company in expansion and growth with lots of opportunities to develop your career
You'll have the chance to be creative and autonomous developing solutions for their products

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

title: Software Licensing Manager
description:

Due to organisational growth, we are now seeking an experienced Software Licensing Manager to join our Team in Acacia Ridge, QLD on a permanent fulltime position.

title: AI-Solution Architect
description:
Our Mission to be Bold and Impactful

How you Contribute

As an AI Solution Architect, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing Emesent‚Äôs AI strategy. This is a unique opportunity to define the vision, drive the development of AI solutions, and ensure their seamless integration across our product suite. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and business stakeholders, to identify and evaluate opportunities to utilise AI to maximize the impact of our solutions.

Reporting to the Principal Architect, this role requires a strong technical background in AI/ML, coupled with leadership skills to help us build our capabilities in AI, and assist the company in shaping its product and technology strategies with AI in mind.

Responsibilities & Accountabilities:

AI Strategy & Leadership

In cooperation with Product Management and Engineering, identify and evaluate opportunities for AI-based solutions inline with our product roadmap and vision.¬† Establish the likely impact of these solutions and support their inclusion product roadmap.

Stay at the forefront of industry trends in AI, machine learning, computer vision, and robotics, ensuring Emesent remains competitive and innovative.

Utilise your knowledge of the state of the art in AI to inform our product and technology strategies, and help us to refine our product vision

AI Product Development & Innovation

Lead AI-driven enhancements to Emesent‚Äôs data processing, and autonomous robotics products.

Lead efforts to establish our capability to execute on the full AI/ML model lifecycle‚Äîfrom research and prototyping to production deployment‚Äîensuring the scalability, efficiency, and accuracy of models.

Drive innovation in AI-powered product features, including computer vision, sensor fusion, autonomy, and data analytics.

Collaborate with engineering and product teams to ensure AI technologies are incorporated into both new and existing product offerings.

Guide the selection of computing infrastructure to support AI solutions, including edge computing and cloud-based services.

Implement AI Operational Excellence

Establish MLOps practices for efficient model deployment, monitoring, and maintenance.

Optimize AI models, pipelines, and data workflows to ensure reliability, speed, and scalability.

Establish and track key AI performance metrics, continuously refining models to meet customer needs and business goals.

Ensure that AI solutions are designed with scalability and regulatory compliance in mind.

Team Growth & Leadership

Lead the growth of Emesent‚Äôs AI capabilities by building and mentoring a high-performing AI team.

Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and experimentation within the team.

Establish best practices for AI development, deployment, and continuous improvement.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Influence

Build strong relationships with key stakeholders, both internally and externally, to ensure the successful adoption and integration of AI solutions.

Drive research partnerships with universities, industry leaders, and other organizations to advance AI capabilities.

Represent Emesent‚Äôs AI strategy externally, speaking at industry events, customer meetings, and investor discussions.

Qualifications & Experience:

7+ years of experience in AI/ML, data science, or related fields, with a focus on machine learning, deep learning, and AI model deployment.

3+ years of leadership experience, preferably in a product-focused AI role, with a demonstrated ability to bridge the gap between research and real-world implementation.

Strong technical expertise in AI technologies which are aligned with computer vision, 3D data, and robotic autonomy.

Demonstrated ability to comprehend cutting-edge advancements in the field of AI, including the capability to critically evaluate and translate academic research papers into actionable insights for strategic and technical decision-making.

Experience in robotics, autonomous systems, or industrial applications is highly desirable.

Hands-on experience with cloud AI services (AWS, GCP, Azure), MLOps practices, and AI infrastructure.

Proven track record of delivering AI-driven products that drive business impact and align with customer needs.

Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.

Knowledge of regulatory considerations in AI, particularly for autonomous systems (e.g., BVLOS compliance for drone operations), is a plus.

The added perks

Work alongside a friendly and passionate team on cutting edge technology! - We know that our success and growth is a result of our motivated and inspiring teams.

Take up our genuine learning and development opportunities.

Access to LinkedIn Learning platform.

Employee Assistance Program.

Qoctor, online telehealth

Settle into our great work environment and facilities.

Work in comfort with a casual dress code.

Flexible working.

1 full day of leave, each year for work anniversaries!

Who are we?

Emesent is a world leader in drone autonomy, LiDAR mapping, and data analytics. Our vision is to autonomously map the inaccessible. Founded in 2018, with deep connections to Australia's globally recognised CSIRO, we have established ourselves worldwide with a reputation for delivering high-quality data capture in the mining, infrastructure, survey, and mapping industries. Our team of 100+ roboticists, engineers, and business development experts work side-by-side to deliver revolutionary efficiency, safety, and operational insights to our customers.

Our flagship product, Hovermap, is a smart mobile scanning unit that combines advanced collision avoidance and autonomous flight technologies to map hazardous and GPS-denied environments. Its award-winning technology utilises innovative hardware, advanced algorithms, and machine learning to automate the collection and analysis of the physical world. Equally capable above ground or underground, indoors, or out, Hovermap is a complete mobile LiDAR mapping solution. Hovermap is uniquely versatile, it can be backpack, drone, or vehicle-mounted to map challenging, inaccessible areas, enabling our customers to gain insights that were not possible before.

With multiple applications across several industries and a rapidly growing customer base, Hovermap and our other solutions are being used commercially for various applications by enterprise customers around the world.

Why Emesent?

At Emesent, you will have the opportunity to work on ground-breaking technology that is shaping the future. We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, and opportunities for professional growth. Join us in our mission to push the boundaries of robotics and digitalisation to help humanity explore further and understand more.

title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY
¬†
We are seeking a skilled Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in automating, managing, and optimizing our cloud infrastructure and increase operations efficiency. And we‚Äôre powered not just by technology, but by passionate people who are fearlessly committed to getting it right for our customers.

Transformative digital solutions take the right team, making the right moves at the right time. You‚Äôve found yours with NRI

DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Integration
description:
About the Role

The Senior Engineering Manager - Integration will lead the design, development, architecture and operation of integration solutions across a diverse range of technologies, driving the successful execution of the organization‚Äôs integration strategy. This role will be responsible for overseeing the full lifecycle of integration platforms, ensuring they are secure, scalable and aligned with business objectives.

The Senior Engineering Manager will lead and mentor a team of engineering managers and technical leads and engineers fostering a high-performing, collaborative culture that emphasizes technical excellence and business alignment. They will play a key role in defining and implementing modern integration architectures to support the organization‚Äôs digital transformation.

Working closely with project managers, delivery lead¬† and business stakeholders, the Senior Engineering Manager will ensure that integration solutions are delivered on time and within budget, balancing strategic business goals with technical excellence. They will act as a key liaison between technical and business teams, driving alignment, managing talent demand, and ensuring the effective execution of Agile methodologies.

This is a strategic leadership role that requires deep technical expertise, strong delivery skills and the ability to manage complex stakeholder relationships across the business.

About you

Expertise in Azure and Cloud-Native Solutions is a must ‚Äì Strong technical background in designing, building, and operating cloud-native solutions on Azure, with a deep understanding of cloud architecture and best practices.
Deep Knowledge of IBM Integration Platforms ‚Äì Proven experience with IBM integration technologies, including designing and implementing complex integration solutions.
Strong Background in Microservices and Event-Driven Architecture ‚Äì Solid experience with microservices, domain-driven design (DDD), and event-driven patterns, with a track record of building scalable and resilient systems.
Software Development Methodologies ‚Äì Deep understanding of modern software development practices, including Agile, DevOps, and CI/CD.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Ability to navigate complex technical challenges and deliver innovative solutions aligned with business needs.
Communication and Stakeholder Management ‚Äì Strong ability to communicate complex technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences, building alignment and trust.
Proven Delivery Experience ‚Äì Demonstrated ability to drive complex projects from concept to completion, delivering high-quality outcomes on time and within budget.
Experience Leading High-Performing Teams ‚Äì Track record of building, managing, and scaling high-performing engineering teams, fostering a culture of accountability and innovation.
Vendor Management Experience ‚Äì Experience working with and managing software vendors, driving value and alignment with business goals.

About Us

BOQ Group is a truly unique group of challenger brands with a purpose ‚Äì to provide a genuine alternative to Australian financial services for customers and employees.

Our family of brands (Bank of Queensland (BOQ), ME Bank, Virgin Money Australia, BOQ Specialist), each come with their own defined customer audience and brand personality, but share one goal ‚Äì to build social capital through banking. That‚Äôs creating trust with customers, exploring staff potential and believing that tiny gestures and big ideas can change the world for communities.

BOQ Group‚Äôs inclusive vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.

Since 2021, BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).

In 2023, we successfully implemented an innovative Reconciliation Plan, driving positive change and promoting inclusivity across BOQ Group.

Our Benefits

At BOQ Group, we are passionate about creating an exceptional work environment that nurtures both your professional and personal growth. Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to enhance your well-being, provide financial security, and foster a sense of community and inclusion. Here are just some of the fantastic perks you can enjoy as part of our team:

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉFlexible working arrangement - Balance your work and personal life with ease.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉDiscounted financial products - Enjoy exclusive rates on our financial services across the Group.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉSalary sacrificing options - Maximise your take-home pay with our salary packaging options.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉPaid parental leave with no minimum requirements - Spend quality time with your new family member without any worries.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉPurchase additional annual leave - Need more time off? You can buy extra leave days.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉDiscounted private health insurance plan - Take care of your health with our special rates.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) - Access confidential support for personal and professional challenges for you and your family

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉAccess to employee network groups - Connect with peers through our First Nations Reconciliation, LGBTQIA+, Multicultural, Gender, Early Careers, and accessibility groups.

‚Ä¢‚ÄÉPride in Diversity membership: We are proud members of Pride in Diversity and actively participate in the Australian Workplace Equality Index.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and supported. Join us and be part of a company that truly cares about its people and community!

How to Apply

To apply for this role at #boqgroup #retailbanking, follow the links or apply via our Careers Page.

BOQ Group is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.

We celebrate, value and include people of all backgrounds, gender and expressions, sexualities, cultures, bodies and abilities. When you apply, you are welcome to tell us the pronouns you use and please let us know any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

If you are successful for a role with BOQ Group, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. Please no agency applications.

title: IT Systems Administrator
description:
IT Systems Administrator

Medcan Group is an Australian leader in the medicinal cannabis industry and have been at the forefront of medicinal cannabis cultivation, research and education in Australia since 2016. From commencement, Medcan Group has experienced significant growth and is forecasted to continue to grow and expand further into the Australian and overseas market.

Medcan Group‚Äôs success is not only due to its development and delivery of quality products and service, and our dedicated staff, but also being a values-based patient health outcome centred company. Due to the company‚Äôs growth, we have an exciting opportunity for a proactive, skills and enthusiastic System Administrator. career.

About the Role

The System Administrator role reports directly into the IT Manager, and is primary focus is to support internet stakeholders by managing, maintaining, and supporting Medcan Group IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and systems. Setting up all new employees, exiting employees, troubleshooting and managing IT hardware assets. The role will also provide the successful incumbent the opportunity to either learn, improve or develop their DevOPs skills, as the role offers diversity across many IT functions.

Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ System administration

‚Ä¢ DevOps practices

‚Ä¢ Security compliance and company hardware asset management

‚Ä¢ Offer quality and valued services to internal stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Assist in development and projects across the IT function

‚Ä¢ Required to travel between our Sumner and Heathwood locations as well as support interstate employees and contractors

What we‚Äôre looking for‚Ä¶

Skills & Experience:

‚Ä¢ Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.

‚Ä¢ Minimum of 3 years of experience as a System Administrator, DevOps Engineer, or in a related IT role, demonstrating a solid understanding of systems administration and DevOps practices.

‚Ä¢ Skills in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Bash) and programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, C#) to support development and automation tasks.

‚Ä¢ Basic understanding of project management principles is beneficial, with the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively and work under tight deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience managing and maintaining IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and cloud environments.

Why Join Medcan Australia?

title: Systems Engineer - Multiple levels
description:
The Opportunity

We are seeking talented systems engineers to support the Battlespace Communication System (BCS) Program. BCS is a next generation networking product that is the centerpiece for multiple projects and campaigns. The BCS combines both developmental and off the shelf hardware and software to provide world leading communications capability for ADF personnel. It can be rapidly deployed from anywhere, and its modular design provides a flexible, scalable solution that can be customized for various mission needs.

We have a range of opportunities available as we plan for future work. These roles will see you applying your skills to either our core product for Army, upgrading the capability to integrate with related maritime communications projects, or modernization of the joint air battlespace management system.

Responsibilities

As a BCS Systems Engineer you will work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team charged with owning and delivering products to our customers across the full product lifecycle.¬† As a part of this team you will have an evolving set of responsibilities are the project progresses, including:

Championing understanding and analyzing customer requirements alongside the development of innovative solutions that ensure the full product lifecycle is optimized.
Coordinating with other design and specialty disciplines (e.g. software, hardware, safety, security and support system engineering) to ensure that your team's products are properly integrated into the solution and delivered in a way that delights the customer.
Working with the broader project team to ensure the engineering scope is delivered within the quality, schedule and budgetary constraints of the project
Development of engineering documentation and configuration management of system hardware infrastructure.
The ability to communicate and collaborate with a diverse team, in a conscientious and inclusive way.
Verifying and validating designs and products to ensure they meet operational and functional requirements

Experience/Qualifications

Essential:

Bachelor's Degree in an Engineering discipline, Information Technology related fields or equivalent industry experience.
Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.
We invite a diverse range of people to apply, including people from outside of the defence industry.

¬†Desirable:

Experience within Defence or complex engineering project environments is desirable.
Understanding of Systems Engineering principles and lifecycle management.
Experience developing and executing against Systems Engineering artefacts including Systems Engineering Management Plan and Verification and Validation Plan
Experience in technical problem solving
Experience with complex communications systems deployed in challenging environments
Experience in utilizing digital systems engineering tools including DOORS and CAMEO/Magic System of Systems Architect

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force.¬† As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests.¬† Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place.¬† From the seabed to outer space you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are core values.¬† We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth.¬† Find your future with us.

Benefits

Cutting edge projects
Flexible working options
Competitive remuneration and incentive plan available
Salary packaging options
Study assistance

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.¬† Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

¬†

title: Maintenance Specialist
description:
Kapsch TrafficCom Australia is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Tolling Maintenance Specialist to join our dynamic team in Bowen Hills, Brisbane. As a Tolling Maintenance Specialist, you will provide technical support and maintenance services for Tolling systems, ensuring their smooth operation and functionality by providing support to mechanical devices and systems, encompassing software-related assistance such as configuration, troubleshooting, and other aspects involved in supporting a computational system. This includes assisting in the resolution of any issues or malfunctions that may arise, performing troubleshooting, and implementing necessary repairs or adjustments to keep the systems running optimally. The candidate will have the opportunity to actively engage with emerging technologies and advancements in the field, staying up to date with the latest trends and innovations. This involvement in new technologies of the future presents a chance for professional growth and development, expanding their skillset and knowledge base to adapt to the evolving landscape of Tolling systems and Traffic.

This role involves 24 hour on-call duties¬†for up to 2 weeks¬†on a shared rotational roster, with additional overtime available.¬†- Potential to earn up to an additional 15% on your base salary with on call and overtime rates available. While prior IT knowledge is advantageous, you'll get all the training and support you need to get up to speed on the necessary tasks while enhancing your career and learning about electronic toll collection and traffic management systems. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to be a part of the company that delivers cutting-edge technologies such as connected vehicles, which is the first step to driverless cars in Australia

Your responsibilities

Maintenance and Support: Provide technical support and maintenance services for Tolling systems, including troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving issues, conducting repairs, and implementing system adjustments to ensure optimal functionality. Meet and exceed Service Level Agreements to guarantee high-quality service delivery.¬†

System Monitoring: Monitor Tolling systems, perform regular checks, and proactively identify potential problems or areas for improvement. Take appropriate action to address any issues, ensuring minimal disruption to operations and adhering to Service Level Agreements.

Technical Expertise: Develop a deep understanding of Tolling systems, including hardware, software, and network infrastructure. Stay updated with the latest industry trends, advancements, and emerging technologies relevant to Tolling operations. Apply technical expertise to effectively address maintenance and support needs.

Flexibility and Adaptability: Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability in handling various maintenance tasks, ranging from routine system checks to complex problem-solving. Willingly work on-call and during non-standard hours, when required, to ensure uninterrupted Tolling system operations.

Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including repairs, system modifications, and upgrades. Prepare detailed reports on system performance, issues encountered, and recommended solutions. Ensure timely documentation and reporting in accordance with organizational guidelines.

Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, technicians, and project managers, to coordinate maintenance activities, exchange technical knowledge, and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives. Communicate effectively to ensure efficient problem resolution and seamless workflow across departments.

Your profile

You are highly organized and motivated. You possess a keen eye for detail and able to use your out of the box thinking to solve complex technical issues.

This role will suit someone with:

Tertiary qualification in IT, Software Engineer or similar is preferred;

3+ years‚Äô experience in an IT customer service or technical role with a demonstrated ability and hands on experience configuring, managing and supporting computer systems;

Previous experience administering Windows Servers (2008-2019) and VMWare (physical and virtual servers);

title: DevOps Engineer
description:

Apply now to be part of a forward-thinking DevOps team!

title: Application Consultant
description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world‚Äôs manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility -¬†our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the¬†work we do changes the world for the better.

We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that‚Äôs you we would love to have you join us!

¬†

Job Description

When you join Rockwell Automation you become part of a diverse, inclusive and global community with experience with innovation and a place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people.

We know our employees are important to our success and future. You will develop a rewarding career is a top priority because when you succeed, we succeed.

You will be reporting to Application Consultant Manager, LCS SP based in Australia.

¬†

Role Summary

The Application Consultant resource engages with domain experts, sales, specialty sellers and customers presale to lead delivery engagements and better understand scope requirements. The resource is the proposal team's subject matter expert for the customer, sales organization, and Department and leads engagement requirements of related products and comprehensive delivery offerings from RA, partners, and competitors in designated focus areas.

The Application Consultant is a technical resource for Rockwell Automation technology, products, services, and solutions within the Process and Power & Control area(s) of expertise, Experience responding to prospect emails, phone calls, and demo requests capability, defining scope and benefits of portfolio to customers. They deliver and lead commercial offer, presales support, and is a trusted advisor to the sales organisation and channel. They are responsible for technical support in pre-sales activities and support bid offer activities for a specific range of products, services and solutions within a defined geography.

¬†

Your Responsibilities:

You will Lead scope definition, articulate differentiators and values versus competition for designated product, service or solution
You have Knowledge of the industry strategies, familiarity with outcome-based selling.
You will have experience in Drives systems within Heavy industry applications, such as cranes/hoists, paper machine, stacker/reclaimers, ship loaders, metal mills, etc.
Work with Sales, Consultants and Specialists to assess and respond to engineering, consulting, project and support services opportunities
Understand the customers need and be able to position and quote a desired outcome for a solution
Management of the process from Bid Request, Information gathering, Scope definition, Solution design and costing, and Approvals ‚Äì Collaborate with Sales, Solution Consultants, Sales Specialists, Engineering, Services, and your peer proposal teams regional/global.
Demonstrate the ability to expand the scope of solutions requested by incorporating the full portfolio of Rockwell Automation offerings, including: Process/Power & Control.
You will Make full use of Global estimating tools and Global Engineering Center Proposal resources
You can Advise Consultants or Sales on proposal generation, validation, and presentations for executive level customers
Share insights with peers.
Understand business models, organization, and go to market strategy, leverage
Knowledge of industry strategies, familiarity with outcome-based selling.
Somewhat faster-than-average pace will be the norm for this position

¬†

The Essentials - You Will Have:

Bachelor's degree in an engineering/technical related field or equivalent.
8+ years pre-sales, direct sales or consulting experience as an estimator, proposal engineer or other contract, project or application engineering focused position
You will have experience in Drives Systems
Demonstrated understanding of larger Rockwell Automation application value including knowledge in Automation products including PLC, Standard Drives, Software, Networks and knowledge of third party products
Good application and industry knowledge
Work well with both internal and external customers
You can provide solution and application expertise, and related demonstrated sales experience.
Fluency with native language and strong command of English (written & spoken).
You can work with and gain confidence of senior level personnel (internal and external) in a collaborative, matrixed partner organization.
Ability to align and influence critical stakeholders.
Passionate about developing goals to improve our customer experience.
You can set, being accountable for and achieve challenging targets.
You will empower, coach, and motivate others.
You will have Experience establishing communication and engagement with prospects and messaging to different audiences.

¬†

The Preferred - You Might Also Have:

Provide security in a stable work environment, allowing individual to plan for, focus on and complete tasks on hand
When changes in the nature of the work occur, you will receive direction, training and support.
You will generally be, requiring someone with a conservative, careful, and cautious approach to work

¬†

What We Offer:

Our benefits package includes ‚Ä¶

Comprehensive mindfulness programs with a premium membership to Calm
Volunteer Paid Time off available after 6 months of employment for eligible employees.
Company volunteer and donation matching program ‚Äì Your volunteer hours or personal cash donations to an eligible charity can be matched with a charitable donation.
Employee Assistance Program
Personalized wellbeing programs through our OnTrack program
On-demand digital course library for professional development

¬†

At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles.

¬†

Rockwell Automation‚Äôs hybrid policy aligns that employees are expected to work at a Rockwell location at least Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays unless they have a business obligation out of the office.

title: IT Infrastructure Officer (Engineer)
description:
IT Infrastructure Officer (Engineer)
Transformation, Assets & Information
Permanent Full Time
Hervey Bay
Stream A Level 6 - $96,171 per annum + superannuation

+ $6,000 relocation bonus (for suitable candidates)
+ 17.5% annual leave loading
+ 9-day fortnight

We are seeking a talented IT Infrastructure Engineer with a strong background across software engineering, infrastructure management, and/or cybersecurity.¬† This role will require onsite work in Hervey Bay (just 3 hours north from Brisbane).

The ideal candidate will have experience some or all of the below technologies:

AD Migrations & Network Management: Azure-focused, but AWS or Google Cloud experience is welcome.
Cloud Technology: Transitioning from on-premises to hybrid or full cloud environments.
Networking Fundamentals: Understanding DNS, PKI, and security management.
Virtualization Platforms: Proficiency with Hyper-V and VMware.
Automation & DevOps Tools: Hands-on experience with Ansible, Chef, Puppet, or similar technologies.
Cybersecurity Best Practices: Familiarity with NIST Security Standards and how cybersecurity is implemented and managed.
Adaptability & Aptitude: We value your eagerness to learn and master new skills as needed.

Find a copy of the position description here.

What your day will look like:

Review infrastructure health dashboards, overnight maintenance tasks, and incident tickets. Prioritize high-impact issues for immediate resolution.
Address complex infrastructure issues escalated from Tier 1 and Tier 2 teams. These might include server outages, storage failures, or virtualization problems.
Perform scheduled updates or upgrades to critical infrastructure components, such as servers, storage systems, or virtualization platforms, LAN and WAN devices.
Contribute to infrastructure planning and design, such as hybrid solutions from on-prem to cloud-based solutions, or enhancing disaster recovery capabilities.
Collaborate on projects like upgrading network infrastructure, implementing new technologies, or enhancing cybersecurity measures.
Ensure all infrastructure components are secure and compliant with government regulations. This involves patching systems, auditing configurations, and conducting security assessments.
Create or update comprehensive technical documentation, such as system configurations, disaster recovery procedures, and compliance checklists.
Update network diagrams, configuration files, and incident reports.

What you'll need for success:

Great communication skills and ability to support and train people on technical issues at all levels of the organisation.
Experience identifying and resolving information technology related problems, including excellent analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills.
Technical skills in a Windows environment, including hardware, software and peripheral devices.
Motivation to provide excellent customer service.
Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as within a team environment.

Apply now:

Applications close: 11pm Monday 31 March.

For further details, please contact Campbell Gunn on 07 4197 4642.

Before starting your application, please ensure your cover letter outlining your suitability for the role and resume are complete in doc, docx or pdf format. ¬†PDF format is preferred. ¬†

title: Senior Avionics Engineer
description:
The opportunity

The Boeing MQ28 - Ghost Bat is a globally-significant program that will deliver a disruptive advantage to support Defence operational capabilities. Developed in partnership with the Royal Australian Air Force, it is the first military combat aircraft to be designed, manufactured and assembled in Australia in 50 years.

Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) are seeking a Senior Avionics Engineer to join the MQ-28 Integrated Test Team to support the development, upgrade and in-service support of the MQ-28 Ghost Bat air vehicle and related test equipment.

¬†The role is based in RAAF Base Amberley but may also be performed in Brisbane.

As a Senior Avionics Engineer you will:

Collaboratively investigate and disposition problem reports generated from ground and flight testing.
Lead the design development of minor air vehicle modifications and repairs.
Develop air vehicle upgrades and modification kits through collaboration with design and maintenance teams.
Lead and develop engineering documentation (e.g. instructions, manuals, procedures and risk assessments) to support the ongoing product operation and maintenance.
Support ground and flight test operations for the MQ-28 System.
Identify and implement product supportability opportunities.¬†

To be considered for the role you will have:

Minimum of 7 years' experience in electrical design, modification or support activities.
Hold Tertiary qualifications in either Avionics, Electrical or Mechatronics, that satisfies the requirements for membership with Engineers Australia (MIEAust).
Demonstrated experience with the design, upgrade or support of air vehicle electrical systems or support & test equipment.
Familiarity with engineering change processes (highly regarded).
Experience developing engineering artefacts within the Defence Aviation Safety Regulation (DASR) environment (highly regarded).
Experience with UAV or Autonomous Systems projects (highly regarded).
Experience with 3D modelling and design tools (highly regarded).

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet Defence security requirements.


You may require a Foreign Work Authorisation (FWA) in order to perform this role. This is not a requirement set or determined by Boeing but by the Department of Defence under laws issued in 2024. Please refer to the Department of Defencewebsite to understand these requirements.


What's on offer?

Boeing values the health and wellbeing of our employees and offer true flexibility including working from home, compressed work weeks, and opportunities for part time arrangements, allowing you to balance your career with what is important to you outside of work.

Other benefits:

Work on cutting edge projects with opportunities to work across platforms.
Attractive remuneration and annual bonus.
Formal mentoring and training as well as on the job learning.
Formal reward and recognition program.
Access discounts for health insurance, travel and accommodation.
Paid study leave, paid parental leave and Defence leave.
Salary packaging options available.
Health and wellbeing benefits including annual flu vaccinations and Employee Assistance Program.
Social and community groups.

BDA works with strong links with our global Boeing community and we strongly encourage collaboration with our international counterparts.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and veterans are encouraged to apply.

If you are ready to join an innovative industry leader and would like to register your interest in working for Boeing, please click Apply Now.

¬†

title: Principal DevOps Engineer
description:
The Role:

As a Principal DevOps Engineer, you will be at the forefront of cloud infrastructure, automation, and CI/CD innovation. You will be responsible for designing, deploying, and optimizing enterprise-grade cloud environments, ensuring efficiency, security, and scalability. You will not only lead technically but also set DevOps strategy, influence key decisions, and guide teams in adopting best practices.

Key Responsibilities:
Architect and implement highly scalable AWS cloud environments, ensuring operational excellence and security.
Define and drive enterprise-wide DevOps strategies, establishing best practices across CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and automation.
Lead the development and optimization of CI/CD pipelines (GitLab, GitHub, Artifactory) to ensure smooth, automated deployments.
Oversee and refine Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions using Terraform, enabling scalable and automated cloud provisioning.
Champion containerization and orchestration using Kubernetes and Docker, optimizing application deployment.
Write and maintain production-grade automation code in Python, JavaScript, and Golang to streamline DevOps operations.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to define technical direction, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Serve as the go-to expert for DevOps architecture, cloud security, and infrastructure automation.
What We‚Äôre Looking For:
Extensive hands-on experience in AWS cloud architecture and automation.
Proven leadership in driving DevOps strategies at an enterprise level.
Expertise in designing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines‚Äîyou know what best practice looks like and can implement it at scale.
Strong coding abilities in Python, JavaScript, or Golang‚Äîthis is a hands-on role requiring technical depth.
Deep experience with Kubernetes and Docker, managing large-scale containerized applications.
Infrastructure-as-Code mastery with Terraform‚Äîyou‚Äôve built, deployed, and managed cloud environments with automation at the core.
Track record of working in complex, cross-functional environments, influencing key decisions, and driving DevOps maturity.
Bonus Points For:
Experience with Azure infrastructure in addition to AWS.
Proficiency with PostgreSQL and MySQL for database performance optimization.
Strong networking knowledge for designing and troubleshooting cloud environments.
Experience securing cloud applications using HashiCorp Vault and best-in-class security practices.
This is not a role for someone looking to maintain DevOps pipelines‚Äîthis is an opportunity to lead, transform, and elevate DevOps practices across a highly complex and mission-critical environment. If you are a DevOps thought leader with the expertise to shape the future of cloud and automation, we want to hear from you.

title: AI Safety Manager
description:
Brisbane / Sydney / Melbourne locations
Design and implement AI safety standards and guardrails
Enable AI safety practices across people, processes, and technology

As AI Safety Manager you will lead the development and implementation of AI guidelines that align with industry best practices and regulatory requirements while also supporting AI adoption and roadmaps. You will contribute to the ethical use of AI systems and models in accordance with data ethics principles, governance standards, and operational requirements. This leadership role provides an opportunity to drive innovation while safeguarding operational integrity in AI transformation initiatives.

What You‚Äôll Do

Operationalise guidelines for in-house AI models and third-party applications

Monitor and track AI use for compliance and prepare reports for senior management.

What You‚Äôll Bring

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, IT, or related field (advanced degree preferred)
Proven experience in AI governance, data governance, or related fields
Strong knowledge of AI models, data ethics, privacy laws, and regulatory standards
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills
Familiarity with AI/ML technologies and frameworks
Certifications in AI governance or data privacy (e.g., AIGP, CIPP) are a plus

What we can offer

A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave
Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as insurance products
Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave
Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs; and

Employee benefits | Suncorp Group

¬†

At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

¬†

If you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process or in the workplace, we encourage you to contact luke.morandini@suncorp.com.au for a confidential conversation.

title: Managing Principal ‚Äì Consultant
description:
About us:

We at IRIS are the specialists within Argon & Co, with deep expertise in data and AI for operations. Our services span data and AI advisory, advanced operations analytics, and AI applications, all underpinned by our innovation lab. We work together with clients to generate real change.

Our team has a proven track record of applying a mix of operational experience, data expertise, and broad business knowledge to design and implement robust solutions. Based in Australia, France, and the UK, we collaborate across Argon & Co offices globally.

We foster an inclusive culture driven by the diversity of our employees and flat structure management to encourage collaboration and contribution from the whole team.

About the role:

As a Managing Principal, you‚Äôll be at the helm of client engagements, overseeing transformative business improvement projects and delivering exceptional value. You‚Äôll guide multidisciplinary teams, foster strong client relationships, and play a pivotal role in growing IRIS's global reputation as a trusted partner for leaders focused on operational excellence.

Your expertise will help drive our annual revenue, while your strategic mindset will shape and deliver transformative Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning solutions across diverse industries. This role includes participation in Short-Term Incentive (STIP) and Long-Term Incentive (LTIP) programs, recognising your integral role in IRIS‚Äôs growth.

This role requires a willingness to travel across Australia.

.

What you‚Äôll do:

Lead teams on transformative projects, blending IRIS methodologies, AI/ML expertise, and business acumen.
Shape and lead large, complex AI/data transformation assignments across industries such as planning, logistics, procurement, and manufacturing.
Develop and deploy advanced AI/ML models, including large language models and computer vision applications.
Mentor and grow technical teams, ensuring the highest standards of delivery.
Build and manage a portfolio of high-value clients, driving repeat business and uncovering new opportunities.
Drive internal initiatives to enhance sustainability, innovation, and efficiency.

What you'll bring:

10+ years of experience in data science with 5+ years in production AI/ML applications.
Proven success in consulting, delivering and selling AI/data analytics solutions at a senior level.
Deep expertise in ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, and ML Operations.
Strong technical knowledge of Python, advanced analytics, and algorithm development.
A track record of winning high-value accounts, delivering innovative solutions, and shaping the future of AI.
A live network of senior contacts who value your expertise and insight.
Leadership qualities: collaborative, client-focused, and a skilled team mentor.
Demonstrable passion for sustainability, innovation, and making a positive impact.

What we offer:

Flexible annual leave: We are committed to support our employees‚Äô well-being and work-life balance. With flexible leave policies, we offer 25 days of annual leave, ensuring you have the time to recharge and explore.
15 days for you: Your time, your way. Flexible days you can use for career progression, personal development, business interest, charitable time or important one-off life activities.
Great performance bonus: Our bonus is linked to business and personal performance, both short and long term.
Learning is never ending: We believe it is essential to provide an environment in which our employees can continually develop and expand their capabilities. Through mentorship, leadership training, and development opportunities, we help our employees reach their fullest potential.
Global career journeys: Our International Mobility Program offers employees the chance to work and grow in diverse locations worldwide. Immerse yourself in new cultures, broaden your skillset, and build valuable relationships - all while advancing your career with exciting international experiences.
Paid parental leave: We support our employees at every stage of life, with generous parental leave policies and flexible working options, so you can thrive both professionally and personally.
Team development days: Each year we aim to invest up to 15 days in developing employees and the business. These team sessions are all about training, team bonding, and knowledge sharing.
Corporate sponsored monthly, quarterly and end of year team social events: A mixture of fun and charitable work.

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to equity, diversity, and social inclusion. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people with disabilities, and women to apply.

For further information or to request any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process please contact careers.australia@argonandco.com.

title: Aerospace Engineers
description:
Tell me about this role:

We are currently looking for security cleared (Baseline or higher) Aerospace Engineers to join our team on a permanent basis. No two days are the same in these roles which are essential to the success of the project. We are looking for multi-skilled, flexible, hardworking people who are keen to grow their career within a leading Defence supplier.
¬†¬†
These roles will see you take on a range of tasks including providing expert engineering advice, designing and conducting test activities and reviewing and producing engineering documents to support major Defence platforms including Blackhawk, Apache, Chinook and a range of Unmanned Aerial Systems.
¬†¬†
Sought after skillsets include but are not limited to: Systems Engineering, Avionics Design Engineers, Aerospace Engineers, Systems Safety Engineers, ILS Engineers and Certification Engineers.¬†
¬†¬†
This role offers uncapped training and development opportunities as well as other benefits including free parking, flexible working and different leave arrangements including paid parental, study, reserve and volunteer leave.¬†

What will I be doing day to day?

Designing and conducting engineering activities
Requirements analysis and definition
Data management and analysis
Work with a wide range of stakeholders and build meaningful and lasting professional relationships
Managing engineering documentation including review and edits
Providing expert engineering inputs into cutting edge technology¬†¬†
What sort of skills do I need?

Experience within a Defence Aerospace environment
Bachelors degree in Engineering
Firm understanding of DASR (desirable)
Experience with working in a CASG environment (desirable)
Strong communication skills
Process orientated with good attention to detail¬†
Hold a minimum Baseline security clearance (must be an Australian citizen)¬†
What‚Äôs in it for me?

Flexibility - We like our employees to have the flexibility they need to live the lives they choose. With flexible working options such as a 9-day fortnight and remote working options.
Inclusion - We like our employees to feel safe bringing their whole self to work offering a number of programs promoting inclusion such as public holiday swap and 40/40/20, our vision for a gender inclusive workplace.
Benefits and Rewards - We have a competitive package of benefits and rewards including additional superannuation; flexible leave options; salary continuation insurance; professional certification bonus; employee discount program.
Exciting work ‚Äì Amentum is continually expanding our opportunities working on prominent Defence projects across air, land and sea supporting the critical capabilities that keep Australia safe. We have a growing presence in cyber, space and nuclear programs.
¬†¬†
Why Amentum?
A trusted partner to Australian Government clients, Amentum is a major service provider for some of the most critical national security capabilities. We manage critical infrastructure and facilities and work on major projects in the land, air, maritime, cyber, space, nuclear and digital domains to support the Department of Defence‚Äôs multi-billion-dollar investment in enhanced capabilities.

With more than 880 engineers, project and program managers, training specialists, cyber security consultants, facilities operations experts, essential workers, logistics and technical trades in Canberra, Sydney, Melbourne, south-east Queensland, Central Australia, Townsville, Adelaide, Perth, Newcastle and Nowra, the business has built a reputation for excellence in quality, performance, innovation, value for money and safety by delivering multi-disciplinary expertise on large and technically challenging projects for more than 27 years.

People are our greatest asset and we value unique backgrounds, experience and perspectives.¬† Without our people we would not be where we are today, we therefore value our team as members of an exceptional organisation offering a wide array of benefits that go far beyond expectations.

Apply today to become a member and experience the many benefits and rewards that help us advance the future together.

Recruitment selection for these positions will commence immediately. To apply for this role click ‚Äúapply now‚Äù or for further information please contact Jeremy Parkinson, jeremy.parkinson@global.amentum.com.

title: Backend Software Engineer - Gen AI, Design Generation Experience (open remote
description:
Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g‚Äôday, mabuhay, kia ora, ‰Ω†Â•Ω, hallo, v√≠tejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time-consuming and you‚Äôre probably keen to find out what‚Äôs on offer, so we‚Äôll get straight to the point.

Where and how you can work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work‚Äîwe trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

What you‚Äôd be doing in this role

As Canva scales, change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that‚Äôs all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you‚Äôll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

Building systems to generate and edit designs, working closely with ML engineers, backend engineers, frontend engineers, designers, and PMs
Owning the full lifecycle of features from design docs and stakeholder alignment through implementation, testing, and maintenance
Staying across state-of-the-art advancements in deep learning and generative AI
Facilitating knowledge sharing and advocating for engineering needs with non-technical stakeholders
Modelling initiative and ownership in achieving goals and improving processes
Identifying cross-team collaboration opportunities to deliver new ideas and improvements

You‚Äôre probably a match if:

You have a strong interest in deep learning, generative AI, and solving real design generation challenges
You bring commercial experience in backend software development (Java or similar OO language)
You‚Äôre passionate about the intersection of design and engineering
You‚Äôre grounded in CS fundamentals‚Äîconcurrency, multithreading, data structures, system design
You collaborate well with others and communicate effectively
You‚Äôre curious and love learning and sharing new knowledge

About the team

The Generative Experience Group is on a mission to ‚ÄúEmpower the world to design by developing and applying AI that can create every type of design and ingredient on Canva.‚Äù

We‚Äôre at the frontier of Canva‚Äôs most cutting-edge AI tech‚Äîwhere research meets product impact. From building prototypes to launching new design generation candidates, we‚Äôre creating magical, emotionally engaging AI experiences that charm users and simplify complex tasks.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard‚Äîand we do‚Äîbut you‚Äôll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva. We also offer a range of benefits to support your success in and outside of work:

Equity packages ‚Äì we want our success to be yours too
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
Annual Vibe & Thrive allowance for wellbeing, social connection, home office & more
Flexible leave options that let you recharge, give back, and support what matters most to you

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion‚Äîas well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva. Even if you don‚Äôt feel like your skills perfectly match what‚Äôs listed above‚Äîwe still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Typescript/React/Node/AWS)
description:
The Squiz product team is working to deliver a cloud-based Digital Experience Platform (DXP) with several core capabilities including Content Management, Optimisation tooling, and Platform services.

We're seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our product engineering team on a permanent basis, with a focus on improving capability across various parts of the DXP. If of interested in getting exposure to AI and you have a desire to learn and work with some impressive engineers in this space we have a few roles in this space also.

We‚Äôre location-flexible!¬† This role is open to all candidates on the east coast of Australia.

This role is hybrid, allowing you to work where and when works best for you.

For this role, we ask that you can demonstrate the following experience:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience in related fields
5+ years of professional hands-on experience in software development building and maintaining large-scale software products
Proficiency in full-stack development, with expertise in web based languages and frameworks including Node, TypeScript, React or similar, and cloud platforms such as AWS
Strong understanding of testing principles and demonstrated experience in implementing testing strategies to improve software quality and robustness
Experience with Agile or other iterative development methodologies. We use Scrum for most of the teams, with some using Kanban
Strong understanding of secure coding practices, particularly community standards such as OWASP
Previous experience mentoring junior and mid level software engineers

Nice to have

Previous experience working on DXP or CMS platforms, or experience integrating or using DXP/CMS platforms
Previous experience creating or maintaining site builders, page builders or WYSIWYG interfaces

¬†What you would do (the role day to day):¬†

Work within a team of 3-5 software engineers to help build our Digital Experience Platform. Each team consists of a Team Lead, and 3 or 4 software engineers at different levels - junior, mid and senior
Develop/enhance robust application code which meets all technical requirements
Collaborate with team members to generate User Stories, Acceptance Criteria and estimates
Provide guidance to junior engineers and assistance to senior engineers
Write and maintain software documentation
Assist Team Leads and Engineering Managers to create and deliver technical roadmaps
Lead best practices in software development, code quality, and architecture across our tech stack within your team - Node, TypeScript, React, AWS, Cloudflare, GitLab CI/CD

Why work for Squiz?¬†

You‚Äôll work with some of the most intelligent and down to earth people you‚Äôve ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate professionals who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we all love what we do.

We have a lived commitment to flexibility, we know the success of our people is dependent on them having a balanced life. You will be offered flexibility as to where and how you work every day. We want you to be able to work in a way that drives productivity, efficiency and outcomes; along with connection and collaboration.

Who we are:¬†

Squiz helps complex, service-led organisations harness the power of digital, improving the services they offer online.¬†

Founded in 1998, Squiz grew during the rise of the internet. Since then, we have evolved from a simple web content management system into a full digital experience platform (DXP), helping customers make the shift from being content managers to experience creators.

The Squiz DXP brings together content, search, data and applications in one place. To get the most out of the platform, customers can collaborate with our digital experts to design solutions and adapt as demands change.¬†¬†

We are headquartered in Australia, with teams and customers across the globe, and offices in New Zealand, the United States, the United Kingdom and Poland.

Come as you are - We celebrate diversity and unite on the elements of our company DNA, starting every customer conversation with ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù to really understand their needs, working hard to find a way to overcome every challenge, and fighting for better outcomes with the work we do. We also check our egos at door, we don‚Äôt take ourselves too seriously and we have fun along the way.

We understand the effort it takes to apply for a role. We are committed to respond to each and every applicant, successful or not.

Recruitment Agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Squiz is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
About Megaport

Megaport has transformed the way IT gets connected. We're global leaders in Network as a Service (NaaS), changing the way businesses reach the cloud. We're also a leading partner to Amazon, Microsoft, Google, IBM, Oracle, NYSE, and many other leading technology companies. Megaport is a publicly traded company on the Australian Stock Exchange. We‚Äôre a lean, high-achieving team made up of over 300 members globally. While the company is headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, employees are spread out across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. Staff enjoy an environment that is collaborative, supportive, and fun.

Our Team Culture

Join a team of globally-positioned industry experts that lead by example. We do not compromise our values for commercial gain; we are all custodians of our culture, and the customer is at the centre of everything we do. Our employees are motivated, adaptable, persistent, hard-working, and dynamic. Our culture permeates everything we do and this, in turn with a global vision, forms a commitment to each other, our customers, and shareholders alike.

The Role

You‚Äôre a software engineer who is well respected by your peers, and collaborates and communicates effectively. You are familiar with Spring and enjoy taking ownership over a product. That means, paying down technical debt, thinking of the users (internal and external), and solving interesting technical problems. Our main code base is in Java / Spring MVC but we‚Äôre actively moving to Kotlin / Spring Boot. We‚Äôre a tech company, our product is in the technical space and we need great engineers to make a great product! Interest in advanced networking is a bonus!

#LI-DNI

If you have any questions, please reach out to Megaport's Talent Acquisition Team at careers@megaport.com

NOTE: All Megaport business correspondence is conducted via our business email accounts (@megaport.com). If you have any concerns, please reach out to Megaport's careers team careers@megaport.com directly and we will verify the legitimacy of any communication. Megaport will not ask you to create an account via Microsoft teams, and does not associate with any email accounts under "@megaportau.com".

All applications will be treated in confidence.

Please see Part 2 of our Privacy Policy to see what information Megaport collects from job applicants, why, and how we store and use it. Note that you‚Äôre entitled to know what personal data of yours Megaport holds, to request updates, rectification, and in some circumstances restriction or deletion thereof if you object (you being entitled to withdraw your consent to our holding your information at any time). Please see Part 5 of our Privacy Policy for more details on this and how to contact Megaport's data protection officer if you have any further privacy-related questions. Candidates who meet the selection criteria will be invited to attend an interview. Strictly no Recruitment Agencies.
